title: VP & Senior Director, Strategy & Transformation - GRS Tech
description:
**Pay Philosophy**
The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.

 **Description**The **VP/Sr Dir of Strategy & Transformation** is responsible for establishing the global strategy and vision for a digitized global GRS organization. Leads a team of creative thinkers that will help establish a consistent, transparent, and efficient approach to the way the technology organization delivers value to the business. Supports and improves the GRS organizational governance and planning process, enables improved workforce management for technology leaders, supports pre-negotiation and day one mergers and acquisitions, improves tooling and reporting on initiatives to the GRS and Technology organization. Technology Strategy, Portfolio and Workforce management, Mergers and Acquisitions and organizational projects teams.

  

The ideal candidate for this role has broad strategic thinking and storytelling capabilities, the ability to effectively influence and collaborate across the organization, experience working with diverse teams around the globe, and strong financial and business acumen.

  



**About the role:**

  

* Delivers thought leadership and strategic guidance on the topics of operational excellence including financial management, strategic vendor partnerships, agile maturity, integration and cross-product area efforts to help senior leaders make better decisions and work more efficiently.
* Acts as interlock with Finance and Talent teams to establish a rhythm to implement budget levers, headcount and vendor management processes in conjunction with the platform leaders and GRS COO organization.
* Leads strategic planning activities and end-to-end development of strategies and initiatives to transform and enable a global technology operating model for GRS in collaboration with the GRS CIO, platform leaders, and GRS operations organization.
* Facilitate and enhance governance, planning and reporting processes for strategic priorities and ensures Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) are clearly defined and measured regularly. Monitors progress against strategic priorities to identify issues and mitigate risks. Provides guidance in creation of construction of business case, OKRs and KPIs, external benchmarking, and other topics related to global capabilities and advancements of strategic imperatives.
* Drives strong value creation for GRS engages with key cross-functional senior leaders often, advocating for the team’s work and influencing significant change.
* Support the development of all executive presentations for the GRS Tech LT – this includes structuring, storyboarding, and working across the organization; ensuring the broader connection and consistency across the organization; and developing supporting materials needed to effectively communicate key messages.
* Manages GRS Technology operational processes and practices for the technology organization, including assessing and transforming operational work practices and leading changes or modifications to operating and organizational models.
* Leads the GRS Tech Project Management office to include building and embedding global project management processes and procedures across the global technology organization.

**Qualifications*** Advanced knowledge of IT concepts, strategies and methodologies as typically acquired through a bachelor’s or advanced degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical discipline and 10 or more years of experience managing a technology organization.
* Strong attention to detail, highly entrepreneurial, creative, open-minded, persistent, highly collaborative and passion for driving business results.
* Experience in a strategy/advisory role in a large/global organization.
* Effective communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
* Developed analytical, problem solving and quantitative modeling skills.
* Expertise includes process excellence, Financial IT systems.
* Experience with Shared Services or Global Business Services.
* Ability to think strategically to solve complex problems.

**About Us**
At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.  

  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New Graduates as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits  

  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

title: Vice President of Information Technology
description:
**Job description:**

* We are looking for a Vice President of IT to join a growing and upcoming financial services company. The VP of IT will join a small team and will be responsible for the strategy, deployment and operational support of the technical environment. As part of a growing company, this person will “wear many hats”, they will be part of strategy/leadership, but will also be hands on with managing projects.
* The ideal candidate will have experience in the evaluation and selection of software/SaaS solutions that support cross functional areas such as accounting, retail and finance. Additional experience with leasing, wholesale and retail software/infrastructure solutions is highly desirable. Experience with the product Solifi is desirable.

**Responsibilities include:**  
1) Project Management – will be responsible for managing a variety of technical services providers, vendors, etc. Must be able to manage project portfolios, timelines, milestones and provide status updates to stakeholders.  
2) Will drive the overall IT strategy for the enterprise, systems implementation, and system certification.  
Primary responsibility of Vice President/Assistant VP of Information Technology is to plan, organize, manage and lead digital transformation initiatives/ projects to optimize efficient and effective use of technology, promote and facilitate automation for improving operational performance and driving growth. Act as a champion and a thought leader across the organization with strong understanding of financial/ leasing operations to maximize efficiency and effectiveness of the operations through digital transformation.  
**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

* **Strategic Leadership for Digital Transformation**
* Identify and evaluate opportunities for automation across various business functions.
* Assess current software applications, systems and IT infrastructure to identify areas for optimization.
* Collaborate with business unites/ departments to understand work flow, requirements, challenges, and business needs.
* Develop comprehensive digital transformation strategies aligned with organizational goals and objectives and lead implementation that support business growth.
* Lead initiatives to upgrade and enhance software systems, ensuring they align with business requirements.
* Lead the integration of IT systems, applications and platforms with the affiliate companies to streamline business process.
* Oversee data management practices and design the program and process to extract data from various sources and transform them into robust reporting solutions to generate analytical insights and support strategic decision making.
* Design and implement a scalable and efficient reporting architecture to meet the evolving needs of the organization.
* Implement and enforce data security measures to protect sensitive information in accordance with applicable regulation and industry best practices.
* Work cross-organizationally to design, implement, and drive adoption of new technologies, and maintain automated solutions for improved efficiency and productivity.
* Collaborate with business units/ departments to integrate technology solutions seamlessly into existing business processes.
* Initiate collaboration with business unites, stakeholders and internal customers focused to drive transformational change and business optimization through process redesign and automation technologies.
* Develop and direct development of IT project schedules, critical deliverables, budget, resource allocation plan, and other support requirements for the IT project or program releases, ensuring compliance with budget and key milestone.
* Supervising IT Department Personnel
* Supervise and monitor IT department personnel work assignments, work schedule, work flow, productivity, performance and quality control & assurance, and compliance in company’s procedures/ polices.
* Assess employee’s job performance and conformance to quality standards and proper procedures, and initiate trainings to correct errors or problems, conducting performance evaluation.
* Provide coaching, counseling, and guidance to IT group members in handling difficult or complex issues.
* Work with senior management for human resources management responsibilities to include: recruiting, performance reviews, progressive discipline issues (counseling, oral, and written warnings), and terminations as necessary.
* Ensure that all of the Company’s operations are complied with all government regulations and company policies/ procedures within own responsibilities.

**Other responsibilities and expectations**

* Stay abreast of emerging technologies, industry/ market trend and best practices and regulatory compliance, evaluating their potential for integration into the organization.
* Maintain complete and open lines of communication with other personnel, function, or department to facilitate operations and interaction in the organization.
* Keep Management informed of status and progress, ensuring that regular and periodical communication takes place.
* Maintain professional conduct, attendance, and high ethical standards in the work place, complying company’s policies and procedures.
* Perform other duties and responsibilities as required or requested by Management.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:** Entire IT department (with several direct reports- less than 5)  
**Education & Experience (Guideline)**  
The following descriptions are guideline and equivalent combination of education, experience and certifications will suffice the qualifications of the position.  
1) Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.  
2) Experience: Minimum 10 years of hands-on experience in a senior leadership role with a focus on digital transformation, automation and software optimization. Strong background in managing complex IT projects and initiatives.  
3) Certification: Relevant certifications in digital transformation, project management or related fields, a plus  
**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* In-depth and comprehensive knowledge of digital transformation methodologies and best practices, IT system integration, automation tools, software.
* Familiarity with project management methodologies.
* Well-developed interpersonal skills (both oral and written) with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization with sensitivity to cultural diversity. Being approachable and establishing a rapport with people in the company regardless of the departments.
* Strong ability to lead change, managing the expectations and reactions from people and impact on processes.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, continuously challenging the status quo.
* High level of commitment to anticipating, understanding and meeting the organizational needs and success.

Job Type: Permanent

Experience:

* Digital transformation: 10 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: VP, Consulting - Virtual
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
Diversified continues to expand our thought leadership team to grow our Consulting practice further, encompassing a larger focus across our company’s business units of Media and Workplace with the addition of a Vice President of Consulting.
  
We are seeking a Vice President of Consulting, to spearhead our Consulting practice across Media and Workplace verticals. This executive role is pivotal in leading a team of consultants and subject matter experts, driving excellence in thought leadership, customer service, and business acumen. The Vice President, Consulting, will be instrumental in shaping the strategic direction of the consulting division, ensuring the delivery of high-value, outcome focused solutions to our clients, and fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration.
  
The Consulting team is staffed with, among other roles, Principal Consultants across multiple disciplines inclusive of transformation efforts, Media supply chain initiatives, and Experiential Workplace solutions. These consultants serve as lead advisors for key/enterprise clients and strategic projects. The VP of Consulting is responsible, at an executive level, for the overarching deliverables supporting the decisions and recommendations made within the team, inclusive of the team itself and their activities.
  
What will you be doing?
  
* The VP of Consulting is a senior leadr within the Consulting staff and offers top down expertise, resources, and guidance to help our clients succeed in their industry. As a VP of Consulting, you may specialize in a variety of technologies/practice areas, and your duties include:
* Provide visionary leadership for the Consulting practice, setting strategic goals and driving business growth across Media and Workplace sectors.
* Lead, mentor, and expand a team of consultants and subject matter experts, fostering an environment of professional development and excellence.
* Oversee the sales process, from lead generation to deal closure, ensuring a high standard of customer service and satisfaction.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients and business partners, understanding their business needs and delivering tailored consulting solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the integration of consulting services with One Diversified's broader offerings.
* Drive thought leadership in the industry, representing the company at conferences, panels, and networking events.
* Ensure the consulting practice's offerings remain at the forefront of industry trends and technological advancements.
* Report to the Senior Vice President of Consulting, providing regular updates on practice performance, market opportunities, and strategic initiatives.


You should expect to work, both in a leadership and supporting function, on several projects across multiple clients as you immerse yourself in their business imperatives and processes, advise on business strategy and tactics, and provide vision and direction for the team.
  
You are responsible for the leadership and ultimate execution of the engagement deliverables, which will follow Diversified’s highest standards for quality and presentation with C-Level caliber collateral.
  
Ideally, You will maintain a subject matter expert role versed in a variety of technologies, including intimate knowledge of vendor product offerings, and a firm perspective on the competitive landscape. Additionally, you will serve as an industry evangelist representing Diversified at global technology conferences, customer engagements and publications in both print and online.
  
  

**Other duties will include:**  

* Develop deep working relationships with Senior Executives and Senior Managers across the client account teams.
* Understand the business direction of clients, Building knowledge capital through research and development, leveraging industry insights to deliver best of breed solutions to clients.
* Helping grow consulting Globally through thought leadership and entrepreneurialism.
* Function as the main contact between Diversified and client from beginning to end of a project/engagement ensuring the team meets the client's needs.
* Develop relationships throughout the customer's organization to identify new business opportunities.
* Participate with Sales during the sales process through scoping workshops, presentations, solutions, development of SOW's.
* Provide the bridge between Sales and Professional Services as new opportunities are closed.
* Create an environment where others feel it is safe to be open and candid, and where conflicting ideas and opinions are regularly discussed.
* Participate in projects involving strategy, implementation support, and optimization related to digital solutions media supply chain.
* Responsible to collaborate on the creation of project deliverables inclusive of the recommendations of technology, Bills of Materials, design concepts and deployment strategies, and quoting and support in vendor negotiations


**Complexity:**  

Highly Complex; The Principal Consultant needs to be able to assimilate complex areas of technology to conceptualize and communicate these to customers at the highest level.
  
  

**Decision Making Authority:**  

The Principal Consultant role reports to the Head of the Consulting department and will direct teams of other consultants, solutions architects along with vendors and customers throughout an engagement lifecycle. They will work with the Diversified account executives to make informed business decisions that will benefit the customer’s desired outcome.
  
  

**Physical Working Environment:**  

Limited physical labor required; most work will be performed on a computer. Remote or On-Site. Up to 50% travel may be expected.
  
What do we require from you?
  
  

**Education/Certifications:**  

* 4-year degree in a relevant business / technology field of study or equivalent experience.
* Experienced with technology and business operations and strategies relevant to the production, processing and distribution of audiovisual content for a variety of industries, including media, financial, retail, etc.


**Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience and Skills:**  

* You are an undisputed expert in your field(s) of technology and business, with 10+ years of experience as a solutions architect/engineer and trusted customer advisor.
* Your educational and professional background is varied and multifaceted and has equipped you with a broad perspective on business and technology, rooted in practical work as an engineer, solution sales professional, or other customer-facing roles.
* You are skilled at problem-solving, identifying issues, and conceptualizing solutions and you’re able to articulate a clear roadmap for implementing those solutions.
* As a Principal Consultant, you may be responsible for multiple projects at the same time, so it is necessary to have strong organizational skills that enable you to manage your time and responsibilities effectively and efficiently. Your organizational skills will also be required to keep track of client information, project details and other important data.
* You are able to manage time to plan and execute tasks effectively and efficiently within a set time frame for yourself and others to manage your own workload and that of your team members, ensuring that tasks are completed on time.
* You are trained, certified or deeply experienced in working with many of the following platforms: Platforms for compute, storage, orchestration and media processing, including AWS, Azure, Google, SAN/NAS, Object Storage (cloud/remote/on-premises), transcoding (Vantage, Elemental), MAMs (Iconik, CatDV, Dalet Flex, Vidispine, Avid MediaCentral/Interplay), Editorial, (Avid, Adobe, Apple, DaVinci), Cloud/hybrid Workflow, Remote workflow (Teradici, BeBop, etc.) and Virtualization Platforms (VMWare ESXi), as well as other media-related systems and solutions
* You have an in-depth understanding of media production, processing and distribution workflows for both live and fille-based content.
* You have excellent communication skills to both listen, understand, and convey important and complex technical information to clients, other consultants and other professionals.
* You are able to communicate effectively with vendors and manufacturers about RFQ technology, pricing and terms.
* You are a highly self-motivated self-starter who can operate independently as well as collaboratively with other Diversified team members to multi-task in an energetic environment.
* Must have the ability to communicate confidently with customers on a 1-on-1 and group setting.
* Must be willing to travel and able to work in a light industrial environment.
* Demonstrated ability to carry out consulting activities, methodologies leading to comprehensive discovery, analysis and technical/business recommendations.
* Advanced communication skills, including business/technical writing and presentations.
* Advanced ability to present in-depth technical solutions
* Self-motivation with the ability to motivate and energize a project team
* Demonstrate ability to work successfully at all customer levels from C-level executives to end users
* Thoughtful leadership and innovative thinking.


To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.

title: Director
description:
**Summary:**


The Director, IT Product Mgmt is responsible for the strategic Product vision and implementation of the Product strategy. The IT Product Management (Mgmt) Director will work closely with Product Managers, Engineering leadership and Business leadership to create and execute on roadmaps that enable the Business to meet their strategic, often revenue-based, goals. This role will foster effective cross-team collaboration, lead leaders and individual contributors (virtually and directly) and enable efficient delivery of product enhancements using agile methodologies with the goal of improving the overall customer and team member experiences and efficiencies.

**Essential Job Functions:**

* Owns the vision and roadmap for one or more Products.
* Is accountable for the overall go to market plan, including the revenue forecasts, adoption goals, pricing, and partner/ecosystem strategies.
* Build compelling marketing content such as case studies, whitepapers, presentations, etc. to showcase customer value, competitive differentiation.
* Identify and coordinate the interdependencies among owned products and other important strategic initiatives across an organization.
* Has a proven ability to think strategically (overall product roadmap) while being able to be hands-on (can write detailed product roadmaps).
* Create effective mechanisms to prioritize initiatives and develop product requirements for different initiatives, working backwards from the business and/or customer.
* Clearly define KPIs to measure success of different initiatives and track/report on them throughout the lifecycle of the product.
* Develops a comprehensive point of view on industry trends and the broader market and competitive landscape.
* Collaborates with wider team on project milestones and provides organizational management and stakeholder with relevant updates.
* Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**

This position has direct reports.

**Qualifications:**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

**Other Related Duties:**

Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Physical Demands**:


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

**Work Environment:**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Work is normally performed in a typical interior office work environment which does not subject the employee to any hazardous or unpleasant elements. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

**Equal Employment Opportunity:**


Freedom Mortgage is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, religion, national origin, age (40 and over), disability, military status, genetic information or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

**Americans with Disabilities Act:**


Applicants as well as employees who are or become disabled must be able to satisfactorily perform the essential job functions of the position either with or without reasonable accommodation. Applicants as well as employees are encouraged to meet with Human Resources as the organization shall review reasonable accommodations on a case-by-case basis in accordance with applicable law.

**Job Responsibilities:**


The statements reflect the general duties and responsibilities considered necessary to perform the essential functions of the job and should not be considered as an all-inclusive list of all the work requirements of the position. Freedom Mortgage Corporation may change the specific job duties with or without prior notice based on the needs of the organization.


  

Remote

title: Director, Information Security
description:
**Director, Information Security**


**New York, NY or Columbus, OH strongly preferred**


**Remote, US welcome to apply**

  


**ABOUT BARK**

  



Here at BARK, we love dogs and their people. We're looking to make all dogs happy throughout the entire world (we're not kidding). Think Disney for dogs - we make magic for dogs and their people through our products, events, and experiences.
  

  

Our ambition level is high, the opportunity is huge, and our love for dogs is through the roof! We launched in 2011 with BarkBox, a monthly-themed subscription of all-natural treats and clever toys. Since then, we've shipped more than 70 million toys and treats to the dogs across the world and use all of that direct customer feedback to inform new initiatives and ways to make magic between dogs and their people. We've since expanded into other offerings as well, as we aim to become THE Dog Company for every family with a four-legged, belly-scratch-loving, interspecies family member.

  


**THE TEAM**



BARK's InfoSec Team manages risk and protects company assets through the assessment of risk, monitoring of vulnerabilities, and collaborating cross-functionally to reduce risk. We provide internal security engineering skills to protect current and future systems by using specialized toolsets and methods to identify vulnerabilities. We work with teams to find the optimum solution that reduces risk without impacting system security or performance.


**WHO WE'RE SNIFFIN' FOR**



We are looking for a dynamic and highly motivated InfoSec/Cybersecurity expert to join our team. The ideal candidate is a resourceful problem solver who will take ownership of critical security related work. The Director of InfoSec will report directly to the CFO and work closely with the People, Technology and Legal teams to create solutions that balance business requirements with information and cyber security requirements.


**KEY DUTIES**


* Identify and communicate current and emerging security threats
* Create solutions that balance business requirements with information and cyber security requirements
* Align standards, frameworks and security with overall business and technology strategy and objectives
* Validate reference architectures for security best practices and recommend changes to enhance security and reduce risk, where applicable
* Train end users and technical staff in the implementation, use and/or remediation of systems
* Work with General Counsel to develop policies and processes that comply with state and federal law, including incident response and data retention
* Support PCI and SOX initiatives, internal technology audits, and GDPR/CCPA initiatives
* Responsible for maintaining security and intrusion detection across infrastructure and home grown applications
* Maintain and update the target architecture for information security at BARK; continually update and maintain the security roadmap and track progress year over year
* Work with product owners to influence their products and roadmaps to ensure alignment with target architecture and vision
* Create and maintain security architecture artifacts (i.e. models, patterns, templates, etc) that can be used (and reused) to leverage security capabilities
* Create, communicate and maintain a cyber security training and awareness program for all employees at BARK.
* Manage and develop one direct team member, as well managing within financial budget


**EXPERIENCE**


#### **A diverse technical background with 10+ years' experience in:**


* Security architecture, demonstrating solutions delivery, principles and emerging technologies - Designing and implementing security solutions. This includes continuous monitoring and making improvements to those solutions.
* Consulting and engineering in the development and design of security best practices and implementation of solid security principles across the organization, to meet business goals and legal/regulatory requirements.
* Security considerations of cloud computing: including data breaches, incident response, hacking, account hijacking, insider threats, third party/vendors, data loss, DoS attacks and cloud based application delivery.
* Identity and access management - including SSO, employee remote access, third party access and device management.
* Network security - including firewalls, AWS VPC security, multi-site WAN and WIFI security.
* Encryption standards and implementation
* Prefer public company experience including knowledge of SOX


**SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS**


* Strong critical thinking and analytical skills
* Demonstrated ability to identify risks associated with business processes, operations, information security programs and technology projects
* Ability to be the security subject matter expert who can explain technical topics to those without a technical background; Exceptional communication skills with cross-functional audiences and senior leaders
* Must demonstrate proven success in working independently as well in a team and exhibit follow-through to understand root causes of issues
* Hard working with a "no task is too small" attitude
* Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team
* And of course, must love dogs


*This position is a full-time, salaried position. It is located on-site at our office in New York, NY or Columbus, OH. We offer health insurance for both you and your pup, 401k, wonderful team lunches, unlimited PTO and a dog to pet anytime you wish.*


**FOR CO/NJ/NY BASED APPLICANTS:**


* The base salary range for this position is **$175,000- $220,000**
* This position is eligible for equity

  


*\\*\\***This compensation range is based on BARKs good faith estimate as of the date of this posting and may be modified in the future. Actual pay for this position will depend on a variety of variables including location, travel, internal equity, experience, education, skills and expertise.*

title: Director, IT Program Management - Remote (East Coast)
description:
With a company culture rooted in collaboration, expertise and innovation, we aim to promote progress and inspire our clients, employees, investors and communities to achieve their greatest potential. Our work is the catalyst that helps others achieve their goals. In short, We Enable Possibility℠.
The ideal candidate will have a sharp business mind, familiarity with IT Operations, and proven ability to strategize and implement high-level program initiatives. As a natural leader, this person should have strong talent for project coordination and delegation.
To be successful in this role, the employee must combine* a strong relationship management/customer service background
* a strong Product, Project, or Program Management background
* a meaningful understanding of the core IT services gained through hands-on experience
* a balanced strategic and pragmatic approach to problem-solving
* a track record of experience managing programs such as global end user upgrades, migrations, chat implementations, service desk, or ITIL improvement efforts


Responsibilities and Objectives of this role* Partner with senior executives to envision, strategize, develop, and maintain services roadmap
* Strategize, implement, and maintain program initiatives that align to organizational objectives
* Perform research, validation, and whitespace analysis to identify new opportunities for existing and new features, functionality, or services
* Understand and develop business cases, including cost/benefit estimates, trends, competitive and risk analysis, service industry best practices, and product initiative timelines
* Build and maintain relationships with business sponsors, understanding their goals and motivations, and shaping the technology roadmap to meet these business objectives
* Plan and prioritize services, features, and requirements from conceptual stages through product life cycles
* Develop program intake and assessment protocols for evaluation and improvement
* Collaborate with IT engineering and operations teams to ensure consistent execution of plans
* Oversee multiple project teams. Identify risks and opportunities across multiple projects
* Work closely with initiative sponsor, cross-functional teams, and assigned IT managers to develop the scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and timing
* Develop and manage budget for projects and be accountable for delivering against established business goals/objectives
* Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for managers and stakeholders


Education and Experience* 10+ years of experience working in IT organizations
* 10+ years of hands-on experience with product, project, or portfolio & program management
* 5 or more years of experience in an upper-management role
* Exceptional skills in leadership, time management, facilitation, and organization
* Experience in managing stakeholders
* Outstanding knowledge of IT service management and change management principles
* Ability to make decisions in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, and rapidly changing environment
* Broad understanding of usability and user experience best practices
* Experience delivering enterprise class software products to a global audience
* Strong diplomatic and consensus building skills


Do you like solving complex business problems, working with talented colleagues and have an innovative mindset? Arch may be a great fit for you. If this job isn’t the right fit but you’re interested in working for Arch, create a job alert! Simply create an account and opt in to receive emails when we have job openings that meet your criteria. Join our talent community to share your preferences directly with Arch’s Talent Acquisition team.

title: Director digital Transformation
description:
At Jabil we strive to make ANYTHING POSSIBLE and EVERYTHING BETTER. We are proud to be a trusted partner for the world's top brands, offering comprehensive engineering, manufacturing, and supply chain solutions. With over 50 years of experience across industries and a vast network of over 100 sites worldwide, Jabil combines global reach with local expertise to deliver both scalable and customized solutions. Our commitment extends beyond business success as we strive to build sustainable processes that minimize environmental impact and foster vibrant and diverse communities around the globe.  

**JOB TITLE:** **Director of Digital Transformation**

At Jabil we strive to make ANYTHING POSSIBLE and EVERYTHING BETTER. We are proud to be a trusted partner for the world's top brands, offering comprehensive engineering, manufacturing, and supply chain solutions. With over 50 years of experience across industries and a vast network of over 100 sites worldwide, Jabil combines global reach with local expertise to deliver both scalable and customized solutions. Our commitment extends beyond business success as we strive to build sustainable processes that minimize environmental impact and foster vibrant and diverse communities around the globe.


**JOB SUMMARY**

As the Director of Digital Transformation, you will play a pivotal role in leading and driving the Jabil's digital transformation initiatives. In this strategic position, you will be responsible for formulating and executing comprehensive digital strategies to enhance operational efficiency, improve customer experiences, and drive innovation across the entire organization.  



  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

Ownership of operational data governance.


Define AI strategic initiatives and drive design and deployment.


Formulate and execute a robust digital transformation strategy aligned with the overall business objectives Collaborate with key stakeholders to identify opportunities for digital innovation and recommend technological solutions to achieve business goals.


Lead and inspire a cross-functional team of digital experts, ensuring effective collaboration and a shared vision for digital transformation Foster a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and adaptability within the team.


Oversee the implementation of cutting-edge digital technologies and platforms to drive efficiency, automation, and agility. Evaluate, select, and manage relationships with technology vendors and partners.


Drive cultural and organizational change required for successful digital transformation Work closely with various departments to ensure smooth adoption of digital processes and technologies.


Utilize data analytics and insights to inform strategic decisions and measure the impact of digital initiatives. Implement data governance practices to ensure the quality and security of digital data assets.


Collaborate with key stakeholders, including executives, department heads, and external partners, to align digital strategies with business objectives.


Communicate digital transformation progress, successes, and challenges effectively to all relevant stakeholders.


Identify and mitigate potential risks associated with digital initiatives, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards.


**JOB QUALIFICATIONS**  

**KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS**

Strong understanding of emerging technologies, trends, and their application to business strategy.


Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and collaborate at all organizational levels.


Track record of successfully implementing digital transformation initiatives and achieving measurable business outcomes.


Exceptional project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Manufacturing or Operations experience is a plus.


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.


Excellent communication and presentation skills.


Willingness to travel globally 25% to 50% of the time.


**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS**

* Bachelor’s degree in a related field; master’s degree preferred.
* 8+ years of proven experience in a leadership role overseeing digital transformation initiatives.
* Or an equivalent combination of education, experience and / or training.

Pay is $149,130 - $268,434. Job-related, non-discriminatory factors used to determine the actual offered rate include qualifications and experience, geographic location, education, external market data, and consideration of internal equity. The anticipated close date of this job requisition is: March 09, 2024.
As part of the total rewards package, this position is eligible for a short-term incentive based on performance. In addition, Jabil offers benefits to enhance your health, wealth, and resilient self. These include medical, dental, and vision insurance plans; paid time off accruing at a rate of 3.07 hours during your first year of employment; 4 weeks of paid parental leave; in 2023, 10 company-paid holidays (8 fixed holidays and 2 optional floating holidays), subject to change yearly; 401(k) retirement plan; and employee stock purchase plan. Eligible for long-term incentive awards.  

BE AWARE OF FRAUD: When applying for a job at Jabil you will be contacted via correspondence through our official job portal with a jabil.com e-mail address; direct phone call from a member of the Jabil team; or direct e-mail with a jabil.com e-mail address. Jabil does not request payments for interviews or at any other point during the hiring process. Jabil will not ask for your personal identifying information such as a social security number, birth certificate, financial institution, driver’s license number or passport information over the phone or via e-mail. If you believe you are a victim of identity theft, contact the Federal Bureau of Investigations internet crime hotline (www.ic3.gov), the Federal Trade Commission identity theft hotline (www.identitytheft.gov) and/or your local police department. Any scam job listings should be reported to whatever website it was posted in.
**Jabil, including its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.**

**Accessibility Accommodation**
===============================

If you are a qualified individual with a disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access Jabil.com/Careers site as a result of your disability. You can request a reasonable accommodation by sending an e-mail to Always\\_Accessible@Jabil.com or calling 727-803-7988 with the nature of your request and contact information. Please do not direct any other general employment related questions to this e-mail or phone number. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to.

title: Program Director
description:
**Program Director**
====================

Req ID: 53204
Location:
Remote, US
**Job Title: Program Director**


**Location: Remote**

  


**About Sapiens:**


Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) empowers the financial sector, with a focus on insurance, to transform and become digital, innovative, and agile. Backed by 40 years of industry expertise, Sapiens offers a complete insurance platform, with pre-integrated, low-code solutions and a cloud-first approach that accelerates customers’ digital transformation. Serving more than 600 customers in 30 countries, Sapiens offers insurers across Property & Casualty, Workers’ Compensation and Life markets the most comprehensive set of solutions, from core to complementary, including Reinsurance, Financial & Compliance, Data & Analytics, Digital, and Decision Management. Sapiens’ team of more than 5,000 employees operates through our offices in North America, the UK, EMEA and Asia Pacific.


**Job Description:**

  


The **Program Director** is the strategic link between the client and Sapiens for both operations and innovation. The Program Director is a business executive who understands and manages the delicate balance of ensuring profitable growth of Sapiens’ business in a defined account/territory, ensuring quality project delivery, achieving its financial targets while assuring that the customer's satisfaction and loyalty are optimized. This position is the central, most significant, and senior role at the heart of Sapiens’ customer-facing operations. The effective and efficient execution of the Program Director role governs the overall business performance of the company and is hence seen as critical by the company. The Program Director has ultimate responsibility for the customer and although cooperation and teamwork are required, it is this person who has the final authority regarding customer-facing matters.

  


**Key requirements for the role:**


Technical knowledge, service delivery and relationship management skills, cultural, leadership, political and geographical management capabilities & ability to:


* Connect between the business stakeholders and Sapiens team.
* Resolve issues related to budget, resources, tech constraints.
* Conduct planning and roadmap for all the services provided to Customer.

  




**Key Responsibilities:**


**Delivery:**


* Responsible for planning and managing the service delivery on a day-to-day basis.
* Accountable for all Sapiens delivery across all work streams & responsible for commercial engagement.
* Monitoring of service delivery performance and escalated issues across all key service metrics.
* Release manager for any release deployed to production.
* Strong connectivity and alignment with onshore and offshore teams to coordinate delivery.
* Strong connectivity and alignment with customer on-site team (in particular Delivery Mgr’s) to meet delivery targets.
* Responsible for delivery of change outcomes in alignment with the Customer delivery roadmap.


**Customer Management:**


* Overall local Customer relationship management.
* Responsible for team engagement and embedding Customer values and behaviors to drive cultural alignment, contribute to organizational change management.
* Understand Customer and business strategies and how these align to industry trends, discuss value propositions.


**Operations:**


* Operational excellence/cost and forecasting management.
* Resource planning, Recruitment, management, and logistics, including utilization.
* Ensure adherence to Customer Business Systems and PMO standards, tools, and processes – as agreed during transition & Issue and Risk Management.
* Set and agree annual KPIs around Improving efficiency, delivering of value.
* Contract management and commercials, Incident manager in case of production incident.
* Responsible for the customer’s work pipeline and roadmap, presentation of it to the business.


**Reporting:**


* Management Reporting, Present Sapiens monthly and weekly service reports, monitoring, tracking, and reporting on progress, SLA, KPI, Operational meetings, report of officers, scorecard meetings & Key presenter and facilitator of Quarterly review meetings Sapiens-Customer.

  




**Skills and Experience:**


* 15+ years background in the IT industry.
* Excellent client relationship management skills and the ability to play a trusted advisor to C-level customer executives.
* Experience with all aspects of project management practices.
* A history of delivering projects meeting requirements, on schedule and on budget.
* Experienced in working in a global matrix organization, good communication with peers.
* A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can manage and prioritize concurrent work assignments.
* Motivated to succeed with a can-do approach.
* Experience in leading managers providing coaching, mentoring, and recruiting as needed.

  



At Sapiens, we are dedicated to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment. We believe that diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences make us stronger and more innovative. We are committed to creating a culture where every individual is valued and can thrive regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.

  


**Sapiens is an E-Verified & Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V.**

  


#LI-Remote

  


  

**Nearest Major Market:** Eugene

title: Director of Product Management, AI Experiences
description:
**Company Description**  

At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.


With more than 7,700+ customers, we serve approximately 85% of the Fortune 500®, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies™.


Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.


Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.

 **Job Description**  

We’re not yesterday’s IT department, we're Digital Technology. The world around us keeps changing and so do we. We’re redefining what it means to be IT with a mindset centered on transformation, experience, AI-driven automation, innovation, and growth. We’re all about delivering delightful, secure customer and employee experiences that accelerate ServiceNow’s journey to become the defining enterprise software company of the 21st century. And we love co-creating, using, and highlighting our own products to do it.


Ultimately, we strive to make the world work better for our employees and customers—when you work in ServiceNow Digital Technology, you work for them.


In this high impact role, you will have the opportunity to showcase your strategic thinking and thought leadership, customer engagement & story telling skills, while also driving day to day execution and innovation excellence.


This opportunity is part of our Emerging Technology Group within Digital Technology. You will be responsible to drive Product strategy, roadmap, and delivery across a suite of high impact AI related products. Exhibit thought leadership, lead an innovative team, and collaborate across many organizations. As part of Digital Technology – you will be able to drive our customer zero strategy for ServiceNow product - we ensure the products works for us internally and delivers value as it gets in hands of our customers. With AI everywhere we are responsible for advance technology services which cuts across the enterprise like Search and Conversational Interfaces.


We are focused on accelerating innovations and developing new concepts, forward-thinking solutions and products leveraging ServiceNow’s Intelligent platform.

**What you get to do in this role:**

* Product strategy and vision – develop and articulate a clear product strategy for our AI products. Define and communicate the long-term vision, ensuring alignment with industry trends and customer needs
* Team leadership - Lead and inspire a high-performing product management team, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence. Provide mentorship and guidance to product managers, helping them develop their skills and contribute to the success of the products.
* Cross-functional collaboration - Collaborate with cross-functional teams, to ensure the successful development, launch, and support of products. Work closely with stakeholders to gather input and feedback, incorporating it into product strategy and roadmap decisions.
* Product Roadmap and Lifecycle Management - Develop and maintain a comprehensive product roadmap, outlining key features, enhancements, and releases. Manage the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to end-of-life, ensuring products meet needs and remain competitive.
* Market Analysis and Competitive Intelligence - Stay abreast of industry trends, market dynamics, and competitive landscape related to products. Conduct regular market analysis and gather intelligence to inform product strategy and positioning.
* Stakeholder engagement - Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs, pain points, and feedback related to products. Drive initiatives to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty through product improvements and innovative solutions.
* Manage complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish and help the teams achieve the intended outcomes
* Develop plans and help the teams stay on track by monitoring and providing on-going visibility to product status (progress against key milestones, key decisions, dependencies, issues, risks, metrics, etc.) to all stakeholders
* Anticipate and aggressively remove obstacles that slow down or prevent product teams from delivering on outcomes

  

**Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you must have:**

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.
* 10+ years experience in product management leadership roles, with 3-5+ years focused on AI products.
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Excellent strategic thinking and decision-making abilities.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proven track record of successfully bringing products to market and driving product growth.
* Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic, and fun team environment
* Team player attitude and willingness to work across the organization and company
* Knowledge of and exposure to the latest in Generative AI landscape highly desirable

**Preferred Qualifications/Skills:**

* Strategic thinking and ability to influence stakeholders
* Prior experience with ServiceNow products and/or processes
* Proven results from establishing and optimizing software engineering processes for different organizations/environments
* Experience in a start-up environment is beneficial

  

**Additional Information**  

ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.


At ServiceNow, we lead with flexibility and trust in our distributed world of work. Click here to learn about our work personas: flexible, remote and required-in-office.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.


For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.


Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.

  



From Fortune. © 2022 Fortune Media IP Limited All rights reserved. Used under license.


Fortune and Fortune Media IP Limited are not affiliated with, and do not endorse products or services of, ServiceNow.

title: Director - Data Engineering and Analytics
description:
**What are we building?**
=========================



Hard Rock Digital is a team focused on becoming the best online sportsbook, casino, and social casino company in the world. We’re building a team that resonates passion for learning, operating and building new products and technologies for millions of consumers. We care about each customer's interaction, experience, behavior, and insight and strive to ensure we’re always acting authentically.

  

Rooted in the kindred spirits of Hard Rock and the Seminole Tribe of Florida, the new Hard Rock Digital taps a brand known the world over as the leader in gaming, entertainment, and hospitality. We’re taking that foundation of success and bringing it to the digital space — ready to join us?

 **What’s the position?**



We are seeking a highly skilled and visionary Director - Data Engineering and Analytics to lead and drive our data strategy, engineering, and analytics initiatives. As the Director, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data-driven decision-making processes, ensuring data accuracy, reliability, and accessibility, and driving innovation in data management, analytics and applications of data science. This is a strategic leadership role that requires a combination of technical expertise, strong leadership capabilities, and a deep understanding of modern data engineering and analytics practices.

 **Key Responsibilities:**



Leadership and Strategy:


* Define and execute the organization's data engineering and analytics strategy, aligning it with overall business goals and objectives.
* Lead a high-performing team of data engineers, analysts, and scientists, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
* Provide thought leadership and stay abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in data engineering, analytics, and machine learning.
* Mentor and connect rising data engineer talent to build a community of practice and career path pipelines from junior to principal



Data Architecture and Engineering:


* Assist Subject Matter Experts in maintaining and enahaning enterprise data architecure.
* Manage delivery and development of data pipelines, ETL processes, and data warehousing solutions.
* Ensure products consitently meet data quality, integrity, and reliability goals.
* Identify initiatives to continuously improve efficiency and reduce latency for real-time and batch processing.



Data Analytics and Insights:


* Collaborate with business stakeholders to define and prioritize data analytics requirements, ensuring the delivery of actionable insights and meaningful visualizations.
* Develop and manage advanced analytics models and predictive algorithms to uncover insights, trends, and opportunities from large and complex datasets.
* Enable self-service analytics capabilities for various business units, empowering data-driven decision-making across the organization.



Data Governance and Compliance:


* Establish and enforce data governance practices, data security protocols, and data privacy regulations to ensure compliance and protect sensitive information.
* Implement data cataloguing and metadata management processes to enhance data discoverability and lineage tracking.
* Work closely with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to data protection and regulatory requirements.



Cross-functional Collaboration:


* Partner with IT, software engineering, and other departments to integrate data engineering and analytics solutions seamlessly into the technology landscape.
* Collaborate with Product Management and Research teams to support data-driven product development and innovation.
* Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making.

**What are we looking for?**
============================


* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field. MBA is a plus.
* Proven track record of leading and managing data engineering and analytics teams in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Strong expertise in data engineering, data architecture, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
* Proficiency in modern data analytics tools and technologies (Python, Spark, SQL), data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), and machine learning frameworks.
* Exposure to and interest in the following technologies:
  

AWS Serverless and serverless-supported languages  

SQL and/or NoSQL experience (ex, MySql, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Snowflake)  

Streaming technologies (Amazon Kinesis, Kafka)  

Message Queues (SQS, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ)  

Data automation tools (DBT)
* Familiarity with MarTech tools a plus (eg Segment, Amplitude, Salesforce, Braze)
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP and their data services.
* In-depth understanding of data governance, data security, and compliance best practices.
* Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.

 **What’s in it for you?**

  


We offer our employees more than just competitive compensation. Our team benefits include:


* Competitive pay and benefits
* Flexible vacation allowance
* Startup culture backed by a secure, global brand

**Roster of Uniques**
=====================



We care deeply about every interaction our customers have with us and trust and empower our staff to own and drive their experience. Our vision for our business and customers is built on fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where regardless of background or beliefs you feel able to be authentic and bring all your talent into play. We want to celebrate you being you (we are an equal opportunities employer)

title: Director of Operations (Life Sciences Automation)
description:
At JSat Automation we believe that by providing our customers with the resources they need to overcome obstacles in their quest for scientific discovery and change, we can more broadly improve the daily lives of everyone in our world. It is our mission to provide our clients with a strategic, efficient cost-effective approach to implementation of their projects. Our goal is more than to just deliver a solution but to foster a long-term relationship as a technical partner and to invest in their continued success.
Our highly diverse and talented team of engineers, project managers and process specialists are encouraged to channel their passion, innovation, and leadership to help enable us to provide unique, superior turnkey solutions for our customers. We are dedicated to finding the best person for every role at JSat because the solutions and tools that we develop together will help revolutionize numerous industries. If you think you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat to see what skills/experience you are able to bring to this team. Apply Today to find out how you can join JSAT Automation and make an impact.
Job Summary


We are seeking an exceptional leader to take on the challenging and rewarding role of Director of Engineering Operations for JSat. This individual will play a pivotal role in guiding our company's growth and success, operational profitability, driving both operational excellence and technical innovation in the exciting field of life sciences automation. You will bridge the gap between business strategy and technical execution, ensuring our solutions not only meet client needs but also push the boundaries of what's possible in the industry.
The Director of Engineering Operations in a services-based company plays a critical role in overseeing various operational aspects to ensure the effective, profitable, and efficient delivery of services. The Director of Engineering Operations plays a key role in translating the company's strategic vision into actionable plans, optimizing processes, managing resources efficiently, profitability, and ensuring the overall success of service delivery. The exact responsibilities may evolve based on the specific needs and goals of the services-based company.
If you are a highly motivated and experienced with a passion for automation and the life sciences industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting position!  

Job Responsibilities

* Operational Strategy
	+ Develop and implement operational strategies aligned with the overall business goals and objectives.
	+ Work closely with the executive team to ensure operational plans are integrated into the broader organizational strategy.
	+ Identify and qualify new project opportunities.
	+ Develop proposals and negotiate contracts.
	+ Represent the company at industry events and conferences.
	+ Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for teams and company as a whole.
	+ Take action on key performance indicators (KPIs) for teams and company as a whole.
* Process Optimization
	+ Identify opportunities to streamline and optimize business processes to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.
	+ Implement best practices and continuous improvement initiatives.
	+ Responsible primarily for planning, coordinating, and executing company processes from the beginning to the end.
* Resource Management
	+ Oversee resource allocation, including staffing, technology, and infrastructure, to meet service delivery requirements.
	+ Ensure adequate training and development programs for employees.
* Quality Assurance
	+ Establish and monitor quality assurance processes to maintain high standards in service delivery.
	+ Implement performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve service quality.
	+ Ensure the technical quality and reliability of all solutions are delivered to clients.
* Client Satisfaction
	+ Collaborate with client-facing teams to understand client needs and expectations.
	+ Implement strategies to enhance client satisfaction and retention.
	+ Develop and maintain relationships with key accounts in the life sciences industry.
	+ Provide ongoing communication with clients and resolve issues.
	+ Interact with client personnel to identify and analyze continuous improvement through system upgrades, studies, collaboration, etc.
* Risk Management
	+ Identify and assess operational risks and implement risk mitigation strategies.
	+ Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards.
	+ Maintain all required training to ensure job responsibilities can be performed daily.
* Technology Integration
	+ Evaluate and implement technology solutions to improve operational efficiency.
	+ Stay updated on industry trends and technological advancements to maintain a competitive edge.
	+ Lead the engineering team, setting the technical vision and direction for the company's automation solutions.
	+ Stay abreast of emerging technologies in the life sciences and automation fields, driving continuous innovation.
	+ Lead conversations with clients in the designing, development, installation and support of systems in respective field of interests (Automation, Validation, IT, etc.).
	+ Technical oversight of individual projects.
* Financial Management
	+ Collaborate with the executives team to manage budgets and control costs.
	+ Implement financial controls and reporting mechanisms.
	+ Oversee all engineering departments and functions, ensuring efficient and profitable operations.
	+ Implement and maintain robust project management processes, ensuring projects are delivered on time and within budget.
	+ Responsible for profitability of all verticals and company.
	+ Oversight of individual projects using Earned Value Management (EVM) for measuring project's cost and schedule performance by comparing work performed with the work planned.
* Communication and Collaboration
	+ Foster effective communication and collaboration between different departments.
	+ Work closely with other executive team to ensure alignment across all functions.
	+ Collaborate with VP of Technology to manage the development and implementation of new automation technologies and products.
	+ Collaborate closely with the sales and marketing teams to understand client needs and translate them into technical solutions.
	+ Collaborate with other departments within the company to ensure that clients' needs are met.
	+ Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including clients, partners, and investors.
* Crisis Management
	+ Develop and implement contingency plans to address potential crises or disruptions.
	+ Lead the company through challenging times with resilience and adaptability.
	+ Responsible for managing and resolving client and vendor grievances.
* Strategic Partnerships
	+ Identify and nurture strategic partnerships and vendors that can enhance service delivery or expand market reach.
* Talent Management
	+ Oversee talent acquisition, retention, and development strategies.
	+ Foster a positive organizational culture and employee engagement that attracts and retains top talent.
	+ Effectively direct and deploy resources that support client and customer requirements for the delivery of projects and services.
	+ Oversee administrative and operational processes that ensure the right engineers are available to successfully complete scheduled and specialty project. requests.

  

Qualifications

* Proven track record of success in a leadership role within a technology or engineering company.
* Deep understanding of the life sciences industry and the challenges and opportunities in automation.
* Strong operational skills, including experience in project management, resource allocation, and financial analysis.
* Excellent technical acumen and experience in software development, automation technologies, or related fields.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with diverse stakeholders.
* Visionary leadership style with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
* Strong focus on innovation and a passion for bringing cutting-edge solutions to market.
* 15 + years of direct life science industry experience.
* 5+ years of experience in sales, preferably in the life sciences industry
* Ability to travel as needed
* Ability to build and maintain relationships with key decision-makers
* Excellent client communication skills.
* Clear, strategic thinker with vision, with the ability to execute on priorities.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Must have strong project management skills (Scheduling, Budgeting, & Resourcing)
* Experience managing proposal creation processes.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills
* Attention to detail, accuracy, and proactive relevance to company interests
* Experienced in the application of engineering best practice, methodologies, tools, software, and principles in the advancement of process improvements and complex project execution
* Solid understanding of job financial reporting with ability to apply cost control measures for projects
* Excellent analytical and organizational skills.
* Experience with automation, commissioning, qualification, or operations in a cGMP environment.
* Knowledge of current industry standards such as GAMP5 and ASTM E2500.
* Experience in Computer System Validation (CSV) for manufacturing systems.
* Strong technical knowledge of automation systems; Emerson DeltaV, Emerson Syncade, Rockwell, Ignition, and Sepasoft.
* Proficient/ thorough knowledge of validation, manufacturing processes, quality systems, engineering design fundamentals, regulatory agency expectation and industry trends.
* Tactical thinker with experience working with customers developing testing, validation and/or quality strategies.
* Strong technical writing, verbal communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently.
* Strong computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft office suite programs.
* Demonstrate good record keeping practices and attention to detail.
* Excellent collaboration and ability to communicate information to a varied audience.
* Bachelor's degree in business, engineering, or a related field

*Salary DOE: The pay range for this position is $145k - $180k per year; however, base pay may be higher or lower depending on the candidate's job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This figure does not include additional compensation such as health benefits, vacation, etc.*

title: Senior Director of Spiritual Development (US)
description:
**About Childcare Worldwide**



Childcare Worldwide is compelled to fulfill the Great Commission by bringing (unchurched) children to church-based Life Centers. Sponsors connect with a child to support their needs so that they can meet their God-given potential. For over 40 years, Childcare Worldwide has been connecting sponsors with children through Christ-based Life Centers. With sponsors and Life Centers removing barriers, children grow spiritually and physically into thriving, productive adults. Our approach focuses on spiritual and holistic needs.

  

At Childcare Worldwide, We Are:


* Mission-Driven: Our guiding light is the call to serve Christ by nurturing His children. This unwavering commitment shapes every aspect of our work, compelling us to make a profound impact on young lives through the Gospel.
* Transparent: We uphold the highest standards of integrity and accountability, ensuring that our actions align with our words. Our commitment to transparency builds trust with our donors, partners, and the communities we serve.
* Agile: Our responsiveness to the needs around us is marked by swift and intentional action. This agility allows us to effectively address challenges and seize opportunities to further our mission.
* Innovative: Innovation is at the heart of our approach. We foster an entrepreneurial spirit among our team, encouraging creative thinking and problem-solving to advance our mission in dynamic ways.

  



What To Expect:


* Collaborative Culture: At Childcare Worldwide, teamwork and passion are the bedrock of our organization. United in our love for Jesus and dedication to serving His children, we believe that together, we can achieve extraordinary outcomes.
* A Purposeful Environment: Our work environment is one of purpose and dedication, valuing hard work, quick and thoughtful action, and innovative thinking. Every task, big or small, is an opportunity to contribute to our mission.
* Relational Excellence: We are committed to building and maintaining strong relationships based on respect, empathy, and genuine care. This commitment to excellence in our interactions ensures that we serve each other and those in our programs with the highest level of compassion and integrity.
* Intentionality: Our actions are guided by a clear purpose: to make a meaningful difference in the lives of the children we serve. This intentionality is woven into the fabric of our daily work, driving us to make decisions that align with our mission and values.

  


**Job Overview**



The Senior Director of Spiritual Development will serve as a visionary leader, primarily responsible for the spiritual oversight and development within our network of Life Centers. This role is critical in ensuring that our programs resonate with and meet the spiritual needs of children across diverse cultural backgrounds, nurturing their growth into spiritually enriched and productive adults.

 **Job Key Responsibilities**


* Strategic Spiritual Leadership: Execute the strategic vision for spiritual programs across all Life Centers, ensuring they align with CW’s mission of bringing unchurched children to Christ.
