#FlexibleWork


  

We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

title: Director, IT Programs & Compliance Management
description:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.


**What you'll be part of:**



Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

**What you'll be responsible for:**



The Director, IT Programs & Compliance Management will lead the IT intake, on time delivery, issue, program and escalation management of work requests across Circle. This role will ensure IT functions with on time delivery and communicates any hurdles to success. They will additionally program manage work generated to advance automations and efficiencies across IT. Responsibilities will include leading regular cadence of IT program meetings with partner teams and IT leadership. This role will additionally hold responsibility for partnering with the Risk and Compliance team to track, manage and ensure on time resolution of all IT risk related issues and audit findings. This person will work across the IT and Risk teams to ensure that policy and controls are accurately documented and followed within the IT organization. Responsibility for management, updates and closure of IT audit board assigned items will be required. This leader will work cross functionally to achieve results for the IT and partner organizations. Responsibilities for corporate wide IT communications will be included in this role. We're looking for an energetic people-person to be able to interface enthusiastically with all levels of leadership and users across Circle.


**What you'll work on:**


* Lead work intake for IT program requests to ensure accurate and complete requirements
* Lead and facilitate IT program tracking, meeting cadence and resolution of issues to ensure on time delivery
* Manage timely escalations to IT leadership and partner teams regarding hurdles or issues relative to delivery
* Facilitate management and closure of all IT risk related audit findings, issues, controls per delivery dates
* Provide communication and training to employees, both formal and ad hoc, relative to IT deployments and associated impacts
* Continuing to grow IT credibility and transparency with business partners


**You will aspire to our four core values:**


* **Multistakeholder -** you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
* **Mindful -** you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
* **Driven by Excellence -** you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
* **High Integrity -** you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.


**What you'll bring to Circle:**


* Exceptional interpersonal skills across all levels of employees and leadership
* Deep Experience in managing the IT work intake process to ensure complete and accurate requirements are understood and delivery dates are agreed upon across IT and stakeholders
* 10+ years experience with IT program management, issue resolution and escalation to executive leadership both in IT and across partner organizations
* 10 + years working in Technology related business, understanding of Cloud infrastructures and SaaS
* 5+ years working in highly regulated financial industries with first hand knowledge of Risk Management, lines of defense
* Experience communicating IT implementations and associated impacts to a corporate wide audience
* Understanding of IT frameworks for ITIL (Incident, Change, Service, Problem), Asset management
* Past experience with corporate programs for ERP, HR, Legal systems a plus


**Additional Information:**


* This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.


*Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.*


*Starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.*


*Base Pay Range: $190,000 - $242,500*


*Annual Bonus Target: 20%*


*Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.*


We are an **equal opportunity employer** and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the **E-Verify Program** in certain locations, as required by law.


###### 
#LI-Remote

title: Director, Data
description:
At Evolve we’re a hardworking team serious about hospitality. Our teams work every day to make vacation rental easy for everyone — from our owners who trust Evolve to build their business to our guests who rest easy with every stay to our Evolvers who make this difference a reality. Our values anchor our daily decisions and interactions with our customers, communities, and each other. Join our inclusive culture in one of the most rapidly-growing segments in travel. Find your home at Evolve.


**Why this role**



As a tech-enabled disruptor in the vacation rental industry, data is the backbone of how we innovate and make our mark in this industry. Evolve is hungry for data-driven insights and products, and we need a leader to take our cloud-based data infrastructure built on technologies like Snowflake, Fivetran, Dbt, Prefect and Tableau to the next level. This is a leadership role with the autonomy, authority, and support to drive Evolve forward and make step level changes in how we structure, store, transform, access, analyze and present data.



Come join our fast-paced growth-stage culture, while enjoying the support of a well funded company - we’ve raised over $100M in investment capital from world-class investors like T. Rowe Price, Allen & Company, and Annox Capital.


**What you’ll do**



As the Head of Data, you will own all Analytics Engineering, Data Engineering and Data Science functions at Evolve. You will create an empowered and data-centric culture at Evolve rooted in data governance and integrity. This will include a thoughtful review of enterprise data movement and implementation of checks and balances where needed, to provide reliable data insights. You will leverage your technical expertise and strong cross functional leadership skills to deliver actionable insights and models to all departments.


* Lead, develop and grow a team of data engineers, analytics engineers and data scientists; responsible for delivering high quality and actionable data, dashboards, analysis, and tools
* Own the architecture of Evolve’s data warehouse design along with Evolve’s overall data integration landscape
* Grow our Data Science and Machine Learning functions at Evolve to drive product innovation and statistical experimentation.
* Be the visible leader of Data to the organization by setting and articulating a vision, providing ongoing communication, establish a foundation of data governance to forge a data culture that promotes trust and empowers the workforce with actionable insights and develop and execute on an data strategy roadmap that is aligned with company objectives and key results
* Establish best-in-class practices and technical standards for analytical processes and solution development, using Agile methodologies
* Be an analytics thought leader and a brainstorm partner for stakeholders across the organization, translating business needs and problems into data-driven solutions
* Partner with engineering and product leadership to continuously seek innovative ways to improve the quality and accessibility of our source system data
* and working cross-functionally
* Own the quality, understandability, and reporting of key company metrics from ingestion to modeling and reporting.
* Empower data-driven decision making across the company
* Partners with executive leadership on strategy development and presents findings to key stakeholders (e.g., external contract partners, state agency leadership, conference presentations, advisory committees, and other partner organizations), using data to educate and “tell the story.”
* Maintains an industry presence and stays abreast of best practices, relevant research, and literature. Routinely and effectively shares learnings with colleagues to enhance Evolve’s knowledge base.
+ Diligently follow competitors and trends within the vacation rental and data analytics industry

**What makes you a great fit**


* 10+ years of experience of building and maintaining data warehouses, BI applications, and data management processes
* 5+ years of people leadership with a passion for unlocking the talents of team members
* Excellent cross-functional leadership and collaboration skills
* Deep understanding and experience with SQL and data visualization tools
* Advanced proficiency with data model design, applications, data flows, API documentation, and data governance
* Highly skilled in communicating and presenting technical information to all levels of the company including executives
* You stay up to date with the latest and evolving BI and EDW best practices and technologies
* You have a strategic mindset with the ability to zoom in and zoom out
* Approaches work with an eye toward understanding and eliminating disparities and brings this mindset into analytic methods, reporting, and dissemination of findings.


**Location**

We currently are able to hire throughout the U.S. except in the following states: District of Columbia, Hawaii, and Pennsylvania. There are also certain positions that may have hiring impacts in the following states: California, Maryland, New York, Rhode Island, and Washington. If you live in Colorado, you can work remotely anywhere in the state, at our downtown Denver office, or a hybrid of both!

California Applicant Privacy Policy | Evolve
**Compensation**



For this role our salary range is $200,000 to $230,000, depending on relevant experience. This role will also be eligible to receive a variable annual bonus based on both company and individual performance.


**How we reward Evolvers**



Evolvers have access to highly competitive benefits and rewards that support their whole well-being so they can focus on bringing their best selves to work.


**Financial**


* Industry competitive pay, including equity in the company for all Evolvers
* 401(k) with a 4% match that vests immediately


**Family**


* 6 weeks of paid parental leave for birth and non-birth parents
* Infertility coverage
* Child care discounts and locator support
* Pet insurance to cover your furry children


**Well-being**


* Comprehensive health plans that include a 100% employer paid option for the Evolver
* 100% employer-paid dental and vision for the Evolver
* 8 free mental health visits


**Unplug and Explore**


* Take some time away from work with generous PTO, sick, holidays, and a personal holiday to celebrate what’s more important to YOU
* Annual Evolve travel credit after 1 year
* Discounts to stay at Evolve properties


**Learn Every Day**


* World class onboarding programs
* Learning and development opportunities


**How we work together**



With our core values as our guide, every Evolver helps shape the company we want to work for and the people we want to be. We’ve cultivated a culture of collaboration, care, and responsibility that we can all be proud of, and we’re excited to see what you’ll bring as your authentic self.



Still curious about who we are and what we do? Read more about our business and our culture at evolve.com.


**EEO**



At Evolve, we are committed to diversity and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified candidates will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military service or veteran status, physical or mental disability, or any other legally protected characteristic. Evolve participates in e-Verify for all positions.



If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation at any point in the hiring process, please let your recruiter know.

title: Director, Strategic Vendor Management
description:
**Company Overview**
--------------------



ID.me is a high-growth enterprise software company that simplifies how people prove and share their identity online. The company empowers people to control their data through a portable and trusted login, which means they don't need to create a new password when visiting sites that have the ID.me button. ID.me's digital identity network has over 117 million registered members, and is used by fourteen federal agencies, agencies in 30 states and over 600 corporations for secure identity proofing and verification.



ID.me's technology meets the federal standards for consumer authentication set by the Commerce Department and is approved as a NIST 800-63-3 IAL2 / AAL2 credential service provider by the Kantara Initiative. In addition to helping people control their credentials and data, the company's "No Identity Left Behind" initiative strives to expand digital access and inclusion for all people. The company offers multiple pathways to identity verification – online self-serve, live video chat agents, and in person. ID.me is passionate about building a robust identity network that does not compromise access for traditionally underserved groups.



ID.me has received numerous awards including Deloitte's 2023 Technology Fast 500, Washington Business Journal's Fastest Growing Companies, Entrepreneur Magazine's 100 Brilliant Companies and Wall Street Journal's Startup of the Year finalist. In recent quarters, ID.me announced it raised $132 million in Series D funding, led by Viking Global Investors with participation from CapitalG, Morgan Stanley Counterpoint, FTV Capital, PSP Growth, Auctus Investment Group, Moonshots Capital, and Scout Ventures. ID.me's most recent round brings the total investment in ID.me to over $275 million since its founding in 2010.

### **Role Overview**



The Director, Strategic Vendor Management will lead the vendor management function for ID.me's product organization. This leader has direct responsibility for managing third-party spend required to deliver ID.me's products with a goal of continually improving gross margin, increasing customer value, and minimizing fraud.



Responsibilities


* Manage Ongoing Partnerships
+ Define KPIs for each vendor category to manage performance and cost.
+ Serve as the go-to resource for current vendor performance across all dimensions (e.g., product performance, spend with vendor, SME on capabilities, etc.)
+ Stay ahead of vendor product roadmap and ensure vendors are aligned with ID.me's needs going forward
+ Overall expert ability to manage tech partnerships

* Evaluate New Technology Partnerships
+ Negotiation and contracting expertise to achieve best outcome for ID.me
+ Provide in depth analysis on vendor comparison across all relevant factors (feature value to business, strategic alignment, time to integrate, pricing, company health, etc.)
+ Ability to forecast, build pricing models, and strong FP&A skills to build and assess business cases for new vendor integrations
+ Partner with product & engineering teams to test new vendors, coordinate into roadmap, and bring new partnerships to market

* Contribute to Product strategy
+ Deep knowledge of competitive landscape, product categories, and vendors in identity domain
+ Understanding market emerging trends and help ID.me stay ahead
+ Advance product strategy & roadmap through recommendations for new partners

Who We're Looking For


* Strong, strategic, business, & financial acumen: Applies the right financial, customer and product metrics, and market knowledge to make sound business decisions and create competitive strategies. Ability to dive into the details to understand business implications and drive alignment and execution across business stakeholders.
* Leadership and influencer: Earns trust and maintains confidence across teams at ID.me. Establishes collaborative working relationships. Able to manage directly and through influence.
* Urgency: Bias for action. Accomplishes goals, beats deadlines, and proactively addresses issues before they become widespread.


Requirements


* Demonstrated track record of identifying, negotiating, and managing large third-party vendor partnerships (>$30M annual third-party spend preferred)
* 10+ years of experience in vendor management, with consulting, strategy, product management, or program management roles to complement this experience.
* Exceptional leadership skills and experience navigating and influencing in a matrixed organization without direct authority.
* Demonstrated success working in an agile environment on multiple projects.
* Experience in the fraud, identity, or financial services industries.


This is a remote position.


The annual base salary listed below for this role is based on experience, skills, education, relevant training and geographic location. Company bonus, incentive for sales roles, equity, and benefits are available depending on the role.



ID.me offers comprehensive medical, dental, vision, health savings account, flexible spending accounts (medical, limited purpose, dependent care, commuter benefit accounts), basic and voluntary life and AD&D insurance, 401(k) with company match, parental leave, ability to participate in unlimited paid time off subject to the terms and conditions of the PTO policy, including 8 company wide holidays, short and long-term disability insurance, accident and critical illness insurance, referral bonus policy, employee assistance program, pet insurance, travel assistant program, wellbeing and childcare discounts, benefit advocates, and a learning and development benefit.



The above represents the anticipated total rewards package for this job requisition. Final offers may vary from the amount listed based on qualifications, professional experiences, skills, education, relevant training, geographic location, and other job related factors.

**Pay Range**


$182,000—$215,256 USD
ID.me maintains a work environment free from discrimination, where employees are treated with dignity and respect. All ID.me employees share in the responsibility for fulfilling our commitment to equal employment opportunity. ID.me does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. ID.me adheres to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, promotion, benefits, social and recreational programs, and discipline. In addition, ID.me's policy is to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances where a particular employee works. Upon request we will provide you with more information about such accommodations.



Please review our Privacy Policy, including our CCPA policy, at id.me/privacy. If you provide ID.me with any personally identifiable information you confirm that you have read and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions set out in our Privacy Policy.



ID.me participates in E-Verify.

title: Director of Creative Operations
description:
Summary
The Director of Creative Operations will be responsible for setting the vision and strategy for the creative operations function for the organization, ensuring the smooth and efficient execution of creative initiatives and projects that align with our overall business objectives. This role will work closely with the Senior Director of Creative and Brand Management and other department heads by establishing and implementing an ecosystem of resources, processes, tools, and metrics that support our current and future state. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing a culture that values operational excellence, data-driven decisions, and continuous improvements to ensure the consistency and quality of the Workiva brand at every touchpoint. This role exemplifies the ability to connect the dots across multiple channels, bringing together the information and resources needed to maintain clear and streamlined communication allowing for work to get done quickly, efficiently, and effectively.  

What You’ll Do
Workflow Optimization, Collaboration, and Communication:* Govern and support the operational needs, requirements, and requests of the creative teams to drive efficient and excellent content creation
* Identify best practices and implement standards to ensure consistency across the creative organization and improve the impact of their efforts
* Create, optimize, and share process documentation across teams with the ability to pivot due to changing workflow demands, ensuring milestones and deadlines are met and desired outcomes are achieved
* Work with Creative, Content, and Digital Leadership and Marketing Operations to ensure processes run efficiently and can scale
* Identify process gaps, make recommendations, and manage significant process improvement initiatives from start to completion
* Scale global impact strategies by implementing guidelines, creating shareable toolkits and templates, and fostering strong relationships within the global team


Project Management, Budgeting, and Cost Control:* Drive effective knowledge sharing and ways of working across multiple stakeholders, teams, and agencies to support event-related initiatives such as our user conference or commercial kickoffs
* Establish and govern an outsourcing strategy for our agency/vendor partners, including evaluations, selection, engagement, scoping, oversight, management, and performance reviews
* Effectively manage daily projects and the workload of the Creative team through adept delegation and prioritization, which involves adjusting assignments, resourcing, and deadlines as necessary
* Coordinate with Marketing team leads to align priorities, assign resources, and meet deadlines
* Coordinate and facilitate team meetings
* Monitor and champion creative consistency across all channels
* Oversee and coordinate creative production and expedite creative output and continuity
* Work closely with and report to the Senior Director of Creative on project flow and provide updates on any obstacles
* Oversee and manage day-to-day operations of asset management, translations, and available resources
* In conjunction with Procurement, establish statements of work (SOWs) and align budgets


Resource Allocation and Agency Management:* Responsible for allocating resources, such as personnel, equipment, and software, to various projects
* Develop and monitor an efficient outsourcing plan, identifying when to engage agency support
* Manage agency relationships and ensure they function as an extension of the team


Performance Tracking and Reporting:* Develop Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and metrics with department leadership and guide the organization toward achieving targets
* Develop and implement long-term creative strategies to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of campaigns and our design system
* Gather, analyze, and report data to provide brand performance analysis, success measurements, and optimization opportunities
* Collaborate with Creative, Production, Demand Generation, Marketing Operations, and other teams to develop tools and processes that support data management, reporting, and development of actionable insights.
* Establish a consistent internal communication strategy to ensure regular updates for teams and leadership.


What You’ll Need
Minimum Qualifications:
Experience* 10+ years of marketing experience, with an emphasis on creative operations and project management


Education:* Bachelor's Degree


Preferred Qualifications:* Minimum 5 years of direct people management experience preferred, including supervisor experience of managers
* SaaS company experience preferred
* Experience building processes for brand design, content creation, presentations, photos, and videos.
* Proven success in defining, launching, and governing scalable solutions that support Creative and Production operations.
* Ability to make informed decisions based on data analysis and drive motions to support performance metric efforts.
* A strong understanding of creative processes, design principles, and industry trends, and the ability to speak the technical design language
* Experience using Agile frameworks within Creative and Marketing teams preferred
* Knowledge of graphic design, copywriting, video production, and other creative disciplines
* Ability to influence and guide cross-functional teams to drive tasks and projects to completion.
* Highly proactive with a keen ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders
* Embrace ambiguity, enjoy problem-solving, identify necessary actions, and follow through accordingly.
* Familiarity with project management technologies, and experience with Monday.com a plus.
* Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite and Figma is a plus
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and ever-developing environment
* Strong attention to detail
* Executive-level communication and people skills
* Financial and business acumen
* Exceptional team-building skills, and an inspiring voice for creative bravery


Travel* 30%

  

Working Conditions & Physical Requirements* Reliable internet access for any period working remotely, not in a Workiva office
* #LI-REMOTE


How You’ll Be Rewarded:* Salary range in the US:


$147,000.00 - $250,000.00* A discretionary bonus typically paid annually
* Restricted Stock Units granted at time of hire
* 401(k) match and comprehensive employee benefits package


The salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this job in the US. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and other relevant factors.
Where You’ll Work
Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created.
We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.
At Workiva, you’ll enjoy:* Fantastic Benefits: With coverage starting day one, choose from competitive health, dental, and vision plans on the largest physician networks available.
* Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.
* Involvement: Ability to participate in Business Employee Resource Groups (Black, Hispanic, Asian, Women, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Veterans, Disabilities), Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and more
* Work-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.

  

Learn more about life at Workiva: https://www.linkedin.com/company/workiva/
Learn more about benefits: https://www.workiva.com/careers/benefits  

Workiva is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other protected characteristic. We strongly encourage and welcome people from historically marginalized groups to apply.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com. *Workiva supports employees in working where they work best - either from an office or remotely from any location within their country of employment.*
