title: Product Director, Data
description:
The world has changed. Why hasn't insurance?



Kin's mission is to reimagine home insurance **For Every New Normal.** While other insurers struggle to handle a fast-changing world, Kin is built for the future and is prepared to meet its challenges head on while helping our customers do the same.



Kin is proud to be a 4-time recipient (2021-2024) of BuiltIn Chicago's Best Mid Sized Companies to work for, and Forbes 2021, 2022, & 2023 Best Startup Employers in North America. Simply put, our people are what make us great, and we need forward-thinking, inspired game-changers like you to join us in our mission.

**So, what's the role?**



The Data Team's mission is to develop an industry leading, modern data stack that enables Kin to expand our competitive advantage. The team is accountable for building out the central nervous system accountable for improving customer experience and navigating commercial outcomes. Our charter includes Data Engineering, Data Science, and Business Analytics. It is our responsibility to build world class data infrastructure, tooling, governance, analytics, insights, and models. Our vision for Kin is a data-empowered culture where everyone at Kin is equipped with the tools, knowledge, and resources to leverage data to drive business growth at scale.



Kin's Product team is the fulcrum that takes our vision of what home insurance should be and makes it real. Our product leaders are responsible for the commercial success of our products. They straddle technology and all other business areas to ensure the right work is getting done.



We are currently looking for a Product Director to join our team. As a Product Director, you will drive and help articulate the overall vision, strategy, and roadmap of Data at Kin. You will do this by deeply understanding our Data opportunities, and collaborating very closely with our SVP of Data Science. You will need to have a strong history of collaborating across teams and organizations, including a heavy focus on business partnership, and data architecture.



Our ideal candidate has low ego, acts like an owner, and can run through walls to turn ambiguous opportunities into concrete plans while taking into account our overall commercial strategy.



You will be accountable for execution of our data strategy, and for directly managing a small team of one or more other product management folks, as well as collaborating with colleagues at all levels within the organization. You will drive key business results for our senior most stakeholders.


**A day in the life could include:**


* Leading a high-quality team of technical folks and engineers that work with you to transform the data vision into reality
* Optimizing our end to end data supply chain to understand gaps, opportunities for improvement, and how best to impact outcomes by leveraging data
* Driving the use of data as a first class product with clear metrics, and strategies to leverage data ubiquitously in the business
* Partnering with architects, product owners, data professionals, and software and data engineers to drive the implementation of new data products
* Collaborating with internal teams to find areas of opportunities for automation and machine learning
* Collaboratively driving the vision, strategy and roadmap for Data, and lead the team to execute
* Supporting the growth and development of team members


**Specifically, be responsible for:**


* Partnering with cross-functional stakeholders and partners, including Product, Data Science, Business Intelligence, Engineering, business domains, and functional operation teams, to align on Data team dependencies, roadmap, priorities, engagement model, and key processes
* Being a thought leader, identifying high impact project opportunities and process changes, and improving productivity of the overall Data Team
* Prioritizing products, features, and enhancements including short, mid, and long-term roadmaps
* Scaling data ingestion to be easier/faster; creating a deeper understanding of data quality, availability and downstream implications of gaps; and driving use of APIs, Analytics and data science across all domains at Kin
* Creating a governance model so there is clear accountability and planning around data usage
* Collaborating with the various data & domain teams to create data-driven decisions and recommendations for priorities
* Presenting recommendations to senior leadership as well as all other levels of stakeholders in the organization
* Gathering user research and inputs across business functions
* Outlining problems and proposed solutions, supported with data
* Writing user themes, epics, and/or stories that provide all of the details needed by our development teams to develop critical features
* Planning ahead to ensure team has appropriate amount of work ready and delivery timelines are known to stakeholders
* Coordinating and leading regular team and stakeholder meetings
* Defining metrics that demonstrate product success, while monitoring and responding to outcomes


**I've got the skills… but do I have the necessary ones?**


* 12+ years total work experience
* 8+ years product management experience, preferably led a data product function.
* 5+ years experience managing people and teams
* Strong understanding of the data supply chain from ingestion to consumption.
* Experience with a modern data stack and cloud data technologies.
* Extensive experience in working collaboratively to lead horizontal or platform functions within a high growth venture backed organization
* Extensive experience working with Agile product, data, and engineering teams in startup and/or rapid-growth environments
* Product management experience at B2C or other software/technology companies
* Ability to turn incomplete, conflicting, or ambiguous inputs into concrete action plans
* Ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
* Entrepreneurial mindset and self-starter attitude
* Experience owning process management or process improvement projects
* Self-starter with high tolerance for ambiguity


**Oh, and don't worry, we've got you covered!**


* Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance
* Flexible PTO policy
* Remote work
* Generous equity package
* 401K with company match
* Parental leave
* Continuing education and professional development
* The excitement of joining a high-growth Insurtech company and seeing your work make an impact

### **About Kin**



In an industry that hasn't budged in more than 100 years, our technology transforms the user experience, cuts inefficiencies that waste billions of consumer dollars, and customizes coverage homeowners want. We believe insurance was always meant to be a digital product – we're making that a reality.



Our approach to the industry makes us unique, and the people at Kin help us excel. We're a team of problem solvers, collaborators, builders, and dreamers who are passionate about creating positive change in the lives of our customers and in our industry. Kin is more than just our name – it's how we treat each other. That's one of the many reasons we've been recognized as a great place to work by Built In, Forbes, and Fast Company.

  


### **EEOC Statement**



Kin is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We don't just accept difference – we honor it, nurture it, and celebrate it. We don't discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.



Kin encourages applications from all backgrounds, communities and industries, and are committed to having a team that is made up of diverse skills, experiences and abilities.

  



#LI-Remote

title: Director of IT
description:
**About Lilac Solutions, Inc.**



Lilac Solutions is a lithium extraction technology company focused on scaling lithium production for the electric vehicle era. Lilac solves the critical technology problems which today prevent development of the world's largest lithium resources: low yields, high costs, slow start-up, poor reliability, and massive environmental impacts. Lilac's technology represents such a step-change in performance and cost that it also unlocks the development of new unconventional lithium deposits with low lithium grades and high impurities, which have historically been impossible to produce. In 2021, Lilac raised $150M in Series B financing from investors including T. Rowe Price, Lowercarbon Capital, Breakthrough Energy Ventures, Sumitomo, BMW and SK Materials. Lilac is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace.

**Job Description**



The IT Director will oversee all IT (Information Technology) functions in our company. You will oversee managing the company's IT team (IT operations/Help Desk and Solutions) as well as work on the implementation of new IT systems and policies in support of Lilac's business. As a senior member of our staff you will be a trusted advisor to the executive leadership on all matters related to IT. The ideal candidate will be experienced in creating and implementing IT policies and systems that will meet objectives while influencing and motivating those around you to adopt them. This role is preferred to be based in Oakland, CA, but is also open to candidates located in Fernley, NV, Salt Lake City, UT, or remote candidates.



The goal is to ensure IT systems and people are effective and functioning within the limits of budget, time and specifications of the company.


**Job Responsibilities**


* Manage and develop a team of [3] IT Operations and [1] IT Solutions professionals to deliver effective IT services for Lilac, including but not limited to: Help Desk, Asset Management (Hardware & Software), Information Security, Data Management, Network & infrastructure Solutions, scoping, impanation and management of SaaS projects, etc.
* Devise and establish IT policies and systems to support the implementation of strategies set by upper management
* Analyze the business requirements of all departments to determine their technology needs and deliver solutions as appropriate
* Purchase efficient and cost-effective technological equipment and software
* Inspect the use of technological equipment and software to ensure functionality and efficiency
* Identify the need for upgrades, configurations or new systems and report to upper management
* Control budget and report on expenditure
* Assist in building relationships with vendors and creating cost-efficient contracts


**Candidate Qualifications**


* 8+ years of experience working in IT operations, supervising technology teams, and overseeing large information technology projects. Proven experience as IT director or similar role is a plus
* BSc/BA in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field; MSc/MA is a plus
* Excellent understanding of computer systems, cyber-security, network and systems administration, databases and data storage systems, and telecommunications systems
* Experience in controlling information technology budget
* Excellent organizational and leadership skills
* Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate with teams across the entire organization
* Experience working for a high growth company rapidly scaling headcount and evolving IT needs
* Experience working in an international organization
* Commitment to fostering a positive and high-performance company culture


**Compensation**


* Salary range: $175-$225k annually (commensurate with experience)
* Stock options
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* Long-term disability insurance
* 401k with pre- and post-tax investing options
* Flexible Paid Time Off Policy
* Eight weeks of Paid Parental Leave
* Onsite Gym and Daily Catered Lunch for Oakland Employees
* Monthly phone stipend
* Private secured parking with EV charging stations


**EEO Statement**



Lilac Solutions is committed to providing a professional work environment free from discrimination and harassment, including discrimination and harassment based on a protected category, and an environment free from retaliation for participating in any protected activity. Lilac Solutions is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment.

title: Director of Technology
description:
**Job Description: Director of Technology**

**Company Overview:** MyeTech, your single source of truth for technology news on AI trends, gaming, hardware, software reviews, and more. Based in the U.S., our content reach expands globally, yet offers catered solutions to U.S. customers. With strong deliverables for blogging, digital marketing, and e-commerce, MyeTech has positioned itself to become a premium outlet for tech consumption.

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a dynamic and experienced **Director of Technology** to lead our software development team. As the Director of Technology, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our technical vision, driving innovation, and ensuring successful project execution. Your expertise in program management, project management, and team leadership will be critical to our organization’s success.

**Responsibilities:**

**Program Management and Project Leadership:**

* Oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of software projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and timelines.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project scope, objectives, and success criteria.
* Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement by optimizing processes and methodologies.

**Software Development and Technical Guidance:**

* Provide hands-on technical guidance to the development team, including software engineers, API specialists, and automation experts.
* Lead by example, contributing to code reviews, architecture discussions, and system design.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to drive innovation within the organization.

**Team Management:**

* Manage and mentor a team of junior developers, fostering their growth and professional development.
* Conduct regular performance evaluations, set goals, and provide constructive feedback.
* Create a collaborative and inclusive environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.

**Qualifications:**

* **Full-Stack Software Development Experience:**
* Proficiency in front-end, back-end, and database development.
* Strong understanding of modern web technologies, frameworks, and APIs.
* **Program and Project Management Skills:**
* Demonstrated experience managing complex software projects from inception to delivery.
* Ability to balance competing priorities, allocate resources effectively, and meet deadlines.
* **Leadership and Coaching:**
* Proven ability to lead and inspire a technical team.
* Experience coaching and mentoring junior developers.
* **Location Requirement:**
* Candidates must be based in the United States.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience working in an agile development environment.
* Familiarity with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Previous exposure to DevOps practices and automation scripting.

If you are passionate about technology, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are ready to make a significant impact, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us as we shape the future of our organization through innovation and excellence!

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $116,000.00 - $350,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Parental leave
* Referral program

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract
* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay
* Monthly bonus
* Performance bonus
* Quarterly bonus
* Yearly bonus

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Application Question(s):

* Do you have, at minimum, at least 4+ years of full-stack software development experience? Though this is a remote position, you must reside within the 48-continental states of the U.S. in order to be considered. Despite an estimated pay range of $116K-$350K, note that this position does not provide a base salary and is contracted on a revenue share basis, which could exceed these values. Though the potential to receive a 7-figure annual pay exists, contractors would not be provided traditional benefits such as 401K, medical, dental, etc. Are you comfortable working on a revenue share basis?

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Head of Corporate IT Operations
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY:**



Nymbus (https://nymbus.com/) isn't just a leader in fintech; we're a community of innovators passionate about reimagining banking. Our award-winning modern core platform and cloud-based technology serve as the backbone for financial institutions eager to modernize and excel.



Here, you won't just be part of a tech revolution; you'll be at the helm, driving change. You'll fit right in if you're a creative thinker eager to lessen technical debt and elevate agility for banks and credit unions. Our culture thrives on collaboration, integrity, and a client-first approach.



Your journey with us won't simply advance your career; it will offer the chance to shape an industry alongside like-minded professionals. We're excited to consider you a key player in this transformative chapter. Thank you for contemplating a role with Nymbus.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**:



We are a remote first company with the exception of a few positions being onsite in our designated locations. The positions which are remote, you will need to be able to travel a few times a year. You may be required at times to visit client sites or attend meetings at designated locations with your team members.

  


**POSITION SUMMARY**



The Nymbus IT Corporate team is composed of engineers responsible for the tools supporting the infrastructure of the company. Our team culture empowers you to take ownership of your work and its outcome. This is a unique opportunity for a self-motivated individual to work with an innovative team. We are looking for candidates who can work collaboratively to resolve problems and have a high tolerance for complexity and ambiguity.



You must be able to manage an internal corporate IT department including:


* IT systems technology and control structures,
* Manage hardware inventory in US, Mexico and overseas
* Advanced knowledge of Windows and Mac operating systems,
* Experience in IT support and ticketing procedures


This is more than a hands-on technical and leadership role, where you will be expected to take charge of problems, and take the initiative to design, recommend, and deliver solutions. We run teams that have a strong desire to learn, innovate, research, and apply new technologies and methods as needed. We are looking for candidates who enjoy mentoring teammates and developing those around them.


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Provide strategic direction for the company's corporate systems
* Set and manage Enterprise IT priorities and provide regular status reporting to management and key stakeholders
* Develop cost effective, innovative solutions to technology challenges across the company
* Develop and maintain departmental system documentation and procedures
* Lead and mentor IT staff. Manage the IT helpdesk. Lead goal setting and performance review processes for the team.
* Represent IT to customers, company's leadership team, and auditors. Serve as the primary escalation point for IT needs across the company
* Serve as system administrator for a variety of corporate systems, including Identity Providers, SaaS and on-premise applications, remote desktop environments and end user workstations
* Ensure appropriate change management procedures are followed
* Manage hardware inventory including Mac, PC, and office equipment in the US, Mexico and overseas
* Lead procurement efforts for corporate systems (identifying and selecting vendors, negotiating prices and terms, contract review and coordinating required approvals)
* Manage the IT budget and find opportunities to optimize spend
* Manage key technology projects including new implementations, upgrades, conversions and decommissions
* Identify, investigate & implement new tools/products/services.
* Incident & Escalation Management – surrounding email and phone outages.
* Conduct periodic reviews of IT Support and ticketing performance
* Work directly with internal risk and compliance teams to ensure compliance with controls and banking related regulatory policies.
* Create (hire), grow, train, and manage a high-performance team

  


**SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:**


* Oversee a SaaS or PaaS IT Operations for 3+ years
* Bachelor's degree with 10+ years of relevant professional experience with progressively increasing responsibility in IT delivery
* Demonstrates thought leader-level abilities as a team leader
* Proficient in IT systems terminology
* Advance background in ERP
* Experience in data encryption
* Experience with global on-premise cloud compute operations
* Supporting annual compliance activities with knowledge of ISO-27001 SOX, PCI, SOC-2, HiTrust etc; and
* Demonstrating hands-on industry experience within one or more of the following cloud platforms: Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform

  


**SALARY & BENEFITS:**


* $155,000 - $175,000 Annual Salary
* Annual Cash Bonus and Equity Options commensurate with the role level and experience
* 100% Fully Remote
* Robust 401(k) plan with company match
* Insurance - Health, Dental and Vision (Nymbus covers 100% of the Healthcare and Basic Dental premiums)
* Time Off Nymbus (The Company) offers six types of Time Off to our employees:
+ 1. Flexible Paid Time Off (Flexible PTO) - no cap per year
+ 2. Sick Time - seven (7) paid Sick days per calendar year
+ 3. Holidays - eleven (11) paid Fixed Holidays per calendar year
+ 4. Jury Duty
+ 5. Volunteer Time - one (1) day per calendar year
+ 6. Leaves of Absence

Ready to join? We invite you to watch this video and learn who we are and how we build and innovates together!



Let's Go!

title: Product Director
description:
**About Origence**


With 30 years at the forefront of fintech innovation, we specialize in SaaS lending solutions that lead the industry. Our core mission is customer-centric, focusing on empowering Credit Unions across the United States with the tools to offer accessible, competitive lending services. We're deeply committed to enhancing the financial ecosystem for a broad network of credit unions, members and auto dealers. We invest in our greatest assets, our employees, and foster a culture of innovation and ownership through freedom and responsibility. We celebrate fiscal accountability, operational rigor and efficiency to create a sustainably healthy and robust business for the long term.


The **Product Director** takes strategic ownership of the Digital Lending Platform. Specifically, the PD will own the research & strategy stage as well as lead the progressive elaboration process including feature analysis & business scope. The PD is responsible for the digital platform’s roadmap. Before the Agile team builds it properly, the Product Director ensures it is the right thing to do.


**What You’ll Be Doing:**


**Research & Strategy**:


* The PD is responsible for the digital platform’s competitive analysis. Moreover, customer research and validation are core competencies including conducting market research through on-going visits with customers and prospects. In collaboration with a UX Designer, the PD is responsible persona development, journey mapping, rapid prototyping, and the EPIC business case.


**Progressive Elaboration**:


* As agile teams are sprinting, the PD in collaboration with a Development Architect is working on EPIC creation, acceptance criteria and portfolio architecture (Feature Analysis). Moreover, the PD leads high level business design, rapid prototyping, and t-shirt sizing with assistance from a UX designer. (Business Scope). The PD serves as an escalation path. If further clarification on any business-related functionality and rules cannot be answered by the Product Owner, then the issue is escalated to the Product Manager.


**Roadmap & Product Pricing**:


* Ensures visibility and accuracy of the digital platform’s roadmap. Prioritization of EPICs and works with Dev Architect to understand the technical dependencies. Moreover, owns and understand targeted component pricing in relation to the marketplace.


**The Ideal Candidate:**


**Education:**


* B.A or B.S degree required
* M.B.A degree preferred

**Experience:**


* Success as Product Manager, Product Owner or Sr. Business Analyst developing or launching new features
* A minimum of six years’ experience in software, system and/or business analysis
* Knowledge of financial industry and/or credit union operations


**Specialized Skills:**


* Strong Soft Skills to quickly gain the support of internal, clients and stakeholders
* Ability to interface with credit union and internal management for the purpose of creating business plans
* Strong organizational skills with ability to develop strategies, set objectives, and manage to results
* Proactive leadership style to identify opportunities and work across organization
* Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
* Must be able to travel 20% of the time


**Why you should apply:**


* Flexible Working Environment
* Paid Time Off
* 401k (8% match)
* College Tuition Benefits/ Tuition Reimbursement
* Good Benefits options
* Company Culture! Cultural and Holiday celebrations, Theme days like Star Wars Day & Bring your Kids to Work Day, Monthly Townhalls and Quarterly Company Meetings that ensure awareness, inclusion, and transparency.


The starting salary range for this full-time position is $147900 - $184900 per year. This base pay will take into consideration internal equity, candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge and experience among other factors. Origence maintains a highly competitive compensation program. Under company guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual bonus to provide an incentive to achieve targeted goals. Bonuses are awarded at company’s discretion on an individual basis.


Origence is an equal opportunity employer. All recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, benefits, discipline, and other terms and conditions of employment will be based upon an individuals’ qualifications regardless of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, military service, marital status, pregnancy, age, protected medical condition, genetic information, disability or any other category protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Senior Director Partnerships K4B
description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world's leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We're also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.



As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each others strengths and insights. Together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.



KAYAK is seeking a highly-motivated Senior Director to help drive its corporate travel online booking tool, KAYAK for Business. This person will report to the SVP of Strategic Partnerships and K4B and work closely to meet Company's goals and milestones through existing and new partnerships.



The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of consumer behavior, superior analytical and business development skills, and the ability to effectively communicate with KAYAK's engineering, design, and commercial teams. Candidates must be self-starters and able to thrive in an agile, fast-paced and data-driven environment. If you are a numbers junkie who is passionate about business and technology, this might be the perfect role for you.


**This position will be based in the remote US located on the east coast.**


**In this role, you will:**

* Be a proven leader that can effectively coach and lead the K4B team to meet and exceed K4B's objectives and key results.
* Own the KAYAK for Business P&L. Interpret performance to uncover opportunities and develop strategy forward.
* Build, manage and maintain a portfolio of Enterprise partners.
* Leverage data to optimize customer performance, drive revenue and improve the user experience
* Develop strong relationships and work cross-functionally with the KAYAK commercial, product, marketing and engineering teams
* Measure product performance using business and user metrics, establish relevant reports
* Monitor the competitive landscape of online corporate travel tools, identify KAYAK weaknesses, formulate/implement a plan to close the gap
* Influence internal and external partners from a wide range of audiences, including our third parties partners, senior leadership within KAYAK, and other sister companies
* Evaluate and negotiate complex, high visibility contracts and help resolve contract disputes

  




**Please apply if:**

* Embody the KAYAK ethos - Be Bold, Love Numbers, Win As One
* 10+ years of business development with partner management or sales experience in the corporate travel industry
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with a willingness to "roll up your sleeves" to investigate issues and provide creative solutions
* Ability to manage complex, multi-faceted relationships
* Proven track record of exceeding expectations through superior execution and project management
* Ability to manage projects of varying size and scope simultaneously, while prioritizing appropriately
* Ability to develop new ideas and work cross-functionally with team members to see projects through to completion
* Excellent negotiator and target driven
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must with experience presenting to internal and external partners
* Likes working in an unstructured, fast-paced environment
* Highly proficient in Excel, PowerPoint
* High attention to detail.
* Experience working with global teams in multiple locations
* BA/BS degree required
* Travel requirement – 25%

**Benefits**


* Generous paid vacation
* Day off on your birthday
* Company matched retirement plans
* Health, dental and vision insurance plans
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Headspace Subscription
* Drinks, coffee, snacks, games etc.
* Weekly Catered Lunches
* Free massages from professional massage therapists
* Universal Paid Parental Leave

**Note** **for Connecticut Residents**: To receive estimated salary range information for this role pursuant to Connecticut's "An Act Concerning the Disclosure of Salary Range for a Vacant Position", email CTCareers@kayak.com. You must include the name of the position in your request.



There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. The range for this remote United States based role is $200,000-$255,000.



In addition to a competitive base salary, roles are eligible for additional compensation and benefits including: annual cash bonus, equity grant; health benefits; flexible spending account; retirement benefits; life insurance; paid time off (including PTO, paid sick leave, medical leave, bereavement leave, floating holidays and paid holidays); and parental leave and benefits.


**Diversity and Inclusion**



We aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more creative ideas, products, and better outcomes for our team members. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

  



#LI-BB1

title: Director of IT, Financial Systems
description:
As a leading mountain resort operator with over 40 resorts in sixteen states and four countries. We exist to create an *Experience of a Lifetime* for our employees, so they can, in turn, provide and *Experience of a Lifetime* for our guests. We are looking for leaders, innovators, creators, and ambitious professionals to join our talented team. If you’re ready to pursue your fullest potential, we want to get to know you!

  

Many of our Corporate function teams can now live and work in any of the states in which Vail Resorts currently operates\\* – enabling flexible remote work alongside a commitment to building and maintaining strong culture both in person and virtually. If you’re ready to pursue your fullest potential, we want to get to know you. Find your purpose with us at www.vailresortscareers.com.

  

Candidates for year-round positions are reviewed on a rolling basis. Applications will be accepted up to 90 days after the posting date, or until the position is filled (whichever is first).

 **Job Classification:** Year Round

**Job Type:** Full Time

**Location:** Remote

 **Job Summary:**


The Finance Technology Director is responsible for partnering across IT and Finance to deliver key initiatives for the organization. This talented individual will manage the overall finance technology roadmap and project portfolio, and will deliver forward-thinking creative solutions that help to drive the technology strategy. Experience with Finance application transformations (on-prem to the cloud) is preferred.


The Director’s day-to-day activities include delivery of large projects, ongoing releases, rigorous prioritization, vendor release management and planning, and alignment of internal and vendor roadmaps to our business objectives and IT resources.


This role is responsible for managing and mentoring a team of Project Managers, Solution Architects, Developers and Business Analyst professionals to deliver scalable and efficient processes and expanded capabilities to the Finance organization.


This is a leadership role with direct interactions with the CIO and CFO and their leadership teams, reporting to the VP of Line of Business Technology.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

  

 Drive:


* Develop and drive the accountability of business objectives and supporting IT initiatives.
* Provide project/program facilitation and oversight; facilitate agreement on objectives and success measures, provide overall project/program issue resolution and roadblock removal.
* Ensure timely and consistent communication to facilitate a clear understanding of ongoing projects and their prioritization within the organization
* Assist in the finalization of the Finance, Accounting, and Procurement business strategy
* Lead and organize efforts to plan and develop key events to achieve desired outcomes (e.g., management and leadership meetings). Facilitate and manage the definition of agendas, materials, review cycles, timelines, etc.
* Deliver high-impact solutions by identifying key issues, defining appropriate work structure, and driving workable recommendations that create value
* Partner closely at the Vice President and Director levels to support key areas of work that focus on highest priorities, including suggesting and managing the best time allocation and use of group meetings


Connect:


* Inspire trust and build strong, authentic, productive relationships within the Finance Technology team and with key stakeholders.
* Effectively engage and collaborate with leadership across the organization to develop, define and build on innovative ideas and business priorities.
* Engage broadly and deeply across the organization to connect information and people to drive enterprise projects, programs, and initiatives
* Use expertise and relationships to influence key stakeholders


Develop:


* Create an environment of continual improvement both inside and outside of direct team.
* Demonstrate the ability to learn and develop as a self-starter requiring little direction. We are looking for someone who shows the potential to do more and is a natural leader.


Out Front:

* Anticipate the needs of key leadership, facilitate and motivate those around you to identify solutions that improve the employee experience and advance business objectives.

Re-Imagine:

* Partner with Finance stakeholders to understand their drivers and needs, and uses that knowledge and those relationships to drive effective prioritization and roadmaps for delivery
* Bring new ideas, methods, and approaches to Vail Resorts and this role. Leverage expertise to challenge the status quo and drive decisions and actions necessary to improve our business processes and related technology.


 Passion:

* Demonstrate an unyielding passion for the employee experience, culture, mission and vision. Lead by example and inspire others to follow.

 **Job Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree in business, technology, or related field
* 8+ years of relevant work experience including proven ability to successfully lead and oversee critical projects and multi-faceted efforts
* Experience managing ERP’s (ex: PeopleSoft, SAP, Workday) and other smaller applications (ex: Coupa, Concur, Planful, OnBase) is preferred
* Strong working knowledge and understanding of key concepts in Finance, Accounting, and Procure-to-Pay business areas
* Authentically connect with and lead others who do not directly report to you
* Successful partnership with Director and VP levels within Finance, Accounting, Procurement, and related technology leaders
* Business advocate with a deep understanding in technology with experience delivering complex projects

  



**Additional Requirements**


Leadership:

* Ability to lead a dynamic team – providing coaching, timely feedback, and opportunities for the team members
* Ability to drive strategy, vision, direction, and prioritization on enterprise-wide projects and programs at the Executive level.
* Can manage initiatives from concept through to completion, including the development and presentation of a business case.
* Applies systems thinking to generate new thoughts and opportunities; has ability to build on strategic and innovative thoughts/ideas.
* Informed on industry standards and practices, and a forward thinker on new innovative approaches.
* Experience in digital transformations is preferred


Project Management:

* Ability to socialize and manage a portfolio of projects supporting stated strategic objectives.
* Manage business operational impacts as well as technical components of the program or project.
* Work with internal and external teams to develop and execute a comprehensive QA approach for enterprise-wide projects and programs.
* Provide vision and leadership regarding organizational design and resourcing of large, complex and undefined enterprise-wide initiatives including all aspects of management from vision through execution.
* Ability to manage/oversee internal and contract resources across multiple projects.


Financials:

* Manage enterprise-wide programs with complex financial models including internal and external stakeholders and complex contract negotiation.
* Participate in the annual expense and capital budgeting processes for both Finance and IT
* Manage team’s OpEx budget and the capital budgets associated with different initiatives


Vendor Management:

* Adept at managing relationships with vendors and other external partners, influencing product roadmaps, resourcing, and financial management to ensure the best possible long-term outcomes.
* Experience negotiating vendor contracts.

  

The expected Total Compensation for this role is $129,900 - $166,950 + annual bonus + equity. Individual compensation decisions are based on a variety of factors.

  

The perks include a free ski pass, and a set of benefits including...

* Medical, Dental, Vision insurance, and a 401(k) retirement plan
* Hourly employees are generally eligible for accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) and Sick Time. Salaried employees are generally eligible for Flexible Time Off (FTO)
* Paid Parental Leave for eligible mothers and fathers
* Healthcare & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
* Life, AD&D, and disability insurance

 **Reach Your Peak at Vail Resorts.** At Vail Resorts, our team is made whole by the brave, passionate individuals who ambitiously push boundaries and challenge the status quo. Whether you’re looking for seasonal work or the career of a lifetime, join us today to reach your peak.

* ***Remote work is currently permitted from British Columbia and the 16 U.S. states in which we currently operate. This includes: California, Colorado, Indiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, Nevada, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Utah, Vermont, Washington State, Wisconsin, and Wyoming. Please note that the ability to work remotely, and the particulars related to such work, are subject to change at any time; and, accordingly, the Company reserves the right to change its policies and/or require in-person/in-office work at any time in its sole discretion.***

 *Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law.*

title: Director of Sustainability
description:
***As an essential business, Anomatic produces innovative and sustainable packaging for today’s biggest brands. By leveraging over five decades of manufacturing*** ***expertise and employing an extensive technologies portfolio, we design, manufacture, and finish incomparable stock and customized solutions for numerous markets.***


**Location:** Open to onsite (New Albany, Ohio), Hybrid, or Remote within the United States
**Reports to:** Chief Executive Officer
\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_
**Summary/Objective**
Reporting directly to the Chief Executive Officer, the Director of Sustainability will lead our commitment to sustainable practices, playing a pivotal role in shaping the future of our products and manufacturing processes. The Director’s primary responsibility will be to oversee and drive the company's sustainability initiatives, ensuring the organization’s business practices and products are aligned with long-term environmental goals.
**Essential Functions -** *Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*
* Establish and oversee the comprehensive mission, execution, and effectiveness of sustainability programs and initiatives internally across Anomatic manufacturing plants in the US and China, as well as aligning the goals with external stakeholders
* Proposes and implements strategies to address various environmental concerns including energy use, conservation, reduction of pollution, recycling, building and facility design, and general education on sustainability.
* Define and communicate purpose to drive sustainable transformation while fostering internal cultural change.
* Assesses and analyzes company policies and processes to identify areas in and processes to which improvements can be made in accordance with the organization's commitment to sustainability.
* Oversees Anomatic Product Safety programs and reporting: REACH, FDA, Proposition 65, CONEG, RCLA, etc.
* Collaborates with appropriate departmental managers to facilitate CSR/ESG monitoring and reporting.
* Provides commercial team support for customer sustainability activities.
* Drafts and prepares reports, presentations, and proposals including external CSR and Sustainability audits & reports (Annual & Quarterly CSR/ESG/Sustainability reporting, EcoVadis, CDP, TRASCE, Intertek, etc.).
* Identifies and facilitates training as needed.

**Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s Degree (B.A./B.S.) from four-year college or university in technical field, Biological or Environmental Science/Engineering, Physical Sciences, Engineering, Material Science, or related field, preferred
* Five or more years of demonstrated leadership in developing and implementing sustainability programs in a manufacturing environment required
* Experience in consumer product sustainability program management (Cosmetics & Personal care, Food packaging, Household consumer product packaging, Consumer electronics).
* Thorough and current knowledge of sustainability practices, and applicable laws and regulations.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills with the ability to drive initiatives from conception to implementation.
* Professional certifications in sustainability, project management ISO management preferred.
* Strong materials and manufacturing knowledge.
* Knowledge of ISO accredited management systems (9001, 14001, 14064, 45001, 26000, etc.).
* Ability to travel internationally, particularly between Europe, China and the United States

**Competencies**
* Strong work ethic, initiative, and commitment to the business
* Superior organization skills, ability to prioritize, multi-task and delegate
* Positive attitude and teamwork among all internal and external customers

**Supervisory Responsibility**
This position has direct supervisory responsibilities: No
**Travel**
This position requires travel: Yes, domestic and international
**Salary Information**
This role offers a competitive salary in the range of $120,000 to $200,000 and is eligible for bonus compensation as well. Actual compensation depends on various factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate's experience and qualifications.

**WHO WE ARE.**
**Our VISION**
“To inspire the world of consumer packaging”.
**Our MISSION**
“We bring passion to packaging”.
**Our VALUES**
* People & Safety First
* Integrity, Respect, Trust
* Continuous Improvement Mindset
* Accountability
* Collaboration


**Benefits you can expect from Anomatic:**


* Competitive Pay and bonus
* Career Growth
* Health Coverage Starting Your First Day
* 401K with Company Match, to help save for the future
* Paid Time Off to Enjoy Family or Hobbies
* Gym Membership Reimbursements, to help you stay active
* Training, to help hone skills
* Many more!


*Anomatic takes pride in creating a safe and inclusive environment that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees and the communities in which they live. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.*
*#1Anomatic*

title: Director, Technology-SRE
description:
TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.
  

  

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.


**Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At TriNet, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every single qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.**  

  

**JOB SUMMARY**  

We are seeking a visionary and strategic Director of Technology to lead our technology team. As the Director of Technology, you will be responsible for shaping and executing the technology strategy, driving innovation, and ensuring the successful implementation of technology initiatives. You will lead a team of talented professionals, fostering collaboration, and driving a culture of excellence. If you are a dynamic leader with a deep understanding of technology trends and a track record of driving organizational transformation, we invite you to apply for this position.
  

  

**Essential Duties/Responsibilities**   

% TIME
  

* Technology Strategy and Vision: Develop and execute a technology strategy aligned with the organization's goals and objectives. Stay informed about emerging technology trends and drive innovation to keep the organization at the forefront of technological advancements. 5%
* Team Leadership and Development: Lead and mentor a team of technology professionals, including engineers, architects, and project managers. Foster a high-performing team culture, promote continuous learning, and ensure the development of technical expertise and leadership capabilities. 5%
* Technology Planning and Execution: Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify technology needs and prioritize initiatives. Develop technology roadmaps and project plans, ensuring successful execution and delivery within defined timelines and budgets. 5%
* Collaboration and Stakeholder Management: Partner with cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Operations, and Executive Leadership, to align technology initiatives with business objectives. Build strong relationships with stakeholders, communicate effectively, and manage expectations. 5%
* Technology Governance and Compliance: Establish and enforce technology governance frameworks, policies, and procedures. Ensure compliance with relevant industry regulations and data protection standards. 5%
* Technology Architecture and Design: Drive the design and architecture of technology solutions, ensuring scalability, security, and performance. Evaluate and select appropriate technologies, platforms, and tools to meet business requirements. 5%
* Vendor Management and Partnership: Identify and manage relationships with technology vendors, service providers, and external partners. Collaborate on strategic initiatives, negotiate contracts, and ensure effective service delivery and value. 5%
* Technology Operations and Support: Oversee the operation and support of technology systems and infrastructure. Collaborate with Operations teams to ensure high availability, performance, and efficient incident resolution. 5%
* Technology Innovation and Continuous Improvement: Promote a culture of innovation, encouraging the exploration and adoption of new technologies and methodologies. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, reliability, and user experience. 5%
* Technology Budget and Resource Management: Develop and manage the technology budget, ensuring effective allocation of resources and investments. Monitor and report on financial performance, identify cost-saving opportunities, and optimize resource utilization. 5%

  

**Required for All Jobs**  

* Performs other duties as assigned
* Complies with all policies and standards

  

**QUALIFICATIONS**  

  

**Education**  

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience, advanced degree preferred
  

  

**Work Experience**  

Experience:
  

Typically 10+ years: Proven experience in a leadership role within the technology industry.
  

  

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**  

* Deep understanding of technology trends, emerging technologies, and their impact on business.
* Strong strategic thinking and ability to align technology initiatives with business goals.
* Track record of driving successful technology transformations and driving innovation.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire.
* Strong collaboration and stakeholder management abilities, with exceptional communication skills.
* Extensive experience in technology planning, budgeting, and resource management.
* Proficiency in project management methodologies and best practices.
* Knowledge of technology governance, compliance, and security best practices.
* Familiarity with cloud computing, software development lifecycles, and IT infrastructure.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills, with the ability to prioritize and execute.
* Exceptional business acumen and ability to drive technology initiatives that deliver value.

  

**Work Environment**  

Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable home or office setting. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable persons with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  

Position may be considered remote and require reliable and consistent internet service.
  

  

The salary range for this role is $137,100 to $362,000. The candidate’s final salary offer will be based on the candidate’s skills, education, work location and experience.
A candidate’s compensation may also include bonuses consistent with TriNet’s corporate bonus plan.


Additionally, subject to applicable eligibility requirements, TriNet offers permanent full-time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, a 401(K) savings plan, an employee stock purchase plan, eleven (11) Company observed holidays, PTO and a comprehensive leave program. Please click the following link for detailed information about our benefits offerings: https://www.trinet.com/documents/blt5b61a1040aae1904
  

  

Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity.


TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact recruiting@trinet.com to request such an accommodation.

title: Director of IT Programming (100% Remote)
description:
**Director of Programming**

**Job Type:** Full Time

**Hours:** 9:00 AM-6:00 PM EST (After hours as needed)

**Salary:** 125-140K annually

**Benefits:** Available after 90 days for full-time employees

**About AnswerNet** 

AnswerNet is the brand name for the AnswerNet family of companies including AnswerNet, Inc., New AnswerNet Inc., Cerida Investment Corp., ECC (Energy Choice California), Synergy Solutions, TPV.com, and Ansercomm, to name a few. Together with our affiliates, AnswerNet operates more than 31 contact centers within the continental United States and Canada. We provide a vast range of services to optimize telephone answering services, appointment setting and confirmation, customer support, third-party verification, sales, lead qualification, market research, and a host of other contact management solutions. In all, AnswerNet has more than 10,000 satisfied clients and we process over 125 million interactions per year.

**Job Summary:**

Oversees the Programming and Business Intelligence functions in the Technical Services Department. The director takes the lead on all Programming systems and ensures the department aligns with the company's priorities. We are seeking a highly skilled individual with a profound understanding of telecom operations, particularly in the realm of call center technology. This role is integral to our organization, as it involves the orchestration of various facets of our call center.

**Reports to:**

Vice President of Technical Services

**Responsibilities:**

* Business Intelligence Strategy:
* Develop and implement a comprehensive business intelligence strategy that aligns with AnswerNet's overall business goals and objectives.
* Collaborate with senior management to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and data-driven insights to drive strategic decision-making across the organization.
* Oversee the design and maintenance of data warehouses and databases to ensure the availability of accurate and timely business data.
* Data Analytics and Reporting:
* Lead a team of data analysts to conduct in-depth data analysis, data mining, and statistical modeling to provide actionable insights and recommendations to various stakeholders.
* Develop interactive and user-friendly dashboards and reports to enable real-time monitoring of key performance metrics and business trends.
* Present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences, including executives and department heads.
* Software Development and Programming:
* Manage and mentor a team of programmers responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications and tools that support the company's business operations.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define software requirements, develop project timelines, and ensure successful implementation of software solutions.
* Oversee the integration of software applications with existing systems to enhance efficiency and data integrity.
* Grasp and Internalize Long-term Goals and Strategic Vision:

· Familiarize yourself with the organization's long-term goals, mission statement, and strategic vision.

· Internalize the overarching vision to align your actions and decisions accordingly

* Collaborate with the President and CEO:

· Engage in regular discussions with the President and CEO to gain insights into their vision for the organization.

· Seek clarification on any aspects of the vision that require further understanding.

· Actively participate in strategic planning sessions to ensure alignment with the overall mission and objectives.

* Process Improvement:
* Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation within the organization, leveraging programming and technology solutions.
* Work closely with department heads to understand their specific needs and provide innovative solutions to improve workflows and enhance operational efficiency.
* Data Security and Compliance:
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and industry best practices in data security.
* Implement robust data protection measures and establish protocols for data access and sharing within the organization.
* Team Management:
* Recruit, train, and develop a high-performing team of programmers and data analysts.
* Foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment that promotes creativity, growth, and continuous learning.
* Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide feedback to team members to enhance their professional development.

7. Telecom Solutioning Manager:

· Spearhead the end-to-end solutioning process within our telecommunication environment, from initial ideation to final implementation, ensuring that each state is meticulously executed to deliver optimal outcomes.

· Lead and inspire a team in crafting innovative solutions to address telecom challenges.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
* Strong experience in a leadership position for telephone answering service or associated technologies as a service provider.
* Expert experience with including Twilio and other upstream service providers.
* Proven experience (minimum 5 years) in leading business intelligence, data analytics, and software development teams in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Strong knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, SQL) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
* Expert level in SIP communication.
* Expertise in data modeling, statistical analysis, and machine learning concepts.
* Demonstrated ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business recommendations.
* Solid understanding of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and data security best practices.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a remote work environment.

Join AnswerNet as the Director of Programming and Business Intelligence and play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making and technological advancements within our organization. Together, let's enhance customer experiences and achieve new heights of success in the customer service solutions industry.

**WAH Requirements:**

· PC/Laptop with at least Windows 10 (Apple/Mac products, Chromebooks, and tablets are not compatible)

· Hard-wired high-speed internet connection (ethernet cable)

· USB-connected Headset

· Webcam

· Quiet dedicated place to work free from distractions including pets and children.

**Location:**

Commutable to Willow Grove, PA, or can be 100% remote. Must be US based.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 7 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Please explain your experience with Call center/Telecom software.

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Python, Java, SQL, Tableau, Power BI: 5 years (Required)
* Data Analytics and Reporting: 5 years (Required)
* Data Security and Compliance: 5 years (Required)
* Leadership: 5 years (Required)
* Twilio/SIP/VOIP: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Wealth (Retirement) IT Director
description:
*Together we fight for everyone’s opportunity for a better financial future.*
We will do this together — with customers, partners and colleagues. We will fight for others, not against: We will stand up for and champion everyone’s access to opportunities. The status quo is not good enough … we believe every individual and every community deserves access to financial opportunities. We are determined to support both individuals and communities in reaching a better financial future. We know that reaching this future depends on our actions today.
Like our Purpose Statement, Voya believes in being bold and committed to action. We are committed to a work environment where the differences that we are born with — and those we acquire throughout our lives — are understood, valued and intentionally pursued. We believe that our employees own our culture and have a responsibility to foster an environment where we all feel comfortable bringing our whole selves to work. Purposefully bringing our differences together to positively influence our culture, serve our clients and enrich our communities is essential to our vision.
Are you ready to join a company with a strong purpose and a winning culture? Start your Voyage – Apply Now
Get to Know the Opportunity:
Voya Wealth business is looking to find a manager of IT professionals that will lead a small cross functional team that will include delivery managers, business analysts, developers, and QA analysts. The manager will lead managers and senior individual contributors and be directly responsible for results produced by the team/group/sub-unit managed. The team will also consist of some offshore IT resources.
The Contributions You'll Make:* You will supervise IT project teams and/or service units with specialists to ensure results meet customer expectations and adhere to internal IT standards, methodologies, and strategies.
* You will troubleshoot special problems and lead performance improvement efforts based on a solid understanding of the technical concepts, methods, and practices applied by reporting staff.
* You will collaborates with team, IT colleagues, IT leadership, business colleagues, senior business leaders and occasionally external clients to identify customer requirements, assess impacts to other data, systems, products or services, compare costs and benefits, consider available technologies and processes and recommends solutions.
* This role includes monitoring and reporting to IT management and user/customer management the status of multiple, concurrent project and/or service efforts.
* You will develop and manage business plan(s) and budget(s) for functional area; identifies resource needs and develops supporting justifications for them; responsible for the overall success unit managed.
* Your ability to delivery on large programs with multiple work streams using strong project management skills will be required
* Your will monitor IT project financials and IT resource demand and capacity
* You will present to leadership at steering and advisory-level meetings
* Experience interacting and communicating status to external clients


Minimum Knowledge & Experience:* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance or a directly related field
* Ten years of progressively responsible experience in IT in an applications development environment
* Demonstrated success in project management and execution with involvement in multiple major projects or a sustained record of success delivering complex IT services to a diverse clientele.


Minimum Knowledge & Experience:* Financial Services experience
* Experience or knowledge of Retirement systems
* Knowledge of OMNI software


#LI-BP2
#LI-Remote

Be Well. Stay Well.
Voya provides the resources that can make a difference in your lives. To us, this means thriving physically, financially, socially and emotionally. Voya benefits are designed to help you do just that. That’s why we offer an array of plans, programs, tools and resources with one goal in mind: To help you and your family be well and stay well.
What We Offer* Health, dental, vision and life insurance plans
* 401(k) Savings plan – with generous company matching contributions (up to 6%)
* Voya Retirement Plan – employer paid cash balance retirement plan (4%)
* Tuition reimbursement up to $5,250/year
* Paid time off – including 20 days paid time off, nine paid company holidays and a flexible Diversity Celebration Day.
* Paid volunteer time — 40 hours per calendar year

  

Critical Skills
At Voya, we have identified the following critical skills which are key to success in our culture:* Customer Focused: Passionate drive to delight our customers and offer unique solutions that deliver on their expectations.
* Critical Thinking: Thoughtful process of analyzing data and problem solving data to reach a well-reasoned solution.
* Team Mentality: Partnering effectively to drive our culture and execute on our common goals.
* Business Acumen: Appreciation and understanding of the financial services industry in order to make sound business decisions.
* Learning Agility: Openness to new ways of thinking and acquiring new skills to retain a competitive advantage.
