title: Director, Product Management - Star Platform
description:
Are you passionate about helping companies create a more ethical and compliant workplace? Do you have a vision for how technology can be used to make compliance easier and more effective?

We are looking for a talented and experienced Product Manager to join our team and help us build the next generation of employee compliance SaaS solutions. As a Product Manager at our company, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and to make a real difference in the way that companies manage compliance.
**The Role**
At Star, Product Managers are the CEOs for their areas and are responsible for the overall commercial success of their products within their markets. We don’t stop at building great products – we also work closely with our sales and marketing colleagues to make sure that we can sell great products and with our services teams to make sure that our products can be implemented and supported effectively. Product Managers are actively engaged in developing the sales pipeline and preparing account growth plans with Relationship Managers. Our goal is to build, sell, and support great products.  

We want to be the go-to technology partner for Employee Compliance solutions, and our mission is to make compliance simple and easy for organizations of all sizes; allowing compliance teams to scale through automation and to reduce the burden of compliance on their firms.  

  

As a Product Manager on Star’s compliance product team, you own all of the “what” questions – what problems we should be solving for our customers, what do we need to do to win in our markets, what is the specific value proposition, what are the critical features that will meet the needs of our customers and increase their success. You will be responsible for advancing the product strategy, owning the roadmap and backlog, ensuring that sales and marketing can position the product well, and leading performance-focused initiatives.  

The Product Manager will work with the Product Owner and other team members across multiple geographies and time zones. Reporting to the Head of Product, the Product Manager will liaise with stakeholders, and collaborate with our customer base and cross-functional teams to execute on their responsibilities.  

Core aspects of the Product Manager role
1. Developing a deep understanding of market dynamics
2. Tuning that understanding into compelling value propositions and great ideas for new features and enhancements to our products and services
3. Developing and communicating a product roadmap that will drive profitable revenue growth and delight customers
4. Planning and executing superb go-to-market plans with colleagues from sales, marketing, and services to promote the adoption and use of our products and services  

Key Performance Indicators* Product Usage and feature adoption metrics
* Product financial performance – revenue and profit
* Client engagement and satisfaction

 **Responsibilities*** Develop a deep understanding of customers; what drives their performance and how our products and services affect that research and monitor compliance change drivers (including legislation & regulations) and translate the implications into actionable strategy and requirements
* Elicit requirements and feedback from the internal and external teams
* Develop and validate the value proposition for the product for all target markets and personas
* Define product strategy and align the product roadmap to deliver value to customers at scale
* Deliver vision and requirement documents with prioritized features and corresponding justification
* Work with the Product Owner and the engineering teams to scope, prioritize, and drive feature specification
* Collaborate with sales on enablement, conversion effectiveness, and win/loss analysis
* Collaborate with product marketing on positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategies
* Collaborate with customer success and strategic customers to handle critical issues requirements analysis, and product planning activities, and to ensure their success
* Product metrics that are required to understand business performance and product value
* Mentor team members and grow team capabilities

 **Skills & Experience*** 10+ years of experience in product management, with a focus on high-scale B2B SaaS offerings; preferably Cloud-native, data services, service APIs, and distributed systems at scale
* Proven track record in release management in an Agile, B2B SaaS product environment
* Strong ability to grasp and translate customer needs into business requirements
* Love speaking with customers and learning more about their product needs
* Evangelist who effectively communicates priorities to internal and external audiences
* Ability to communicate both business and technical topics to diverse audiences
* You're intrinsically motivated and committed to driving projects from start to finish
* Able to work independently, anticipate, and resolve problems
* Possess strong decision-making and prioritization skills.
* Capable of efficiently gathering information and making real-time decisions to maintain development velocity and release predictability
* Commercially ‘savvy’ – knowing when to prioritize features around commercial vs technical requirement
* Have a strong desire to help people see and understand the value of RegTech – regulatory technology

  

**Preferred Skills & Experience*** In-depth knowledge of the financial services industry
* Strong experience and domain knowledge in Regulatory Compliance
* Strong geo preference, East Coast (North Carolina and North)

**StarCompliance Background Checks**  

All positions require pre-employment screening due to employees potentially having access to highly sensitive and confidential information involving finance and compliance; candidates must be trustworthy and have a heightened sensitivity to protecting confidential financial, professional information. To be eligible for employment with StarCompliance, candidates must undergo a rigorous background investigation with checks including, but not limited to, criminal record history, consumer credit, employment history, qualifications, and education checks. **Equal Opportunity Employer Statement**  

We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, marital/civil union/domestic partnership status, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by country, state, or local laws.  

This policy applies to all employment practices within our organisation, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. StarCompliance makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, please request a copy of our Equal Opportunities Policy.

title: Director of Technology Partnerships
description:
Summary
The Director of Technology Partnerships is a driving force in the establishment, development and execution of the Go-To-Market (GTM) strategy for Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) at Workiva. The Director will leverage their experience to develop Alliances with some of the world’s largest software companies. A net new channel for Workiva, these partnerships represent a significant growth opportunity. As a result we are seeking a seasoned professional with a proven track record of developing and driving world class partnerships, developing compelling joint offerings in conjunction with our consulting partners, and identifying new routes to market.
Responsibilities include defining and leading strategy, business planning, joint value propositions, and strategic initiatives in order to grow the pipeline, revenue, and market share for Workiva. They will work within Workiva as well as within the partner’s organization to build trust, alignment, and accountability. This involves initiating, cultivating and sustaining relationships with partner executives and sales leaders that result in a highly effective partnership delivering material impact to both the partner and Workiva.
What You’ll Do  

Provide leadership in driving:* Executive level relationship management
* GTM Strategies
* Joint Value Propositions
* Sourced and co-sell bookings
* Partner recruitment and activation
* Partner enablement and delivery excellence
* Pipeline development
* Pipe nurture


What You'll Need
Minimum Qualifications* 8+ years of related experience in software and/or SaaS leadership
* Prior experience partnering with Independent Software Vendors (ISVs)
* Proven track record of success meeting and exceeding quotas, driving revenue via direct and partner-influenced opportunities
* Bachelor's degree


Preferred Qualifications* Proven ability to develop and execute a strategy involving multiple stakeholders
* Experience interacting cross-functionally in a matrix-oriented environment (including but not limited to sales, services, product, customer success, marketing, operations)
* Technical aptitude in SaaS would create unique differentiation
* Expertise working with any of the following partner programs: AWS Partner Network (APN), Microsoft AppSource, Workday Solutions Marketplace, ServiceNow Store
* Ability to identify ways to successfully develop and execute a strategy
* Negotiation, influencing, collaboration and conflict resolution skills
* Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to multitask and manage multiple processes, programs, and procedures simultaneously while working under pressure to meet deadlines
* Excellent judgment and creative problem-solving/critical thinking skills
* Self-motivated with strong propensity for action, results and continuous improvement
* Thrives in a collaborative environment and strong ability to be flexible in work approach based on business needs

  

Travel Requirement* Up to 35% travel

  

Working Conditions and Physical Requirements* Reliable internet access for any period of time working remotely, not in a Workiva office


How You’ll Be Rewarded:* Salary range in the US:


$126,000.00 - $214,000.00* Eligible for commission based on sales performance
* Restricted Stock Units granted at time of hire
* 401(k) match and comprehensive employee benefits package


The salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this job in the US. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and other relevant factors.
Where You’ll Work
Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created.* Customer Success: Always delight our customers.
* Trust: Rely on each other.
* Integrity: Do the right thing, every time.
* Collaboration: Share resources and work together.
* Innovation: Keep creating solutions and finding better ways.
* Inclusion: Support a diverse community where we all belong.
* Accountability: Be responsible for your success and failure.

  

We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.
At Workiva, you’ll enjoy:* Fantastic Benefits: With coverage starting day one, choose from competitive health, dental, and vision plans on the largest physician networks available.
* Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.
* Involvement: Ability to participate in Business Employee Resource Groups (Black, Hispanic, Asian, Women, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Veterans, Disabilities), Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and more
* Work-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.

  

Learn more about life at Workiva: https://www.linkedin.com/company/workiva/
Learn more about benefits: https://www.workiva.com/careers/benefits  

Workiva is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other protected characteristic. We strongly encourage and welcome people from historically marginalized groups to apply.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com. *Workiva supports employees in working where they work best - either from an office or remotely from any location within their country of employment.*
#LI-EK1

title: Director, Program Management - Product PMO
description:
**Director, Program Management (Product PMO)**  


  

**About Us**  

  

We are BetMGM. We are revolutionizing sports betting and online gaming in the United States. We are a partnership between two powerhouse organizations—MGM Resorts International and Entain Group. You know our name through our exciting portfolio of brands including BetMGM Sportsbook, Borgata online, Party Casino and Party Poker. We aim to bring our ideas into action and find ways to deliver the best quality in gaming platforms.  

  

We understand that each card in the deck plays a unique role in any given hand, just as our employees each play a unique role in accomplishing our goals as a company. We strive to create a culture of empathy where our employees feel valued, heard, and comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. We want to build a product and a workplace that reflect the communities we serve so we approach our work fearlessly, take responsibility when we get it wrong, and ante-up again. We play to win, and we are all-in together.  

  

We were recognized as one of Glassdoor’s “Best Places to Work”.
**About the Role**
As a key member of the Program Management team at BetMGM the Director, Program Management (Product PMO) will be responsible for the BetMGM product portfolio and roadmap planning, ongoing feature activation and continued prioritization of the portfolio in alignment with the company strategy. The Director, Program Management will act as the liaison between all BetMGM Product Areas, the Entain PMO and Product and the BetMGM PMO team to ensure successful and timely execution of the product roadmap. The Director will also be the key champion for driving operational excellence via standardization and documentation and continuous improvement of PDLC and SDLC.  

The ideal candidate will have a passion for driving and enabling change with a strong foundation of digital product management and program management experience. This key role will work with senior team members across product, product design, user research, engineering, compliance, and operations to manage the regular product roadmap planning process, facilitate the prioritization process, and collaborate with the PMO Process team to continuously advance the planning and delivery process.
The Director, Program Management should be a dynamic leader and highly impactful communicator, with an excellent ability to present to and gather feedback from senior stakeholders. They should contribute meaningfully to creating a culture of excellence and driving the practice of program management and innovation, helping BetMGM create the future of sports and entertainment.
  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage and gain alignment on roadmap planning processes and delivery across all product verticals and Entain.
* Facilitate the regular roadmap planning and prioritization process and ensure all submissions adhere to the highest quality standards.
* Drive adaption and continuous improvement of PDLC and SDLC.
* Define the strategic goals for the Product PMO team based on the needs of the business and provide direct line management to departments program and projects managers by setting performance objectives and providing guidance and coaching to ensure set objectives are met.
* Build strong relationships with all BetMGM Product leads and partner with them to understand inefficiencies in the planning process, eliminate any roadblocks and drive improvement of any roadmap related processes.
* Develop and maintain a regular project and portfolio status reporting cadence and process for BetMGM in alignment with Entain.
* Monitoring and actively managing project deviations to resolve issues and bring at risk projects back on track.
* Create and deliver senior stakeholder presentations, summarizing the BetMGM Product roadmap including strategic initiatives and key focus areas.
* Oversee and drive a robust change control process to enable risk mitigation and enable transparent communication when significant impact is expected.


**Essential Functions**
* Must be able to stand or sit and operate computers and other technological devices for extended periods of time


**Qualifications**
* Experience in Product Management and/or managing Product portfolios required.
* Substantial experience of working with PDLC, SDLS and both Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies and associated tools and techniques.
* Proven authority and responsibility for effectively and efficiently managing complex change portfolios.
* Proven strong performance in prior project management and/or delivery roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
* Proven people leadership experience, especially in building, leading and motivating teams.
* Willingness to act as mentor and coach to build on colleague’s strengths and improve on weaknesses, acting as one who listens and gives honest feedback.
* Ability to successfully work across cultures and locations, driving team cohesion and effectiveness.
* Experience developing a function or department in a fast-paced environment preferred.
* Ability to inspire via superior communication & interpersonal skills are required, experience communicating and interacting with executive teams required.
* Excellent communicator who is able to get one’s message understood clearly by adopting a range of styles and techniques appropriate to the audience and the nature of the information.
* Experience using tools such as Jira, Smartsheet, Asana, Trello, etc. to optimize team efficiency.
* Willingness for occasional travel to colleagues that are located across multiple offices.


**About Our Culture**  

  

Building BetMGM from the ground up takes effort, energy, and teamwork, but that’s what will make leading this industry all the more satisfying. We stay focused on our main goal with the help of these four company pillars:
* Believe in Your Game – Take your shot! There’s a freedom to explore ideas usually only start-ups are lucky enough to experience.
* Backed by the Best - With our expertise—merged with that of our world-class investors—we have the opportunity to take this business, and ourselves, farther than anyone has ever imagined.
* Do What’s Right - We operate with clarity and simplicity, always doing the right thing by our customers and each other, standing shoulder to shoulder every day.
* Hustle Hard - Our combined commitment and ambition is what drives us to create some of the most innovative products in the industry.

**What We Offer**
  

As a valued employee, we’re committed to giving you the resources and support you need. We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Paid Time Off, Holidays, Employee Resource Groups and more!  

  

**Gaming Compliance**  

  

Candidate must comply with and support the company’s responsible gambling policies, procedures and initiatives.  

  

This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of duties a person in this position may be asked to perform from time to time.  

  

***BetMGM LLC is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, termination, promotions, or any other condition of employment or career development. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to learn more about you.***  

  

*If you need assistance or accommodation with your application due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitment@betmgm.com.*  

#LI-MH1

title: Director, Product Management- Terrell, TX or Remote
description:
**Who We Are**



At OBE, together, we build excellence every day… We are driven by our passion to lead our industry and build a sustainable future, we focus on exceeding customer expectations and delivering innovative solutions. We succeed through the dedication of our empowered teams and partners who fuel our ambition to achieve excellence in the markets where we have a right to win.



We believe **safety, integrity, performance culture, teamwork, customer centricity**, and **agility** are at the core of who we are and how we operate each day to achieve success.


**Position Summary**



Join us at Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope as a visionary Director of Product Management, where you will lead the charge in shaping the future or our product portfolio. We’re seeking a strategic and dynamic leader who can drive innovation, collaborate seamlessly across functions, and deliver market-leading products. If you’re ready to take on a pivotal role in our journey of product excellence and contribute to the success of a growing company, apply now to be a key architect of our exciting future!


**Key Responsibilities**


* **Portfolio Strategy:** Develop comprehensive portfolio strategy aligned with the company's overall goals, inclusive of customer needs, competition, suppliers, emerging trends/technologies, and regulatory.
* **Roadmap Development:** Drive the creation and execution of product roadmaps ensuring alignment with business goals
* **Market Analysis:** Conduct thorough customer and market research, including competitive analysis to identify opportunities for product differentiation and market leadership
* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Work closely with Engineering, Manufacturing, Sales, Marketing, and Procurement teams to ensure seamless product development to successful commercialization leveraging the program development stage gate process, PDP
* **Product Launch and Lifecycle Management:** Oversee the successful launch of new products, manage product lifecycles, and make data-driven decisions to optimize product performance.
* **Customer-Centric Approach:** Cultivate a customer-centric culture within the product team, leveraging customer feedback and market research to drive product enhancements.
* **Financial Management:** Develop and manage product budgets, ensuring efficient resource allocation and alignment with financial objectives.
* **Innovation:** Foster a culture of innovation within the product management team, staying abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies.
* **Regulatory Compliance:** Ensure products adhere to industry standards, regulations and certifications, leading efforts to navigate and comply with evolving requirements.
* **Team Development:** Lead, mentor and inspire a high-performing product management team, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.


**Key Competencies**


* **Strategic Thinking:** Ability to think strategically and translate business objectives into actionable product strategies
* **Communication/ Collaborative:** Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively convey product strategies and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* **Analytical:** Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to inspire and guide a diverse team towards common goals
* **Adaptability:** Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, adapting to changing market conditions and business priorities.


**Professional Experience/Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Engineering, or related field. MBA with BS in technical field preferred.
* 10+ years of progressive product management/ product marketing and leadership experience, specifically in Building Construction or related industry
* A proven track record of success in multi-generation product strategy planning, new product development and commercialization launches


**Other**


* Lead a team of 5 direct reports comprised of Product, Program & Product Data Analytics Management
* Some travel required


**What OBE Offers You**


* Competitive pay
* Paid time off
* 10 Holidays (inclusive of 2 floating holidays)
* Market competitive 401(k) match
* Industry-leading medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Short-term and long-term disability coverage
* Life Insurance


**About OBE**



At OBE, we believe the work of our employees truly matters. From apartments in New York to office buildings in Toronto, stadiums in Dallas, and universities in Atlanta, our teams contribute to the projects that shape the world where we live, work, heal, and play.

  



OBE delivers products to a broad customer base of architects, glaziers, contractors, and developers serving diversified residential and commercial construction end-markets. With over 6,700 employees, we operate 82 manufacturing and distribution facilities in five countries.



If you want to help us build something great- we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager for consideration. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!



OBE is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.



EOE/Vet/Disability-If you want to know more, please click on this link.



Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope is an E-Verify Employer.



#OBE


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: VP of Data and Analytics
description:
### **About Life360**



Life360's mission is to keep people close to the ones they love. We help families protect the people, pets, and things they care about with our industry-leading mobile app and category-defining Tile tracking devices. Life360 has more than 58 million monthly active users (MAU) in more than 150 countries. We are the 16th most-used iOS app in the US, running on almost 15% of iPhones. Life360 was founded in 2008, went public on the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX: 360) in 2019, acquired Tile and Jiobit device makers in 2022, and has plans to pursue a dual listing on a US exchange (i.e. NASDAQ or NYSE) in the near future. We continue to grow rapidly, with strong double digit growth delivering expected revenues of over $300 million in 2023. Our ASX listing gives employees the liquidity of a public company with the upside of a private growth stage business.



Bringing together our highly successful mobile app with innovative devices, we have the opportunity to do unprecedented good for families across free and paid plans. Key features include location sharing, lost item reimbursement, driver monitoring, 24/7 roadside assistance, and crash detection with emergency response. By continuing to innovate and deliver for our customers, we aim to become a household name and establish ourselves as the must-have mobile-based membership for families of all stages.



Our growing team of 500+ employees operates as remote-first, with the majority of the leadership team centered around the San Francisco Bay Area and people located across the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia.A remote work environment will be the primary experience for all employees.


### **Opportunity for Impact**



Life360 represents a unique opportunity for impact because our massive highly engaged customer base (58M+ MAU) provides an amazing source of insights, and your leadership will ensure that we're continuously learning and improving how we serve our customers and grow our business. You will grow and develop analytics talent and tooling across domains, including product analytics, marketing analytics, and core business metrics, while increasing our acumen in experimentation and scaling our data science capabilities. Your team will go beyond reporting on the data–they are uniquely qualified and empowered to make sense of billions of data points about how families move and interact to identify new ways to promote connection between family members, improve safety (on the road and off), and to find compelling ways to help the world understand the value of location sharing and the services we provide. You will partner with product, marketing, engineering, and finance leadership to build a data strategy and use that data and the insights we derive from it to help inform our product, marketing, and overall business strategy.


### **What You'll Do**


* **Leadership:** Nurture our growing analytics function, helping the team deepen their understanding of and impact on the business, and fostering a culture of empowerment, data democratization, accountability, innovation, and excellence. You will be instrumental in cultivating a data-centric culture, empowering decision-making across all levels with actionable, data intelligence
* **Data Strategy:** Develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy, in partnership with engineering, and aligned with business objectives, ensuring the effective capture, storage, analysis, and utilization of data assets.
* **Insights and Storytelling:** Utilize the latest analytics techniques to extract actionable insights from large and complex datasets, coupled with automation and self-service capabilities, to drive informed decision-making across all levels of the organization. Develop ways of communicating the meaning behind the data so that employees, investors, and the general public can leverage these insights.
* **Product and Marketing Experimentation:** Collaborate closely with product and marketing teams to improve our experimentation methodology and velocity; identify opportunities for optimization and enhancement based on data-driven insights into user behavior, preferences, and trends.
* **Performance Measurement:** Help to identify, measure, and automate reporting for key performance indicators (KPIs) and establish robust frameworks for measuring and monitoring the performance of products, features, and initiatives.
* **Forecasting and Modeling:** Improve predictive models and forecasting methodologies to anticipate trends, user behavior patterns, and business performance, enabling proactive decision-making.
* **Data Platform Modernization**: Spearhead the modernization of our data platform, a strategic initiative aimed at unlocking advanced insights capabilities and the rich value of our data set. Bringing a visionary approach to integrating cutting-edge technologies and methodologies that enable real-time data analytics, ensuring our organization can respond with agility to market dynamics and customer needs. You will define the roadmap for cross-functional teams to extend the existing data infrastructure, enable solutions such as predictive modeling, AI-driven insights, and real-time high-scale user facing analytics. This role not only requires experience partnering with technical leadership but also a strategic mindset to align data capabilities with business objectives, driving innovation and competitive advantage in our industry.

### **What We're Looking For**


* 12+ years of deep expertise in data science, experimentation, and growth analytics for a mobile, subscription, or consumer tech company.
* 5+ years in a senior leadership role overseeing analytics and data science functions, including managing managers, preferably in the mobile consumer tech space.
* Extensive experience leading experimentation at scale and helping both analytics teams, and the business and product teams they support, improve experimentation practices.
* Deep experience in statistical analysis, data mining, machine learning, and predictive modeling, with large data sets and distributed computing in a cloud based environment.
* Strong business acumen and demonstrated ability to translate data insights into actionable business recommendations and strategic initiatives, using visualization and storytelling to enroll others to follow through on these recommendations.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with a track record of building and developing high-performing teams, and influencing and collaborating with cross-functional leaders in engineering, product, marketing, and finance.
* Demonstrated experience translating strategic business and product questions into a successful data and analytics roadmap.
* Willingness and ability to roll up your sleeves get hands on when needed.
* Strong command of analytics and visualization tools, such as Tableau and Amplitude.
* Experience with stream processing solutions, such as Apache Flink, Pinot, Spark and cloud-based Business Intelligence, Data Science and Analytics solutions, such as Tableau, Quicksight, Kinesis, DataBricks, Snowflake is required.
* BS/MS in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Economics, Physics, or related fields preferred.

### **Our Benefits**


* Competitive pay and benefits
* Medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance plans (100% paid for employees)
* 401(k) plan with company matching program
* Mental Wellness Program & Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for mental well being
* Flexible PTO, 13 company wide days off throughout the year & paid Holiday Shutdown
* Learning & Development programs
* Equipment, tools, and reimbursement support for a productive remote environment
* Free Life360 Platinum Membership for your preferred circle
* Free Tile Products

### **Life360 Values**



Our company's mission driven culture is guided by our shared values to create a trusted work environment where you can bring your authentic self to work and make a positive difference


* Be a Good Person - We have a team of high integrity people you can trust.
* Be Direct With Respect - We communicate directly, even when it's hard.
* Members Before Metrics - We focus on building an exceptional experience for families.
* High Intensity High Impact - We do whatever it takes to get the job done.

### **Our Commitment to Diversity**



We believe that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds create a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better results. Together, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. It fuels our innovation and connects us closer to our customers and the communities we serve. We strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic best selves to work.


*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Life360. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any legally protected status.*


*We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences create a foundation for the best ideas. Come join us in building something meaningful.**Even if you don't meet 100% of the below qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying!*

  

**#LI-Remote**

title: Product Director- REMOTE
description:
**Systems & Methods, Inc. (SMI MGMT)**



SMI is one of the most highly regarded technology producers in the human services field. We develop state-of-the-art solutions for complex human service operations. To maintain our prominence in this competitive industry, SMI recruits individuals who are technical, creative, client-focused, and most importantly willing to go the *Extra Mile*. With over 50 years as a family-owned and operated business, SMI considers its employees and clients part of an extended family. We are a family serving families. Our culture is one of teamwork, dedication, empowerment, and a strong emphasis on work-life balance. We offer an optimal atmosphere for career growth and achievement while remaining competitive in terms of compensation and benefits. We are multi-state operation and administrative private company with a staff of over 650 employees throughout the United States. We depend on the expertise of our SMI team to support and develop the very best systems and product lines in the industry and expect continued innovation. If you are looking for a meaningful and fulfilling career, we hope that you will consider SMI.

  



**Job Summary:**

  


The Product Director will play a pivotal role in the future growth and transformation of SMI by managing projects and personnel assigned to support the expansion of SMI’s Payments Solution suite for government agencies. They will have an opportunity to participate in delivering a compelling best-in-class reimagined product experience leveraging technology and design. You will be responsible for supporting the vision, opportunities and goals set forth by Leadership.

  



The ideal candidate for this role should have experience in product management, a proven track record of launching successful products, strong leadership and communication skills, and a deep understanding of technology and the product development process. The candidate should also be familiar with Payment solutions for state and other government entities.

  



This location-agnostic role has core business hours in the eastern time zone. The role will report to the Head of Product.

  


**Key Functions & Basic Duties:**

  


* Defines the product vision, strategy and roadmap
* Gathers, manages and prioritizes market/customer requirements
* Acts as the customer advocate articulating the user’s and/or buyer’s needs
* Works closely with engineering, sales, marketing, operations, and support to ensure business case and customer satisfaction goals are met.
* The Product Manager will Lead cross departmental strategic product initiatives coordinating with key stakeholders in sales, marketing, design, development, and operations
* Has technical product knowledge or specific domain expertise in fintech, banking, or payments
* Defines what to solve in the market needs document, where you articulate the valuable market problem you’re solving along with priorities and justification for each part of the solution
* Runs beta and pilot programs during the qualify phase with almost final products samples. In Agile environments, regularly review completed work and checks with customers to ensure that it meets the customer expectations.
* Is a market expert. Market expertise includes understanding the reasons customers purchase products. This includes a deep understanding of the competition and how customers think of and buy your product. Product Managers need market research and competitive analysis skills to complete these tasks
* Acts as the product’s leader within the company
* Develops the business case for new products, improvements to existing products, and business ventures.
* Lead a broad team of digital professionals to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives.
* Recommends or contributes information in setting product pricing.
* Additional duties may be assigned.
  

  

**Education and/ or Experience:**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in technology, business or equivalent experience


* 3 + years experience in product management or operations with payment solutions


* Deep understanding of financial systems, payments, and financial technology domains


* Collaborative problem-solving and ideation in a highly ambiguous environment


* Excellent communication skills; written and verbal.


* Deep curiosity for how complex (financial) systems work, and ability to internalize and analyze this information quickly


* Experience delivering quality software that solves business and user needs


* Data-driven approach and excellent analytical skills
  


**Language Skills:**

  


Fluent in English.

  


**Computer Skills:**

  


Basic knowledge of Microsoft Windows/Office. Knowledge and familiarity with Jira and/or tools that are used for software development

  


SMI offers employees great insurance, a 401(K) plan, HSA/Flexible Spending Account, paid holidays/paid time off, and profit-sharing.



To learn more about the SMI Culture, please visit our website: https://www.smi-inc.com/family/culture


**We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are a Drug-Free Workplace.**

title: Director, IT Operations Warehouse/Pharmacy
description:
Hims & Hers Health, Inc. (better known as Hims & Hers) is the leading health and wellness platform, on a mission to help the world feel great through the power of better health. We are revolutionizing telehealth for providers and their patients alike. Making personalized solutions accessible is of paramount importance to Hims & Hers and we are focused on continued innovation in this space. Hims & Hers offers nonprescription products and access to highly personalized prescription solutions for a variety of conditions related to mental health, sexual health, hair care, skincare, heart health, and more.



Hims & Hers is a public company, traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol "HIMS". To learn more about the brand and offerings, you can visit hims.com and forhers.com, or visit our investor site. For information on the company's outstanding benefits, culture, and its talent-first flexible/remote work approach, see below and visit www.hims.com/careers-professionals.

### **About the Role:**



Exciting opportunity to be part of the Technology Operations leadership team!



We are looking for a Director to lead our IT field operations across implementations and support of all infrastructure systems including security systems (firewall), routers, switches, access points, servers, workstations, printers, and RF devices for warehouses/pharmacies. This role is onsite based in Columbus, OH, or Gilbert, AZ, and requires travel between sites as needed, with future opportunities for hybrid work arrangement.


### **You Will:**


* The #1 priority of this position is to ensure the systems supporting the warehouse/pharmacy are always up and running in both Columbus, OH and Gilbert, AZ
* Maintain infrastructure services covering all network devices (firewall, routers, switches, access points, servers, workstations, RFs, and printers), operating systems, and applications uptime running on the physical and virtual server infrastructure - ensuring stability and up to date operating systems and patches
* Lead a team supporting IT field operations by establishing continuous service improvement targets and individual team metrics, to help develop team members and overall team performance
* Ensure proactive monitoring, performance tuning, security administration, capacity planning, and disaster recovery (server backups) of all applicable hardware, and systems
* Ensure users are provided with efficient, effective, and timely support on a 24x7 basis; manage staff schedules to ensure optimal coverage and responsiveness between multiple sites
* Joint ownership of warehouse/pharmacy COTS systems with a focus on technical aspects including relationship management of the system integrators
* Experience with vendor performance management - development and monitoring of SOWs and deliverables, SLA compliance, and general vendor relationship management
* Oversee incident management and root-cause identification exercises to identify and correct major problems in collaboration with SRE and Business Operations teams
* End-to-end planning, management, and delivery of operational and technology projects related to the warehousing/pharmacy environment
* Communicate regularly with staff through group meetings and individual sessions; ensure issues/input from the team are listened to and that organization/department strategy, goals, and decisions are communicated consistently and on time
* Assist with developing and enforcing IT procedures, standards, and best practices in collaboration with Corporate IT and Security
* Provide IT license forecasting, contract negotiations, technology refresh, and budget
* Perform additional duties as assigned

### **You Have:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or relevant work experience
* 12+ years of experience in a Technology related role
* 5 + years experience supporting Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and/or Pharmacies
* Background in Retail or Healthcare industry preferred
* Expert in proposing, implementing, and configuring solutions to complex business-critical problems
* Experience operating successfully within a high-growth and fast-paced environment
* Experience with user-centric customer support
* Strong technical knowledge of Windows (Mac OS nice to have)
* 5 + years with network design, configuring, and managing WAN / LAN layer 2 and 3 site-to-site VPN, QoS, DNS, TCP/IP protocols, and IPv6.
* 5 + years experience with virtualization, VMWare
* Familiarity with Cisco Meraki (security appliance, managed switches, wireless access points, and cameras)
* Familiarity and working knowledge of SD-WAN, ZTNA, and Perimeter Security
* Experience with SOX and HIPAA preferred
* Experience with Hybrid Cloud environment preferred (Public or Private Cloud)
* Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
* Strong creative and analytical thinking with a high attention to detail
* Self-directed and capable of taking initiative

### **Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):**


* Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles
* Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days
* Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave
* Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
* Employee discounts on hims & hers & Apostrophe online products
* 401k benefits with employer matching contribution
* Offsite team retreats

  


*#LI-Remote*

  

Outlined below is a reasonable estimate of H&H's compensation range for this role.  

  

H&H also offers a comprehensive Total Rewards package that includes equity grants of restricted stock (RSU's) so that H&H employees own a piece of our company.  

  

The actual amount will take into account a range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and location.  

  

Consult with your Recruiter during any potential screening to determine a more targeted range based on the job-related factors. We don't ever want the pay range to act as a deterrent from you applying!**An estimate of the current salary range for US-based employees is**


$180,000—$205,000 USD
We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you're excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.



Hims is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Hims considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.


*Hims & hers is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at* *accommodations@forhims.com**. Please do not send resumes to this email address.*


*For our California-based applicants – Please see our* *California Employment Candidate Privacy Policy* *to learn more about how we collect, use, retain, and disclose Personal Information.*

title: Corporate Director of IT (Remote/Hawaii Based)
description:
Sightline Hospitality is seeking an Oahu based remote **Corporate Director of IT (with some travel to the mainland required).**
As Corporate Director of IT you will be responsible for the day-to-day support of all IT systems, business systems, office systems, computer networks, and telephony systems throughout the Sightline Portfolio. Additionally, you will be responsible for Information Technology issues, products, and services at the property, as well as provide user training and support of all property/site systems, network enhancements, hardware, and software support. You will also maintain an inventory of all hardware products and software licenses and reviews maintenance agreements.
**About Sightline Hospitality**
Experience-driven and full of heart, we are explorers and adventure enthusiasts. Sightline Hospitality is a growing organization looking for fresh, creative, and entrepreneurial minds to join our team —we’ve led the development of renovations and new hotel projects, developed award-winning restaurants, and welcomed the community into our spaces—for decades. We’ve welcomed guests from across the world to our visionary destinations throughout the continental US and Hawaii.
**Your Responsibilities**
* Responsible for overseeing and handling network configuration, Servers, Workstations, Networking equipment, PABX, email accounts, and also support for the underlying server/desktop infrastructure.
* Work Strategically with the Operations, Finance, Revenue Management and Sales & Marketing Teams on the technology stack for each new property that will be onboarded to the portfolio.
* Conduct Root Cause Analysis on problems.
* Oversee outsourced IT team.
* Responsible for smooth functioning and co-ordination of vendors for Guest Internet, Property Management Systems – PMS, Point of Sale – POS, IPTV, Telephony systems and other software vendors.
* Troubleshoot hardware and software problems.
* Manage leadership in the establishment of project scope, technical strategy, cost, budget, and staff support requirements with new IT initiatives.
* Prepare Policy & Procedures for the IT Department and for the user department.
* Managing Disaster Recovery Process and ensuring regular daily backup is taken.
* Anti-virus setup and day to day support.
* Plan, assign and take reports from the IT team.
* Identify and implement solutions to user challenges and concerns associated with the use of personal computer equipment.
* Ensure that policies and procedure relating to PCI compliance are updated.
* Maintains a system error / progress logbook and deals with reported problems.
* Responsible to ensure that IT Audit points are implemented as per relevant Standard operating Procedures.
* Monitor and maintain proper inventory of hardware and software license.
* Aware of IT Security Policies and ensure implementation through regular staff training.
* Keep updated with latest hotel technology and security risks on a regular basis.
* Able to perform other IT or Systems related tasks assigned by the management.


**Essential Experience/Aptitudes:**
* **Education:**
* Degree or Diploma in Information Technology field. Along with In depth knowledge of Microsoft Operating systems, Microsoft or Cisco certification.
* Applicable Microsoft certifications: MCSA, MCTS or MCITP for Windows Server, MCDST for workstations.
* Experience with these Hospitality related applications and or systems (PMS, POS, Key Card, PBX, Voice Mail).
* **Experience:**
* A minimum of five (5) years of experience in Hospitality, Operations, and IT support roles. Along with minimum of two (2) years of Supervisory / managerial experience.
* Must know the Network fundamentals, general network setup and device configuration.
* Good knowledge of server hardware, Disk storage technology, I/O devices.
* Skilled in usage of system level profiling tools and network monitoring systems to aid in application performance profiling (iostat, Nagios).
* Knowledge of network infrastructure, including CAT5/6 cabling, wireless networks, network switches, WAN/LAN, domain controller, Active Directory, firewall and VPN applications.
* Extensive knowledge on Active Directory, Management and Implementations.
* Prepare & Implement Preventative Maintenance Schedule for all IT hardware & Software.
* Background in highly available systems and image capture/management systems.


**Desired Skills/Experience:*** Must be a self-starter, alert, energetic, responsible, and flexible.
* Excellent communication and listening skills.
* Ability to work under pressure.
* Must be mature, pleasant, courteous, cooperative and an enthusiastic team player who displays good human relations skills.
* Committed to delivering high levels of customer service.
* Ability to respond courteously and efficiently to queries and problems from guests and system users.
* Excellent organizational and prioritization skills, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills.
* Must be flexible in working hours, including weekends, evenings, and holidays.


**Essential Physical Abilities:**
* Must be able to work at a computer for extended periods of time.
* Reading and writing abilities are utilized often when completing paperwork and management reports, interpreting results, giving, and receiving instructions, and training.
* Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances are used frequently.
* Must be flexible to work long and sometimes irregular hours.
* Must be able to work well under pressure.
* Occasionally required to handle and move objects weighing up to 40 lbs. over short distances.

**Benefits:**
* Bonus Plan
* 401(K) plan with match
* Medical Vision, dental, and life insurance options
* Personal Time Off Benefits and Holidays
* Employee discount for stays at hotels within Sightline Hospitality expanding portfolio.

Sightline Hospitality is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applicants and employees of all backgrounds. M/F/D/V/SO

title: Director, Product Management
description:
**Our Mission**

As the world’s number 1 job site\\*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(\\*comScore Total Visits, September 2023)

**Responsibilities**

* Create and drive the vision for Indeed Flex’s Worker Retention including Browse experience, Matching & Offering, Status Program, and Machine Learning products.
* Manage and grow a team of product managers.
* Build a roadmap and define execution strategies with the team by utilizing data, user research, and business priorities. Work closely with stakeholders, including the Fulfillment & Worker Retention service group and Indeed Flex’s Senior Leadership Team.
* Define metrics to measure the success of the features your team builds. Possess a drive for velocity, be highly adaptable, and demonstrate an ability to take a big idea and distill it into a clear and consistent plan that’s backed by data.
* Build relationships and partnerships with people and teams across the company, align on strategy, vision, and execution.

**Skills/Competencies**

* Experience in a fast-paced/startup environment
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field
* 7+ years of Product Management experience or its equivalent
* 3+ years of 2-sided Marketplace experience building machine learning or ranking / matching products
* 2+ years managing a team and are deeply committed to coaching, mentoring, and supporting future leaders. You’re not afraid to be hands on and act as a player-coach when needed.
* Proven track record of cross-functional partnering to execute on strategy.
* Experience presenting to executive audiences.

**Salary Range Transparency**

* United States - Remote - $178,000 - 258,000 USD per year
* Austin Metro Area - $178,000 - 258,000 USD per year
* New York City Metro Area - $208,000 - 302,000
* Seattle Metro Area - $222,000 - 322,000
* San Francisco Metro Area - $242,000 - 350,000

**Salary Range Disclaimer**

The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position in the given work location. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range(s) listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), a Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.

**Benefits - Health, Work/Life Harmony, & Wellbeing**

We care about what you care about. We have a multitude of benefits to support Indeedians, as well as their pets, kids, and partners. Select your country and learn more about our employee benefits, program, & perks at https://benefits.indeed.jobs!

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

**Fair Chance Hiring**

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Service Desk
description:
Pax8 is the leading cloud-based technology marketplace, simplifying the cloud journey for our partners by integrating technology, business intelligence and proactive service to deliver an unparalleled experience. Serving thousands of partners through the indirect sales channel, our mission is to be the world's favorite place to buy cloud products. We are a fast-growing, dynamic and high-energy startup organization, allowing you to make a meaningful impact on the business. Culture is important to us, and at Pax8, it's business, and it **IS** personal. We are passionate, creative and humorously offbeat. We work hard, keep it fun, and expect the best.

We Elev8 each other. We Advoc8 for our partners. We Innov8 continuously. We Celebr8 life.

No matter who you are, Pax8 is a place you can call home. We know there's no such thing as a *"perfect"* candidate, so we don't look for the right "*fit*" – instead, we look for the add. We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don't meet 100% of the bullet points. We believe in cultivating an environment with a diversity of perspectives, in hopes that we can all thrive in an inclusive environment.



We are only as great as our people. And we have great people all over the world. No matter where you live and work, you're a part of the Pax8 team. This means embracing hybrid- and remote-work whenever possible.

**Position Summary:**

The Director of Service Desk is focused on elevating our partners' experience by managing and developing the teams that support the Pax8 platform directly. Building teams and leaders of high performing, diverse individuals that put the partner experience first is a core competency of the director role. The Director of Service Desk looks to the future, focusing on the support strategic vision and Pax8 partner experience. They are responsible for all things related to their teams' service, efficiency, growth and experience, and understand current capacities while forecasting future growth and needs.


**Essential Responsibilities (includes, but is not limited to):**

* Service Management and Quality Control
	+ Cultivate and Preserve a productive culture around purpose, efficiency, and meeting utility
	+ Monitor and React to the Service Desk team's performance, taking appropriate measures to ensure world-class service
	+ Investigate and Respond to feedback around team workflows, service design, and process
	+ Create, Monitor, and Standardize metrics for team performance, service quality, and interactions across Pax8 teams
	+ Define department standards and implement tools & process to drive accountability to these standards
	+ Hire and mentor managers and team leads
	+ Collaborate with leadership to surface team and individual needs to improve efficiency
* Planning and Forecasting
	+ Monitor and React to resource and personnel needs
	+ Collaborate and Assist with employee selection and hiring
	+ Develop and Report models for team forecasting, employee churn, and growth to align with Pax8 strategic growth
* Team & Employee Development
	+ Track and Take Action on employee goals, interests, and strengths, and correlate these to advancement and learning opportunities
	+ Drive accountability and healthy team performance, taking necessary action to manage both individuals and teams
	+ Train and Mentor leadership talent; develop management skills and act as a mentor for leadership growth
	+ Schedule and Execute 1 on 1's with direct reports; develop goals, provide direction, track progress, and remove obstacles.
	+ Curate and Maintain a healthy employee and workplace experience
	+ Create promotional paths, team improvement plans, and learning & certification objectives, along with the tools to track eligibility & progress
	+ Develop and Deploy training to ensure teams are prepared with knowledge and a healthy support structure
	+ Oversee and React to employee onboarding needs and collaborate with training resources when necessary

**Ideal Skills, Experience, and Competencies:**

* 10 years experience in a customer facing support role, ideally supporting a SaaS application in the IT services application space
* 5 years of experience in a customer support leadership role
* Exceptional leadership and team management skills
* Strong customer service skills, with a passion for delivering exceptional service and support
* Excellent problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
* Solid understanding of customer support processes and best practices
* Proficient in using customer support software and tools
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with customers and team members at all levels of the organization
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities
* Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze data and use it to drive decision making
* Proven track record in driving improvements in customer support operations and performance


**Required Education & Certifications:**

* B.S./B.A. degree in related field or equivalent work experience is preferred
* At least five (5) years of relevant experience in customer service leadership is preferred

#### **Compensation:**


* Qualified candidates can expect a salary beginning at $120,000/yr or more depending on experience


#LI-Remote #LI-JF1 #BI-Remote

* Note: Compensation is benchmarked on local Denver Metro area market rates. Qualified candidates in other locations can expect a salary package that may be adjusted based off applicable cost of wages in their respective location.


At Pax8 we believe that your Total Rewards should include a benefits package that shows how much we value our greatest assets. All **FTE** Pax8 people enjoy the following benefits:
* Non-Commissioned Bonus Plans or Variable Commission
* 401(k) plan with employer match
* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employer Paid Short & Long Term Disability, Life and AD&D Insurance
* Flexible, Open Vacation
* Paid Sick Time Off
* Extended Leave for Life events
* RTD Eco Pass (For local Colorado Employees)
* Career Development Programs
* Stock Option Eligibility
* Employee-led Resource Groups

 Pax8 is an EEOC Employer.

title: Executive Director Practice Technology
description:
Overview:

Today, SCA Health has grown to 11,000 teammates who care for 1 million patients each year and support physician specialists holistically in many aspects of patient care. Together, our teammates create value in specialty care by aligning physicians, health plans and health systems around a common goal: delivering on the quadruple aim of high-quality outcomes and a better experience for patients and providers, all at a lower total cost of care.  

As part of Optum, we participate in an integrated care delivery system that enables us to support our partners as they navigate a complex healthcare environment, Only SCA Health has a dynamic group of physician-driven, specialty care businesses that allows us to customize solutions, no matter the need or challenge:* We connect patients to physicians in new and differentiated ways as part of Optum and with our new Specialty Management Solutions business.
* We have pioneered a physician-led, multi-site model of practice solutions that restores physician agency by aligning incentives to support growth and transition to value-based care.
* We lead the industry in value-based payment solutions through our Global 1 bundled payment convener, that provides easy predictable billing to patients.
* We help physicians address everything beyond surgical procedures, including anesthesia and ancillary service lines.

  

The new SCA Health represents who we are today and where we are going—and the growing career opportunities for YOU.
Accountabilities / Responsibilities:

OSP partners with specialty physician groups, through MSOs to support their migration into value-based healthcare as part of the OptumCare team. OSP partners to provide practice management and clinical performance support, referral and payer alignment, data analytics, and strategic capital while the practices themselves provide physician leadership, market knowledge and clinical excellence to create market-leading specialty care delivery systems. OSP is responsible for delivering high-value specialty care networks that overlay and integrate with SCA Health, OptumCare Care Delivery Organizations (CDOs), and other OptumCare partners.***Role Description:***  

Reporting to the VP of Practice Services, this role is intended to be a technology business operations leader. They will be responsible for building the information technology offering for the national MSO and building technology enabled solutions for local and regional OSP platforms. They will be a key leader within the national MSO; having a huge and lasting impact on setting the direction and building IT solutions for specialty practices.  

A successful candidate will have to be adept at designing and implementing technology-enabled business solutions for the business; working as a leader and luminary. The candidate should have a deep understanding of the physician practice landscape and the unique issues practices face. Candidate must be able to collaborate with lines of business (finance, operations, managed care, revenue cycle, clinical), to identify pain points and offer technology solutions for business problems. Then take these learnings to work with the broader SCAH Information Technology team to help identify solutions and paths (build, buy, source internally). This person will be the key liaison between SCAH IT team and the national MSO acting as a true business partner to IT representing the practice needs and unique challenges. This role has an opportunity to have significant exposure to internal stakeholders, multiple functional lanes, market operating group leadership, Optum, and high-profile external regional platforms. ***Responsibility Description:***  

This role will have both short term (immediate) responsibilities as well as longer term goals (1-2 years) as a successful candidate builds the functional area.  

In addition to responsibilities as assigned, immediate responsibilities a successful candidate will engage with, include:* ***Enterprise Data Warehouse*** – This “EDW” is a foundational initiative to enable the growth and successful delivery of solutions by the national MSO. Candidate will work with the data architecture and other IT team members functioning as a subject matter expert (“SME”) to help guide the team in understanding the structure of EMR/PMS and other systems (Phone, Patient Engagement systems) and guide them in successfully transforming the data into the EDW.
* ***Integration Support*** – Candidate will work with local platform/partnerships to guide and advisement on: 1) transitioning to SCA Health solutions and/or 2) EMR/PMS selection and implementation.
* ***Workflow Optimization –*** candidate will work with departments/lanes to help identify if and how technology can be utilized workflow issues across the functional areas (Revenue cycle, practice workflow, etc)

 ***Building the multi-specialty technology offering –*** the 1-2 year vision of this role is to build the services and offering. A successful candidate will focus on:* ***Visioning and ideation*** – Resulting in a defined value proposition offering a unique and cutting-edge value proposition; effectively communicating this differentiated service offering to physician stakeholders
* Building the solution through collaborating with internal and external stakeholders. This position will be responsible for working with existing SCAH IT resources to pull together a comprehensive offering from internal, existing capabilities and either build or externally sourced capabilities. Some examples include:
	+ ***Technology Application Strategy*** – Identify 2-3 standard solutions that can be deployed and readily supported. These would include a PMS/EMR solution, mobile charge capture, patient engagement, etc
	+ ***Desktop Support*** – If the decision is made to keep this locally owned, work with existing help desk solution owners to develop an offering that is tailored to the practice space and architecture. If we insource this support, work with SCAH IT to inform decision on offering.
	+ ***EMR Optimization and Training*** – Work with existing training team to develop a training and optimization cosilting program in support of our Architecture and practice space
* ***Listening to the voice of the customer*** – Our most important stakeholders are our physician partners. Continuous improvement and implementation of (appropriate) feedback
* ***Supporting growth*** – Depending on the solution path (build or buy) and level of support determined to be appropriate; This role will potentially build out key support functions for clinical applications such as training, project management, and desktop support.

 ***Key Activities***:  

* Act as an advisor to other departments supporting OSP teammates to help them draw insights for existing analytical tools, as well as create requirements around new potential tools
* Work with and gain working relationships with Information Technology teammates
* Find ways to leverage existing enterprise data and information in company’s products and services
* Prioritize, plan, and track project progress for the department.
* Participate and lead management meetings in subject area
* Consult with and present to partnerships finding
* Utilize data analytics to uncover critical business insights and findings


Qualifications:  

* An undergraduate or graduate degree in business or technology related field
* A minimum of ten years of relevant healthcare experience
* Experience with large multisite medical groups is required
* Demonstrated experience with physician practice system selection, implementation, and on-going support
* Demonstrated understanding of key physician practice workflows (like Patient scheduling, Check-in/Check-out, Revenue cycle)
* Ability to collaborate with other departments and organizations (managed care, development, operations, MSO partnerships, physician partners etc.)
* Working knowledge of the latest technology solutions and trends in the specialty practice space
* Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to communicate
* Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with physicians
* Motivation to achieve individual and team goals, must be able to work independently and in a team environment.
* Ability to function as high-level executive and in the weeds in a start-up-like environment
* Travel requirements: As needed to support the company and partnerships (estimated <25%)


Min: USD $175,000.00/Yr. Max: USD $225,000.00/Yr.

title: Managing Director - IT Business Operations 994
description:
We are the leading provider of professional services to the middle market globally, our purpose is to instill confidence in a world of change, empowering our clients and people to realize their full potential. Our exceptional people are the key to our unrivaled, inclusive culture and talent experience and our ability to be compelling to our clients. You’ll find an environment that inspires and empowers you to thrive both personally and professionally. There’s no one like you and that’s why there’s nowhere like RSM.


The **Managing Director - IT Business Operations** , reporting to the CIO and a member of the IT executive leadership team (IT ELT), is a senior IT leader who supports the CIO in transforming IT to align with the firm’s goals and vision. They lead the Office of the CIO (OCIO), which coordinates and oversees various IT functions and projects, such as governance, financial performance, and the business of IT. They handle IT resource management, financial management, and 3rd party / vendor management, and ensure IT governance. They work with the CIO to design and implement IT operational strategies and ensure IT excellence and improvement. They build strategic relationships with the rest of the IT ELT and promotes firm culture and employee empowerment.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES**

**Business Acumen:** Aligns the OCIO with the firm’s vision and goals, and the industry's benchmarks and baselines. They make informed decisions and recommendations and communicate them effectively to various stakeholders. They initiate and support enterprise-wide operational excellence projects that create value and enhance capabilities. They secure resources and collaboration from key players across the organization and beyond, both onshore and offshore. They simplify and explain complex issues and solutions.


**Strategic IT Planning:** Develops and executes IT strategy and plans that align with the firm’s needs and vision. They examine issues and generate ideas with a long-term perspective and apply external and internal factors to strategy development. They consider the strategic impact of their decisions and direction and ensure that short-term and functional goals support the long-term strategy. They incorporate business priorities, strategies, goals, technologies, trends, and viability into their plans. They take a holistic systems perspective and envision, compare, and contrast multiple potential future states, reaching across Lines of Business, Functional Groups and 3rd party ecosystems. They challenge assumptions, develop and test hypotheses, facilitate scenarios, identify trends and inconsistencies, and apply creativity and critical analysis to achieve our objectives. They approve, sponsor, and lead the implementation of the IT strategic plan, and define the objectives, frameworks, and metrics for the IT scorecard process. They partner with senior IT leaders to integrate the IT strategic plan with the enterprise’s long-term plans.


**Tactical Execution:** Accountable for the daily operations of the IT organization including vendor relationships and contracts, resource utilization, growth plans, and financial oversight. This includes developing annual plans in concert with the CIO, the IT Operating Committee, the Digital Integration Group and the Finance organization. Evaluate ongoing activities across the organization for opportunities to create leverage and efficiencies. Provide regular, actionable reporting on operational performance.


**Enterprise Leadership:** Communicates persuasively to gain support, agreement, and commitment from business and IT stakeholders alike. They encourage others to take accountability and provide them with the information, training, and resources they need to make decisions and succeed. They execute complex campaigns and strategies to influence multiple audiences and stakeholders, and work toward a common goal in diverse situations. They allocate strategic decision-making authority and encourage risk taking and results orientation. They sponsor and champion challenges and build an empowering team of influencers, contributors, and managers. They lead the creation of an IT workforce strategy and develop, direct, coach, mentor, and reinforce team members. They foster cooperation, commitment, results, collaboration, trust, and team spirit. They demonstrate awareness of the organizational structure, culture, and power dynamics, and use them to inform and shape their behaviors and decisions. They maintain and form alliances with experts and decision makers and demonstrates strong negotiation and conflict management skills.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**

**EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor of Science or equivalent experience in Software Engineering and Management - Required
* Master of Business Administration - Preferred

**TECHNICAL/SOFT SKILLS**

* Experience managing the operations of a business or large group
* Strong leadership skills with experience managing teams to deliver complex business solutions
* Solid understanding of technology including infrastructure, vendor and custom solutions implementation and support
* Experience leading teams building on-premise, off-premise and hybrid solutions preferred
* Experience building business solutions with a strong understanding of business processes
* Strong conceptual, analytic, and expert problem-solving skills
