* Possess an understanding of software development practices
* Development experience preferred
* Experience leading QA, BA, and PMO teams
* Motivated to work in a growing environment
* Strong mentoring and training skills
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and influence skills and conveys an approachable demeanor

**EXPERIENCE**

* 15 year’s experience managing the financial operations, resource management and vendor management of a business or large group required
* 10 year’s experience leading technology teams, either discipline or solution teams required
* 5 years experience building enterprise-class on-premise, off-premise and hybrid solutions preferred
* 5 year’s experience developing and maintaining policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines required
* 5 years’ experience supporting clients, technology sales or business relationship management required
* Experience presenting to C-level executive and Board of Director levels required
* Proficiency in performing and reporting risk and business impact required
* Ability to determine when customization, development, or additional commercial products are required
* Strong experience in Agile and working within multiple frameworks preferred

**LEADERSHIP SKILLS**

* Strong leadership skills and the ability to work effectively with business managers, IT engineering and IT operations staff as well as non-IT areas such as Talent Acquisition, Finance, Procurement, and Human Resources
* Leads a multi-disciplined team through complex problems delivering quality outcomes, setting expectations, and delivering accordingly
* Instills strong business focus and a sense of urgency to deliver in alignment with business needs
* Provide thought leadership through innovative ideas, business and technology trends, competitive analysis, and internal collaboration
* Stays informed of current industry best practices; working with clients and internal cross-functional teams to apply best practices where appropriate
* Takes responsibility for business P&L and operating characteristics, ensuring business is informed and aligned with progress, current spend and projected budget
* Ability to influence without authority
* Ability to build strong relationships across lines of business, functional areas, and outside vendors
* Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively across the entire organization
* Ability to drive delivery and motivate teams,
* Strong leader: takes ownership, leads by example, creates, and motivates high-performing teams

At RSM, we offer a competitive benefits and compensation package for all our people. We support and inspire you to prioritize your wellbeing by delivering personalized, holistic programming for your physical, emotional, financial and community wellbeing. RSM has a generous time off policy with at least 14 paid holidays, wellbeing days and associate and above access to self-managed time off. We offer flexibility in your schedule, empowering you to balance life’s demands, while also maintaining your ability to serve clients. Learn more about our total rewards at https://rsmus.com/careers/working-at-rsm/benefits .


RSM is proud to be an Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We are proud to provide our employees with tools to assist them in being successful in achieving both personal and professional goals. We welcome and support all our employees to thrive in an environment free of discrimination and harassment. As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer all applicants will receive consideration for employment as RSM does not tolerate discrimination and/or harassment based on race; color; creed; sincerely held religious beliefs, practices or observances; sex (including pregnancy or disabilities related to nursing); gender (including gender identity and/or gender expression); sexual orientation; HIV Status; national origin; ancestry; familial or marital status; age; physical or mental disability; citizenship; political affiliation; medical condition (including family and medical leave); domestic violence victim status; past, current or prospective service in the US uniformed service; pre-disposing genetic characteristics or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local law.


Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process and/or employment/partnership. RSM is committed to providing equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete an application, interview, or otherwise participate in the recruiting process, please call us at 800-274-3978 or send us an email at careers@rsmus.com .


RSM does not intend to hire entry level candidates who will require sponsorship now OR in the future (i.e. F-1 visa holders). However, those candidates who may be recent U.S. college / university graduates possessing 1-2 years of progressive and relevant work experience, excluding internships, in the U.S. or his/her home country would be eligible for hire as an experienced candidate and thus eligible for sponsorship.


Compensation Range: $198,500 - $380,100

title: Director, Product & Design
description:
**About us:**



Chief is the largest network of senior executive women, representing more than 10,000 companies and 77% of Fortune 100 companies. Chief members are located across the U.S. and 40% are in the C-Suite.



Chief is designed to help our members maximize their leadership impact through powerful connections, valuable insights, and executive development. We offer a wide range of services both in-person and on our digital platform. We have clubhouse locations in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, San Francisco, and Washington, DC where our members can come together in community including at Chief-hosted events.



Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are central to our community and how we work. Knowing that our people are the most important driver of our success, we focus on building teams where the power of diverse voices, identities, perspectives, and experiences is celebrated.



Chief is backed by renowned investors including CapitalG, General Catalyst, Inspired Capital, and Primary Ventures and we've been recognized as one of TIME's 100 Most Influential Companies and one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies.


### **About the Role:**



Chief is seeking an experienced Product Leader to lead the product and design teams responsible for Chief's portfolio of digital products. Your role will be to lead the overall product strategy and roadmap while partnering closely with key business leads across our Learning & Development, Member Success, and Events & Community to drive the digital enablement of those services. This role is critical to setting the strategic direction for our digital products and will report directly to the Chief Product & Experience Officer.


### **What you'll do:**


* Develop and communicate a clear digital product strategy and roadmap aligned with business objectives
* Lead and inspire a cross-functional team of product managers and designers
* Identify new opportunities and areas of investment to build innovative products
* Champion user-centric design principles and ensure a seamless and intuitive user experience across digital products
* Define clear measurable goals to ensure teams are set up for success and regularly report on product metrics
* Utilize data and research-driven insights to measure product performance and make informed decisions
* Collaborate closely with key stakeholders (e.g., Learning & Development, Member Success, Events, Community, Research, Data, Software Engineering) to to align product initiatives with overall business goals
* Drive best practices to guide the team and establish ways of working

### **What you've done and enjoy doing:**


* Deep experience managing and building well-loved products in a B2C context, ideally across both web and mobile
* Experience leading product and design teams with proven ability to hire and grow talent
* Experience operating in ambiguity with a proven track record of building products that have clear impact to the business
* Deep experience leveraging data to make informed decisions with proven ability to set clear and measurable objectives
* Strong product intuition, showcasing deep user empathy in everything you do
* Proven track record in building collaborative partnerships across multi-disciplinary teams
* Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to influence and communicate cross-functionally and at all levels of the organization
* Must be authorized to work in the United States


**Note: Candidates based in NYC preferred**


### **Why You'll Want to Work Here:**


* Competitive salary and equity
* Flexible vacation policy and 4.5 day work weeks
* 20 weeks of paid gender neutral parental leave
* Full medical, dental, and vision packages, 401(k)
* Opportunity to work for a startup focused on driving real change for women in business
* Opportunity to create and attend inspiring experiences and events with leaders of the industry
* Access to our ongoing virtual Chief member exclusive content, including workshops, thought leadership, and iconic speakers
* Lifestyle and Learning Stipends available


While we're committed to remaining compliant and adhering to mandates, for us, pay transparency is more than a consideration of what's lawful and unlawful but rather, an opportunity to disclose what's required, and what we think is a fair and equitable compensation framework.



At Chief, we want to hire, develop, and retain the best talent, making Chief a top destination to accelerate your career. Our compensation framework is a key part of our vision, and we continually revisit and invest in our philosophy and framework to ensure we remain competitive and relevant, on a quest to achieve our vision.



The pay transparency mandates, as well as our own policies and practices, are a means of narrowing the gender pay gap and fostering an engaged and positive working environment that builds trust, on our mission to change the face of leadership.



The base salary for this role is: $215,000



Chief participates in the **E-Verify Program** in certain locations, as required by law.



https://assets.chief.com/careers/e-verify.pdf



https://assets.chief.com/careers/right-to-work-poster.pdf

title: Executive Director, Product Operations
description:
TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.
  

  

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.


**Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At TriNet, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every single qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.**

As an Executive Director of Product Operations, you will be responsible for overseeing all stages of the Product Lifecyle, including development, launch, growth, maturity, and decline. You will be part of the Product leadership team, responsible for operational discipline, aligning top down goals with bottom up innovation, and creating standards and best practices for internal teams. This role will orchestrate cross-team collaboration with product teams and stakeholders. You will manage a team that ensures product initiatives are delivered efficiently and timely.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead and oversee planning activities, including the development and execution of strategic initiatives, management of the product portfolio, and creation of comprehensive roadmaps to drive the successful achievement of organizational goals.
* Lead the continuous improvement of product development lifecycle processes, including partnering with Agile center of excellence and the engineering team to drive definition, tools, community of practice, and measurement.
* Enable Product Go-To-Market, driving product launch-related activities.
* Equip Product colleagues with tools, processes, best practices, and data to make the organization more effective, streamline operations and enhance overall efficiency.
* Collect and manage data, including quantitative and qualitative insights.
* Collaborate with Product leadership to establish KPIs and metrics for operational success.
* Implement robust reporting mechanisms to track and communicate key operational metrics and performance indicators.
* Foster strong collaboration between Product, Engineering, Design, and other internal stakeholders.
* Establish communication channels that allow for engagement with stakeholder requests, responsible for synthesizing stakeholder and direct customer feedback and managing timelines, deliverables, and expectations.
* Collaborate with People team to optimize resource allocation and ensure optimal organizational structure, addressing resource constraints and strategizing for resource scalability.
* Collaborate with Finance and Product leadership to manage Product budget, monitor and report financial metrics and provide product purchasing oversight.

**Education:**

BA/BS required
  

Graduate degree preferred
  

  

**Experience**  

10-12 years’ experience in Product, Program Management, Consulting, Technology Portfolio Management or similar roles with demonstrated operations leadership


Experience in a B2B software company preferred
  

  

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Ability to influence key stakeholders, demonstrating strong emotional intelligence and ability to work with different personalities.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, including effectively interacting with executive leadership and presenting to on behalf of Product.
* Act as trusted advisor to executives, strong strategy and management consulting experience
* Ability to anticipate needs.
* Strategic thinking - Ability to break complex problems down into component parts.
* Experience leading multiple high-profile projects distributed across set of stakeholders without direct ownership of resources.
* Tailored communication style, providing clear and consistent communication between product and other teams.
* Proven ability to drive organizational change.
* Highest level of integrity and discretion in managing confidential information.
* Expert in organizing and analyzing data sets – expert with data analysis tools.
* Advanced presentation skills using variety of mediums – expert at MSOffice.
* Knowledge of agile development methodologies.
* Skilled with product management tools and technologies.

The salary range for this role is $157,700 to $302,760. The candidate’s final salary offer will be based on the candidate’s skills, education, work location and experience.


A candidate’s compensation may also include bonuses consistent with TriNet’s corporate bonus plan.


Additionally, subject to applicable eligibility requirements, TriNet offers permanent full-time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, a 401(K) savings plan, an employee stock purchase plan, eleven (11) Company observed holidays, PTO and a comprehensive leave program. Please click the following link for detailed information about our benefits offerings: https://www.trinet.com/documents/blt5b61a1040aae1904


Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity.


TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact recruiting@trinet.com to request such an accommodation.

title: Vice President, Deputy General Counsel(Vendor Contracting, Clinical, IT, Information Security, Privacy, IP/Trademark & Paralegal Support)
description:
Job Summary:
The VP, Deputy General Counsel is an essential member of the Chief Legal Officer’s leadership team and is responsible for assisting the General Counsel in all functions of the Legal Department as may be requested. The VP, Deputy General Counsel is primarily responsible for leading the team and providing day-to-day legal advice related to vendor contracting, clinical, information technology (IT), information security, privacy, intellectual property and trademark/copyright and management of the paralegals. In pertinent part, the legal advice this position and team provide will help to ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policy, Medicare and Medicaid.
Essential Functions:*Role Specific** Provide key strategic legal guidance and advice to senior leaders in topical area such as Clinical, Vendor Contracting, Information Technology, Information Security, Privacy, Real Estate, and Intellectual Property/Copyright/Trademark.
* Work closely with Sourcing, Clinical, Privacy and IT leadership and teams to identify and reduce known and potential regulatory, legal and business risks.
* Work closely with Clinical and Quality Management leadership and teams to manage legal risk associated with utilization management, care management, and quality management including regulatory, policy and procedure, and operational compliance.
* Oversee and manage the paralegals supporting the OGC team. Ensure appropriate use and development of paralegals.

*General** Manage and mitigate legal risk through effective and proactive legal support across all business units, affiliates, and markets in assigned topical areas.
* Provide secondary support for business development work and corporate transactions.
* Independently assess, communicate, and mitigate risk while providing sound legal advice and counsel to all levels of leadership within the organization.
* Influence strategic decision making at the highest levels of the organization, including the Executive Leadership Team.
* Draft policies and procedures needed by CareSource to ensure business operations are compliant with internal and external requirements.
* Supervise a team of attorneys who provides legal advice and support on a wide range of corporate matters for assigned senior leaders, topical areas, or business divisions.
* Collaborate and establish trusting partnerships with internal and external stakeholders including business owners, business partners, and colleagues.
* Manage and direct outside counsel and other legal support partners.
* Help develop and manage other attorneys and non-attorney staff with the goal of ensuring a high performing and high functioning OGC team that is trusted and valued by the business.
* Assist in the preparation of board materials, reports, and presentations.
* Participate in management committees and workgroups as assigned.
* Interact with management team as well as with external representatives of regulatory agencies, governmental entities and others.
* Perform any other job duties as requested.


Education and Experience:* Completion of a Juris Doctorate degree program at an accredited college/university is required.
* Minimum of ten (10) years health care experience in managed care and/or related health care industry is required.
* Experience with Medicaid/Medicare regulations is required.
* Demonstrated progressive leadership responsibilities required.
* Demonstrated people management skills is required.
* Demonstrated experience supporting senior leadership is required.


Competencies, Knowledge and Skills:* Advanced expertise in a wide range of topics related to health care law such as, HIPAA/privacy, information security, intellectual property/copyright/trademark, utilization management/utilization review, regulatory compliance, Medicaid and Medicare issues
* Advanced expertise in contract drafting, review, and negotiations
* Advanced expertise in health care/managed care regulatory environment
* Top analytic, research and organizational skills
* Advanced Microsoft Office skills, including Word
* Broad internet research skills
* Excellent written and oral communications skills
* Strong customer service and team orientation
* Excellent time/project management and prioritization skills
* Ability to excel in fluid, dynamic environment


Licensure and Certification:* Must be a member in good standing of a State Bar
* Current, unrestricted license to practice law is required


Working Conditions:* General office environment; may be required to sit or stand for extended periods of time


Compensation range $150,000-$300,000. CareSource takes into consideration a combination of a candidate’s education, training, and experience as well as the position’s scope and complexity, the discretion and latitude required for the role, and other external and internal data when establishing a salary level. We are highly invested in every employee’s total well-being and offer a substantial and comprehensive total rewards package.
Compensation Type (hourly/salary):
Salary
Organization Level Competencies* Create an Inclusive Environment
* Cultivate Partnerships
* Develop Self and Others
* Drive Execution
* Energize and Inspire the Organization
* Influence Others
* Pursue Personal Excellence
* Understand the Business

  

This job description is not all inclusive. CareSource reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. CareSource is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veteran status. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: Senior Director, IT Business Excellence (Remote)
description:
Responsible for supporting Business and Corporate Services functions with IS/IT solutions and capabilities that support Nordson strategic and operational goals and objectives. Build and maintaining strong business relationships through trust, effective communication, and IS/IT delivery. This position will develop a continuous improvement process to address Business process and operational excellence opportunities.


This position may also advise the CIO to mature IS/IT capabilities and services including but not limited to building and maintaining frameworks for Strategic Business Planning, IS/IT Planning, Operational Excellence, Organizational Change Management, IS/IT Employee Engagement, and Talent Management.


Organizational responsibilities will include introducing, managing, and maturing the following global resource groups:


* Project Management Office [PMO]
* Business Analyst Office [BAO]
* Merger & Acquisitions Team [MAT]
* Business Management Office [BMO]

**Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities**

**Business Relationships**

* Establish strong relationships with Corporate Service Functions’ Leadership.
* Create regular Program / Project Reporting to ensure Business Leaders are involved and connected to ongoing progress.
* Establish a seat at the table with Business Leaders.
* Be the focal point to address Business Leaders’ comments, concerns, and questions.

**Planning and Execution (Strategic and Operational)**

* Establish 3-year strategies and annual business plans to effectively deliver to Nordson’s strategic priorities.
* Implement Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) to manage commitments, successes, and obstacles to provide transparency on all areas of IS/IT delivery.
* Develop and maintain a Program/Project Intake Process to address annual and on-going business needs.
* Create department business plans, individual employee goals and service level agreements as necessary with robust metrics to ensure continual improvement targets are achieved.
* Establish a continuous performance efforts, monitoring, and reporting systems. Closely monitor operational success measures, producing timely and accurate reports to track progress in delivering to strategies and plans.
* Implement an RCA (Root Cause Analysis) mindset and methodology to drive continual improvement efforts for the Corporate Services Functions and the Corporate Services IT Organization.
* Regularly report the status of performance improvement efforts and impacts.
* Design, develop and monitor a balanced scorecard and Organization Maturity Model process and reporting. Ensure adherence to reporting quality and timelines.
* Direct PMO, BAO, MAT and BMO - with responsibility for delivering operational excellence for all IS/IT Functions.

**Operational Excellence**

* Implement a Value Stream Mapping capability within Nordson IS/IT Organization.
* Partnering with division leaders and internal IS/IT leaders to identify potential process and system improvement areas documenting current As-Is flows and determine future To-Be flows that can improve overall organizational and system performance.

**Frameworks**

* Establish a **Strategic Planning Framework** to capture the Business Functions strategies and objectives that can be used to develop the IS/IT response.
* Develop and implement a **Quarterly Business Plan** **Framework** and process that will drive quarterly planning and execution. Build a Quarterly Business Review (QBR) process that ensures all stakeholders are aligned on the status, successes, and obstacles.
* Rollout an **RCA (Root Cause Analysis) Framework** , process, and mindset to continually address improvement areas and to determine root causes of issues to eliminate future issues.

**IS/IT Services Portfolio & Project Management Office**

* Maintain the Corporate Services Portfolio and Reporting.
* Ensure all Program/Project Managers are aligned on project execution methodologies and reporting requirements.

**Technology Enablement**

* Manage through IS/IT Leaders within the technology organization all technology aspects from day-to-day operations to issue & resolution management processes to maintain agreed upon services levels.
* Stay abreast of the latest technology trends and applications that support the Corporate Services Functions operations. Communicate with the Business Partners what the trends are and how the organizations may leverage new advancements in technological capabilities.

**Talent Management**

* Build and effective and motivated IT team.
* Create an environment where the IT team thrives providing understanding of the IT and Business strategies and where they fit into the Big Picture (their line-of-sight). Provide opportunities to grow and timely feedback on performance with the eye to increase individual and team performance.
* Implement a semi-annual and annual Talent Management Process to discuss individuals and growth opportunities within the IS/IT Team.

**Quarterly Business Review Reporting**

* Manage metrics reporting pertaining to business drivers, labor drivers, service levels and risk indicators. Communicate to various stakeholders on a monthly/quarterly basis with recommendations for improvements.
* Continually investigate ways to simplify and automate scorecard metrics capture and reporting.
* Coordinate, manage and facilitate Corporate Services Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) with Division Leaders, Segment/Corporate Business Partners and IS/IT Leaders.

**Financial Management**

* Implement an effective financial management and communication model to support visibility of costs and benefits of Programs, Projects, and IT Organization processes.
* Create and manage the IS/IT Budget.

**Vendor Management**

* Conduct periodic vendor management reviews as needed to ensure satisfaction.
* Manage Vendor Relationship and performance to ensure value is being delivered.
* Manage internal organizational resources to ensure all service capabilities are executed to meet service level agreements.
* Manage external resources as needed to ensure services rendered meet or exceed the organization’s needs.

**IT Leadership Team Member**

* Participate as an active team member of the overall IS/IT organization leadership team.
* Provide insights, ideas, and collaboration to enhance a connected IT Organization.

**Education and Experience Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree in computer sciences, or similar discipline. Master’s degree is a plus.
* 15+ years of relevant work experience in IS/IT management.
* Proven track record of effectively leading and managing employees, managing performance, setting goals for team/individuals and provide mentoring.
* Project management experience, including leading, delivering and implementation projects for new solutions in complex environments with many involved parties (technical disciplines, IT, software vendors, outsourcing partners etc.)
* A natural ability to engage and communicate with customers to understand their needs and unique challenges

**Skills and Abilities**

* Organizational skills and works effectively with a vast array of information and to cope with rapidly changing information, able to manage multiple tasks as well as multiple customers, ability to work independently and be highly organized.
* Tolerance for Ambiguity with Sound judgment, initiative, resourcefulness, tenacity, and the flexibility to operate independently in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong communication, interpersonal, relationship skills to be able to interact at all levels.
* Strong Financial acumen and fluency
* Understand customer/organizational business functions and requirements, expertly evaluate existing, new, and emerging technology and/or applications, which may provide solutions for the requirements and to provide expert leadership and assist in implementing the solution to the customer’s satisfaction. The candidate must understand the interrelationships of all functional and technical areas.
* Combination of high level of IS/technical and business/functional knowledge.
* Manage teams of both technical and business/functional background.
* Turn insights into compelling narratives and executive presentations using dashboards and visualization.
* Support business ideation and requirements discovery activities including conducting demos, scoping assessments, build recommendations, rapid prototypes, discuss sourcing options and deliver projects.
* Manage all aspects of projects including business needs, technical implementation, schedule, scope, stakeholder management and communication.
* Strong communication, presentation, project management and time management skills
* Enthusiasm and drive to be a leader in our team, helping shape and develop its future.

**Working Conditions and Physical Demands**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


**Travel Required** 

Estimated 5%


Base Salary Range for this position is: $213,000 - $267,000
  

, and bonus target is 20%; shift premium may be available depending on shift associated with the specific job opportunity. Benefits including Medical, Rx, Vision, Dental, and Health Savings Account (HSA), Retirement and Security benefits including 401k and Life Insurance. During the first year of employment, employees may accrue up to 15 days of Paid Time Off (PTO), equivalent to 120 hours. Employees receive 13 paid holidays. In addition to Paid Time Off and paid Holidays, each employee receives 16 hours paid time each calendar year to perform volunteer services for Nordson-sponsored events. Ample opportunities for giving exist at Nordson including our Matching Gifts Program.


The base salary pay range for this job level is a general guideline and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to internal equity, business considerations, and local market conditions, as well as candidate qualifications, such as education, experience, and skills.


Nordson Corporation provides equal employment opportunity to all applicants and employees. No person is to be discriminated against in any aspect of the employment relationship due to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment drug screening and background/criminal check, consistent with applicable laws.Third party recruiters and agencies should not contact employees of Nordson or its subsidiaries directly. Any resumes sent to a hiring manager or submitted to Nordson employees are considered unsolicited and property of Nordson. Nordson will not pay a placement fee unless the agency or recruiter has a signed contract with Nordson’s Human Resources department in advance of submitting a candidate for consideration. Verbal and written approvals will not be considered a valid contract for service.

title: Associate Director, Affiliate Technology Services
description:
**Planned Parenthood** is the nation’s leading provider and advocate of high-quality, affordable sexual and reproductive health care for all people, as well as the nation’s largest provider of sex education. With more than 600 health centers across the country, Planned Parenthood organizations serve all patients with care and compassion, with respect, and without judgment, striving to create equitable access to health care. Through health centers, programs in schools and communities, and online resources, Planned Parenthood is a trusted source of reliable education and information that allows people to make informed health decisions. We do all this because we care passionately about helping people lead healthier lives.  

  

**Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA)** is a 501(c)(3) charitable organization that supports the independently incorporated Planned Parenthood affiliates operating health centers across the U.S. **Planned Parenthood Action Fund** is an independent, nonpartisan, not-for-profit membership organization formed as the advocacy and political arm of Planned Parenthood Federation of America. The Action Fund engages in educational, advocacy, and electoral activity, including grassroots organizing, legislative advocacy, and voter education.  

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) seek a collaborative and effective Assoc Director, Affiliate Tech Services. This job reports to the Director, Affiliate Tech Services in the Information Technology department of PPFA. The Information Technology department provides technology strategy, operational support, and tech delivery /implementation of the information technology products and services while the Information Security program safeguards the data entrusted to Planned Parenthood by its patients, supporters, donors, and staff. **Purpose:**  

This position is the coordinator of Affiliate Tech Services across the National Office for seamless service delivery for the federation. Work closely with other InfoSec, IT, and National Office teams on strategic initiatives impacting Affiliates. The Associate Director, Affiliate Tech Services, is expected to have a proven track record of successful results for enterprise-wide services & program management, process excellence, and relationship management accountabilities. Has a solid Technology and Information Security background.* Leads program & project management responsibilities for successfully implementing federation-wide tech services from the National Office to the Affiliates. Strives for flawless delivery of key Affiliate Tech Services & Programs.
* Stays current with industry trends, methodologies, and program management best practices.
* This requires knowing the business, across the federation and is responsible for fostering trusted partnerships and driving information technology priorities for shared services to mature the basic security layer.

 **Engagement:**
* Supports the Director and National Director of Affiliate Tech Services in collaborating with key stakeholders at the National Office for all Tech Services.
* Advises managers and teams on new approaches that sustain tech services and drive continuous improvement based on stakeholder feedback.
* Knows the business and fosters trusted partnerships across the federation to drive all technology and information security priorities for shared services.
* Supports the education of Affiliate stakeholders on tech services and creates content on service offerings and value proposition of all tech services.
* Includes planning and tracking, collaboration with teams and stakeholders, creation of educational materials, and delivery of educational services
* Ability to pivot and lead by example when priorities shift or requirements change
* Builds and maintains strong affiliate relationships.
* Key leadership point of contact for affiliate escalations and service client satisfaction for all risk management-related services.

 **Delivery:**  

Responsible for ensuring successful implementation and support of National Office Tech Services. Services are to be determined by the National Director, Affiliate Tech Services.* Creates a Tech Services Framework across National Office Tech Services for service delivery methodology.
* Delivery includes the ability to define, develop, and deploy these specified new tech shared services federation-wide.
* Responsible for creating and managing detailed project plans, including onboarding approach, deployment tactics and methods, post-deployment project management, and ongoing customer satisfaction.
* Ensure Affiliate satisfaction meets or exceeds expectations as measured by annual Affiliate satisfaction surveys.
* Manage escalation process for Affiliates regarding Tech Services issues that may arise and lead continuous improvement activities with Affiliates.
* Stay current with program and deployment best practices and principles to enable consistent delivery and enable alignment with long-term direction.
* Stay up to date on new tools & techniques in the information technology and security industry.
* Work directly with enterprise architecture and operations subject matter experts to enable successful project deployments applying the recommended tools, technologies and techniques.
* Ensure seamless transition from service delivery process to operational business as usual processes in partnership for all tech services.
* Perform reporting of service metrics/ standards that ensure consistent quality in service/ program/ portfolio deliverables
* Adapt and evolve services, programs, and approach to meet the ever-changing needs of the federation.
* Participate in the development of strategic tech shared services roadmap and prioritized capabilities based on Affiliate feedback, needs, and technical direction.
* Organize work outputs to support optimal delivery through adapting procedures, including defining and following repeatable processes that scale with the federation’s growth
* Stay current with industry trends, methodologies and program management best practices
* **Responsible for vendor management practices, including:**
* License and contract management
* RFPs for new or renewal services/tools
* Metrics tracking and remediation planning
* Hold vendors accountable through a detailed Statement of Work and clear roles/responsibilities.
* Foster development best practices within the team.
* Identify and drive process improvements for Vendor Management as part of Service Delivery touchpoints.
* Support Director with accurate budget management, reporting, and process improvements to benefit the Affiliate Tech Services tower and CIO team overall
* Responsible for Weekly, Monthly, and Quarterly Project metrics and status reporting.
* Drives service roadmaps and new features/functionality for each service's annual planning and lifecycle management.
* Building trust and credibility with National Office stakeholders and the federation is imperative for success.
* Align with corporate policies and customer needs/expectations. Accountable for daily tasks, on time, on budget, and on scope.
* Ensure enterprise processes are in place to support affiliate services for continuous improvement.

 **Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):**
* Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years of broad-based information technology experience with a strong focus on the information security domain. Expertise in the following areas: delivering complex technology capabilities and enterprise program management leadership with a proven track record of delivery success as measured by customer satisfaction.
* Experience in a regulated industry a plus, specifically healthcare
* **Skills**
* Solid service delivery experience in a cross-functional environment is required.
* Strong executive presence, communication, and collaboration skills with Senior Leadership
* Practical IT experience with modern information security technologies and vendor solutions to include but not limited to strong authentication, network security, endpoint security, cloud/SaaS/PaaS security, security information and event management, SSDLC, mobile security, privacy, and regulatory compliance.
* Effective and flexible project management
* **Abilities**
* Proven trusted advisor in the shared services operating model.
* Experience leading, coordinating vendor solution delivery and partnering effectively with vendors to meet affiliate and National Office business needs.
* Project Management Professional Certification (PMP) desired, but not required with relevant security or technology work experience.
* Experience with information security frameworks: HIPAA, PCI DSS, NIST, ISO 27001.

 **Travel:**0-10% travel, as needed  



$130,000 - $140,000 a year
Total offer package to include generous vacation + sick leave + paid holidays, individual/family provided medical, dental and vision benefits effective day 1, life insurance, short/long term disability, paid family leave and 401k. We also offer voluntary opt-in for Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Transportation/Commuter accounts.  

We value a truly diverse workforce and a culture of inclusivity and belonging. Our goal is to attract qualified candidates and encourage applications from all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. ***PPFA participates in the E-Verify program and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.***  

#LI-SY1* PDN-HR

  

Roles that are denoted as NYC, DC, or both will work a hybrid schedule, requiring 2-3 days per week in the office **unless the role is denoted as onsite**, which requires working onsite full time or 5 days per week.

title: Director, Website Strategy and Performance-Remote
description:
DeVry University strives to close our society’s opportunity gap by preparing learners to thrive in careers shaped by continuous technological change. Through innovative programs, relevant partnerships, and exceptional care, we empower students to meaningfully improve their lives, communities, and workplaces.

When you apply for a DeVry University career, you become part of an institution that dates back to 1931. Our colleagues are passionate about higher education and shaping the future of today’s learners.

**Opportunity**  
As Director, Marketing - Web Strategy and Performance, you will be responsible for the overall strategy of DeVry University’s website, DeVry.edu, creating an optimal, compelling, and personalized audience-first experience. You will leverage data analytics, personalization strategies, and analytic tools to help increase demand while strengthening the positioning of our brand.  
This role will manage a team comprised in the areas of Web Design, Web Publishing, SEO, and Analytics to create a cohesive and connected experience, tailored to audience needs. In this role, you will design analytically driven plans to deliver audience-centric paths to increase quality web traffic and website lead generation, set test agendas to improve visitor-to-lead conversion, set the agenda for continuous performance improvement, and define roadmaps to fully leverage our web technology stack.  
**Responsibilities**

* The Director, Marketing – Website Strategy and Performance leads website initiatives on DeVry.edu to increase website performance including web traffic, inquiry generation, and audience engagement that supports brand reputation and enrollments in DeVry University programs
* Drive long-term web strategy, utilizing modern marketing approaches, balancing data, technology, design, and audience needs
* Define and manage Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and forecasts with an eye towards daily lead generation performance tracking to goals
* Rigorous use of analytics to track and manage performance, inform decisions on website content, priorities, and real-time understanding of website engagement and traffic patterns that drive actions to improve conversion and remedy any shortfalls
* Strong collaboration with cross-functional teams is essential, including members of IT, Academics, and Strategic Enrollment to ensure that web initiatives are implemented to support University strategies while maintaining performance and conversion
* Develop requirements necessary to deliver web enhancements and work with the web development team to scope and deliver timely solutions. Familiar with Agile methodologies and able to define Epics and User Stories to manage sprint cycles and ticket prioritization
* Ensures SLAs are met for publishing and management of all technology requirements including maintenance needs of web systems and technology partner integrations used to generate and capture demand
* Must be passionate about building digital experiences that delight and enables our audiences to find the right information at the right time that is informed by outside-in perspective and understanding of audience insights
* Develop and translate business cases into a roadmap, providing structure and order to the Website team
* Lead UX optimization strategy through A|B test planning and execution to maximize conversion lifts and return on investment
* Partner with the Marketing content team on website SEO strategy to improve page ranking and increase organic website traffic through keyword optimization tactics, implementation of schema, page optimization, and other technical enhancements
* Lead cross-functional team initiatives managing additional contact sub-channels such as chat, toll-free-number, and text
* Manage external agencies specializing in SEO, link building, web analytics, and accessibility.
* Assures all content is compliance approved and meets brand guidelines

**Qualifications**  
Below are the minimum requirements of the education, experience, knowledge, and skills required to competently perform in this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Minimum 10 years of experience in digital marketing including web, SEO, digital advertising, marketing, lead generation, and acquisition, with extensive experience with developing state-of-the-art website experiences
* Methodical, metrics-driven approach to continuous improvement; strong analytical skills with the ability to identify insights and translate them into action
* Hands-on experience with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Google Analytics, and Salesforce
* On the leading edge of best practices for high performing, highly functional, on-brand, and modern acquisition-focused websites
* Demonstrated mastery of SEO fundamentals using website technology, architecture, and content to deliver outstanding organic search performance
* Excellent project management, analytical and problem-solving skills — scoping work, driving execution, and delivering on deadlines while working with multiple stakeholders
* Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate findings to executives; comfortable working with data to build effective business reviews
* Has phenomenal attention to detail and a passion for delivering the highest quality and error-free websites
* Has a strong track record of delivering work above expectations, on time, and on budget
* Comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that is passionate about innovation
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically and execute effectively with strong solutions and results orientation
* Clearly sets expectations for direct reports, evaluates performance, and makes recommendations to aid their career growth
* Educational industry experience an advantage, but not required
* Bachelor's degree required, preferably in marketing, web design/development, or a related field
* MBA/Master's Degree preferred

**DeVry University offers competitive wages and benefit options, including:**

* 401(k) and Roth Plan w/match
* Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
* Paid Parental Leave
* Health Advocacy Service
* Family and Domestic Partner Coverage
* Tax Savings Account (FSA and HSA)
* Short-Term/Long-Term Disability Coverage
* Life, Accident, AD&D, Critical Illness Insurance
* Fertility Coverage
* Wellness Programs
* Volunteer Time Off
* Remote and Flex Work Options
* Technology Stipend
* Paid Tuition Program
* Auto/Homeowners, Pet and Legal Insurance
* Exclusive Discount Programs
* Adoption Assistance
* Career Development Programs
* Mental Health Care Programs
* Family Care Services
* 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation service

Benefits vary based on employment status. Part-time/Visiting Professors positions may not be eligible for all benefits.

We believe diversity is essential to our educational mission and to the success of our community. We are committed to fostering a working environment where differences are respected, valued and embraced.

Pay: $140,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Operations, CST
description:
Lyrasis serves as the Organizational Home for various community supported technologies including ArchivesSpace, CollectionSpace, DSpace, Fedora, and VIVO. Lyrasis provides critical resources in the form of accounting, HR, program management, executive leadership, and support services to the open-source software (OSS) communities to help them grow and be sustainable.


The Community Supported Technologies (CST) Director's purpose is to foster relationships with community governance, increase effectiveness and impact of division programs, to grow and ensure long term sustainability of the programs in our portfolio, and to grow our ability to support new programs. An important component of this position is review and analysis of the organizational home model and how it can be enhanced. Critical to this role is continued analysis and outreach to the larger open-source communities to grow the programs within the organizational home.


The CST Director is deeply engaged with community governance and respectful of the specific community's needs while working with communities to achieve long-term and strategic goals.


Leadership, innovation, trust, and relationship building are key in this position.

**Impact**


This position strives to make connections among Community Supported Technologies (CST) programs but also to the larger Lyrasis portfolio to enable a more seamless experience for members. Our success lies in our ability to pull the different stands of Lyrasis together more effectively for members.


The success of these programs positions Lyrasis as a leader in the open-source community. Effective work in this area positions Lyrasis as the center of our members' ecosystem. The CST programs and their impacts are core to the success of the open-source, open access, community-led future for which our members strive.

**Duties/Job Responsibilities:**

* Establishes and executes organizational engagement strategies that align with Lyrasis' vision, mission and goals with the members and future members that this position touches through its engagement
* Oversees the operational staff for each program - leads, directs, supervises, influences, and/or evaluates the work of those reporting to the director
* Evaluates the organizational home model; recommends and implements model enhancements
* Works to grow the organizational home program participants in productive and beneficial ways
* Serves as a key collaborator with community driven program governance for effective programs with meaningful impacts and long-term sustainability
* Cultivates and sustains effective internal relationships within Lyrasis
* Creates and sustains effective relationships with members, vendors, and partner organizations. In some cases, the director serves on program governance boards.
* Coordinates training, cross-training, mentoring and performance evaluations as needed for division staff
* Represents Lyrasis at regional, national, and international conferences to engage with members and inform future activities

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**

* Supervises program staff including program managers and technical staff for ArchivesSpace, CollectionSpace, DSpace, Fedora, and VIVO. Some of the program staff also supervise staff.
* Supervises overall relationships with contractors for programs.

 **Skills and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree required, MLIS or similar degree preferred
* 7+ years of increasing responsibility in a library, archives, museum, consortium, library related vendor, or non-profit membership organization
* Direct management experience leading programs with a wide variety of stakeholders working in disparate locations
* Experience leading software development teams
* Experience with budget preparation, fiscal knowledge, and fiscal stewardship
* Strong team-building skills, both between and within functional teams
* Project and program abilities at the regional, national, and international levels
* Ability to communicate effectively both in person and virtually using a variety of media and technologies
* Superior presentation and writing skills
* A commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where differences and complexities in background, cultures, values, and viewpoints are valued

 **Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience in open-source and community supported software
* Familiarity with software development processes, particularly agile
* Experience with forecasting financial models, including forecasting

 **Physical Demands:**

* Occasional travel to conferences and meetings

 **Position Location:**

* This position is part of a geographically and institutionally distributed team and applications from candidates interested in telecommuting are welcome.

**Applications will accepted until the position is filled but review of applications will begin on February 6, 2024.**


All applications should include a resume and cover letter or brief statement of interest in the position.


At Lyrasis, one of our core values is to provide an inclusive environment to all who are employed here.Therefore, the organization is intentional in providing fair and equitable employment opportunities to all applicants, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Director of Product - Ads + Growth
description:
**Company Overview**
--------------------



ID.me is a high-growth enterprise software company that simplifies how people prove and share their identity online. The company empowers people to control their data through a portable and trusted login, which means they don't need to create a new password when visiting sites that have the ID.me button. ID.me's digital identity network has over 117 million registered members, and is used by fourteen federal agencies, agencies in 30 states and over 600 corporations for secure identity proofing and verification.



ID.me's technology meets the federal standards for consumer authentication set by the Commerce Department and is approved as a NIST 800-63-3 IAL2 / AAL2 credential service provider by the Kantara Initiative. In addition to helping people control their credentials and data, the company's "No Identity Left Behind" initiative strives to expand digital access and inclusion for all people. The company offers multiple pathways to identity verification – online self-serve, live video chat agents, and in person. ID.me is passionate about building a robust identity network that does not compromise access for traditionally underserved groups.



ID.me has received numerous awards including Deloitte's 2023 Technology Fast 500, Washington Business Journal's Fastest Growing Companies, Entrepreneur Magazine's 100 Brilliant Companies and Wall Street Journal's Startup of the Year finalist. In recent quarters, ID.me announced it raised $132 million in Series D funding, led by Viking Global Investors with participation from CapitalG, Morgan Stanley Counterpoint, FTV Capital, PSP Growth, Auctus Investment Group, Moonshots Capital, and Scout Ventures. ID.me's most recent round brings the total investment in ID.me to over $275 million since its founding in 2010.

**Role Overview**
-----------------



We are seeking a **Director of Product - Ads + Growth** who will lead key consumer advertising and email experiences for members and partners of ID.me Marketplaces. The Product Leader will build a scalable, performance-based ads platform to drive value to the thousands of brands ID.me Shop works with, own Ads pricing, and will serve as the business owner for Ads.


**Responsibilities**


* Independently drive product strategy, roadmap, and execution
* Empathize with users and understand their needs
* Breakdown problems using First-Principles thinking
* Develop ID.me Marketplaces product vision and strategy
* Define Key Performance Indicators (KPI) for your product
* Write high quality, detailed requirements documents
* Prioritize features using data and insights
* Develop a program plan that incorporates interdependencies between functional areas
* Conduct market research for expansion into new markets and vertical segments
* Collaborate with cross-functional leaders to ensure the commercial success of ID.me's products
* Operates a high-performance organization. Holds high standards, continually synthesizes the situation, and is able to anticipate risks.

**Ideal Qualifications**
------------------------


* 15+ years of building scalable ads platforms and networks
* Undergraduate degree in business, economics, engineering, computer science, or similar discipline
* MBA preferred but not required
* Deep knowledge of ads industry - competition, business models, law, evolving technologies
* Proven track record of launching and scaling "zero-to-one" products as well as driving innovation and growth for mature products
* Ability to drive clarity where there is ambiguity
* Strength in applying processes in a fast-paced environment while maintaining room for flexibility and quick iterations
* Thought leader with successful track record of communicating effectively with senior leadership


Ideal candidate will thrive in the following culture:


* Must have an obsession for building quality products
* Ability to thrive when there are changing priorities and shifting of gears
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Must be a team player with a strong, self-managing work ethic
* Must be a self-starter with a passion for technology, learning and continuous improvement


Note that candidates must be located in the continental U.S.



**Vision:** To be the world's leading digital identity network empowering people to control their own information and to prove their credentials across all channels: online, call center, and in-person.


**Mission:** To make the world a more trusted place by delivering the highest level of security with the least amount of friction at the lowest possible cost.


**People:** We have an audacious mission. We aim to fix the identity layer of the internet. Billions of people will live better lives with more trust and convenience thanks to ID.me. We are like Special Forces. We take on the most difficult challenges with amazing teammates.


**ID.me** **Core Values:** \\*Don't be a jerk. \\*Always compete. \\*Ask questions like a 5-year old. \\*Inspire people with your passion. \\*Make something better every day. \\*Treat each customer like your favorite family member. \\*Own your mistakes so you can learn from them. \\*Details are everything. \\*Communicate like a scientist. \\*Be truthful (even when it's hard). \\*Reflect ID.me's values in your actions. \\*Act like an owner.



ID.me Career Site & Culture Deck: https://www.id.me/careers#LI-JP1



The annual base salary listed below for this role is based on experience, skills, education, relevant training and geographic location. Company bonus, incentive for sales roles, equity, and benefits are available depending on the role.



ID.me offers comprehensive medical, dental, vision, health savings account, flexible spending accounts (medical, limited purpose, dependent care, commuter benefit accounts), basic and voluntary life and AD&D insurance, 401(k) with company match, parental leave, ability to participate in unlimited paid time off subject to the terms and conditions of the PTO policy, including 8 company wide holidays, short and long-term disability insurance, accident and critical illness insurance, referral bonus policy, employee assistance program, pet insurance, travel assistant program, wellbeing and childcare discounts, benefit advocates, and a learning and development benefit.



The above represents the anticipated total rewards package for this job requisition. Final offers may vary from the amount listed based on qualifications, professional experiences, skills, education, relevant training, geographic location, and other job related factors.

**Pay Range**


$195,000—$225,000 USD
ID.me maintains a work environment free from discrimination, where employees are treated with dignity and respect. All ID.me employees share in the responsibility for fulfilling our commitment to equal employment opportunity. ID.me does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. ID.me adheres to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, promotion, benefits, social and recreational programs, and discipline. In addition, ID.me's policy is to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances where a particular employee works. Upon request we will provide you with more information about such accommodations.



Please review our Privacy Policy, including our CCPA policy, at id.me/privacy. If you provide ID.me with any personally identifiable information you confirm that you have read and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions set out in our Privacy Policy.



ID.me participates in E-Verify.

title: Director, Project Management Office (PMO)
description:
At USGBC, our vision is that buildings and communities will regenerate and sustain the health and vitality of all life within a generation. Our mission is to transform how buildings and communities are designed, built, and operated, enabling an environmentally and socially responsible, healthy, and prosperous environment that improves the quality of life. We're committed to transforming our built environment through LEED, the world’s most preeminent green building system. Today there are more than 105,000 LEED certified buildings in nearly 190 countries.

  

USGBC is a leading global not-for-profit organization. We are seeking a dynamic and experienced PMO Director that will oversee all organization-wide project and initiatives. This role will grow and lead a team of experienced Project Managers, while reporting directly to the COO.

  

This role is eligible to work remotely within the United States.

  

As the **Project Management Office (PMO) Director at USGBC**, you will play a pivotal role in driving the success of our technology and business projects, ensuring alignment with our mission and objectives. You will lead a team of dedicated Project Managers and collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to deliver impactful projects that advance our cause on a global scale.

 **Specific Responsibilities:**

* **Strategic Leadership:** Develop and execute a strategic vision for the Project Management Office in alignment with the organization's mission and goals.
* **Portfolio Management:** Manage a diverse portfolio of technology and business projects, ensuring prioritization, resource allocation, and successful execution.
* **Team Leadership:** Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of project managers, providing guidance and fostering a culture of excellence and collaboration.
* **Stakeholder Engagement:** Collaborate with key stakeholders, including senior leadership, to ensure project needs are understood, gain support, and successfully implemented.
* **Project Governance:** Enforce project governance standards, methodologies, and best practices across the organization.
* **Risk Management:** Identify and mitigate risks, issues, and dependencies across the project portfolio to ensure project delivery within scope, budget, and timeline.
* **Performance Monitoring:** Implement metrics and KPIs to monitor project performance and ensure continuous improvement.
* **Resource Management:** Optimize resource allocation and utilization to maximize project efficiency and effectiveness.
* **Budget Oversight:** Manage and track the PMO budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness and responsible financial management.
* **Reporting and Communication:** Provide regular updates and reports to senior leadership and stakeholders on the status and progress of projects.
* **Change Management Expertise:** Lead teams through organizational changes that may accompany project implementations.

 **Education & Experience Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in a related field (Master's preferred)
* 10+ years of proven experience in a leadership role within a PMO, ideally in a not-for-profit or global organization
* Strong understanding and management of project management methodologies (e.g., PMI, Agile, Lean Six Sigma, etc.)
* Exceptional leadership and team-building skills with the ability to inspire, motivate, and develop high-performing teams
* Displays excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal abilities with both internal resources and outsourced service providers
* Track record of successfully managing a diverse portfolio of projects
* Budget management experience
* Commitment and sincere interest to the organization's mission and values
* Proficiency in change management principles
* Experience working on projects in diverse cultural and geographical settings, demonstrating adaptability and sensitivity to global nuances
* Strong familiarity with emerging technologies and trends relevant to the not-for-profit sector, ensuring projects leverage cutting-edge solutions
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques to make data-driven decisions and optimize project outcomes
* Possession of relevant certifications such as PMP (Project Management Professional), PgMP (Program Management Professional), or PMI-ACP (PMI Agile Certified Practitioner)
* Experience in strategic planning and the ability to align project objectives with the organization's long-term strategic vision
* Strong adaptability to changing priorities, business needs, and technological advancements in the ESG IT landscape

 **Benefits:**


Employees work for an established mission-based and member-driven nonprofit organization with a compelling vision, nonprofit competitive compensation that includes 401k matching, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive health insurance, employer sponsored Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) and pre-tax Flexible Spending Account (FSA), generous paid leave, in addition to a renewal leave of six weeks for employees celebrating monumental employment anniversary.

  

The headquarters office is a LEED Platinum commercial interior space in a LEED certified building in the LEED Platinum certified central business district in the first LEED Platinum certified city, Washington, DC. The office serves as an example for green design and construction products and practices. It is close to public transportation and incorporates many healthy and environmentally friendly features, including an on-site gym, rooftop lounge and healthy snacks for staff.

title: CSS Head of Incident Management
description:
Overview:
### **Working at Atlassian**


Atlassians have flexibility in where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company**.**


With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role located anywhere in the **United States or Canada**. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly recruitment team further.

### **About the Role**


At Atlassian, the mission of the Customer Support Services (CSS) department is to provide world class, legendary support to meet the needs and exceed the expectations of our customers.


We are excited to create a new Incident Management team within our CSS department. This dedicated global team will be responsible for minimizing the impact of incidents to customers, communicating (internally and externally) resolution updates, and working with engineering to reduce the occurrence of incidents.


We are looking for a **CSS** **Head of Incident Management** to spearhead and lead this new Incident Management team and partner closely with the Atlassian Incident Management team. Reporting to the Head of CSS Cloud SMB, you’ll have the opportunity to build a new team from ground up and define the 3-year roadmap, operating structure, and governance model. In this position, you’ll provide thought-leadership, implement the framework and processes to achieve objectives, and expand our proficiency and capabilities within incident management.


A strong sense of urgency and exceptional problem-solving skills are essential in this role, as you will be responsible for promptly and effectively resolving critical incidents. The ideal candidate will possess an unwavering drive for results, excellent communication, and the ability to demonstrate gravitas in challenging situations.


**Compensation**


At Atlassian, we strive to design equitable, explainable, and competitive compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Base pay within the range is ultimately determined by a candidate's skills, expertise, or experience. In the United States, we have three geographic pay zones. For this role, our current base pay ranges for new hires in each zone are:


Zone A: $193,500 - $258,000


Zone B: $174,100 - $232,200


Zone C: $160,600 - $214,100


This role may also be eligible for benefits, bonuses, commissions, and equity.


Please visit go.atlassian.com/payzones for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.


Responsibilities:
* Create a long term vision and 3-year strategic roadmap for the CSS incident management team
* Build and lead a high performing CSS incident management team; develop the team’s operating model and structure
* Have end-to-end ownership and accountability of CSS incident management, be the single point of contact for CSS, for everything related to incidents
* Develop best-in-class standards and implement incident management motions (processes, procedures, runbooks and frameworks)
* Lead the incident management process by representing CSS in war rooms, providing expertise, influencing decisions, and staying aware and well-versed on status/resolution plans
* Manage communication and status updates with internal stakeholders and customers, during major incidents
* Enable the swift resolution of incidents, minimize downtime, and implement preventive measures to mitigate future issues
* Drive and facilitate resolution via Zoom and Slack as an incident commander with excellent executive presence, communications, collaboration skills
* Collaborate and align with Leaders across Engineering, Sales, Corporate Comms, and Legal to accelerate incident resolution, remove blockers, and provide a high level of service to our customers
* Actively engage with cross functional teams to ensure Root Cause Analysis (RCAs) and Post Incident Review (PIRs) are complete, review remediation plans to identify areas for improvement, and socialize findings/insights
* Thrive under pressure with the ability to stay calm, handle conflict, and partner with the global Atlassian Incident Management team
* Coach managers and individual contributors in their professional development and serve as a role model
* Develop and monitor key metrics to understand incident trends, as well as operational resilience and readiness
* Develop and present MBR and QBR read-outs to CSS Leadership


Qualifications:

On your first day, we'll expect you to have the following:

* 5+ years experience leading a global 24x7 incident management team in an enterprise SaaS environment
* 15+ years of technical experience (Support, Services, IT, Engineering) at a tech company with exposure working with complex customer base
* Subject matter expertise in incident management frameworks; awareness of industry standards and best practices
* Demonstrate outstanding problem-solving and decision-making skills to identify root causes and implement corrective actions
* Clear and concise communication skills at the C-Level (written and verbal)
* Technically literate and able to articulate technical issues in a meaningful way to both engineers and executive-level management
* Ability to collaborate, build credibility, and establish good working relationships with leaders across Atlassian to ensure solid partnership and alignment
* Excellent project management skills, with an ability to influence
* Customer-centric attitude and focus on providing best-in-class service for customers
* Resilient and adaptable to changing circumstances

title: IT Retail Program Director
description:
VISEO works to simulate new ideas, offers, ways of collaborating, and methods for producing or selling. With 2500 team members working on four continents and a turnover of more than 265 million dollars, VISEO offers an alternative for integrators, agencies, and consulting firms by providing a unique, flexible, innovative, and structured approach. Our Digital Retail entity aims to help our customers in their POS, Omnichannel, and e-commerce projects (rollout, new implementation, or support on new and existing applications). To strengthen the activities of our team, we are looking for a program director to work with our clients and contribute to the development of our POS practice.


Your missions


You will work on the point of Sale (POS) management solutions, which are fully developed as part of the growth of connected digital commerce. In addition to the historical services of these solutions (sales management, stock, and in-store collection functions), they are evolving to integrate, for example:

* Digitalization of the point of sale (clienteling, cataloging, mobility)
* Omnichannel sales experiences (e-reservation, click & collect, etc.)
* Unified inventory management

As Program Director, you are responsible for our strategic retail projects. In this sense, you oversee the following:


* The strategic scoping (definition of priority axes, analysis, and management of costing)
* Accompanying the client in the expression and analysis of their needs
* Analysis and auditing of retail processes
* Managing retail solution implementation projects (ensuring project governance and coordination, monitoring project planning and costs, managing risks)
* Supervision of consultant teams and coordinated the various actors involved in the projects
* Managing customer relations and customer satisfaction

You are a crucial element of the Retail practice and contribute to its development, whether in the pre-sales, offer construction and delivery phases, or in the recruitment and development of teams.


Your profile

* A graduate of an engineering or business school, you must have a minimum of 6 years of experience in managing retail projects and supervising teams.
* You have an in-depth knowledge of the retail world and cash management/point-of-sale solutions.
* You have a successful experience on one of the POS solutions of the market (Cegid CBR/Y2, Oracle, Diebold, Openbravo, Toshiba, NCR, ...).
* You know how to manage several projects in parallel, and you have worked in demanding contexts regarding quality.
* You have excellent interpersonal skills and a keen sense of communication and are responsible for the smooth running of the project.
* You are comfortable working in international environments.
